At first I already knew that the movie would be phenomenal because it's directed by Christopher Nolan but my God did the movie exceed my expectations, especially in the cinematography, sound effects, and the direction that the directors had from the movie, and seeing how Cillian Murphy impersonated Robert Oppenheimer in the best way an actor should be. And I had a lot of fun experiencing this movie, especially in IMAX thank you Christopher Nolan for this masterpiece. I know I'm not a movie critic or anything but if you enjoy movies and love the cinemas, I highly recommend Oppenheimer.

Review_Title: Floccinaucinihilipilification, of little or no value
Review: After the film ended at the expensive IMAX theater, I heard the twenty-something boys beside me talking about the black piece of clothing that was well grafted on an apparently nude actress. The boys on the other side, a few years younger were wondering why Oppenheimer has never been in their syllabus. Down the steps, an outspoken man was showing off his readings on the life and times of the 'actual' Oppenheimer. A new couple were still sitting, and giggling, picking up from the same giant tub of unfinished popcorns. A lady in a crop top was busy disciplining her two children, both under ten who were probably bored with the verbosity without much 'action' in the film.

Storyline is quite good. Compared to the films of Christopher Nolan in this movie the coordination, vividity and balance of music/bgm was greatly done. The whole movie from start to end has bgm, only 2min after the scene of bomb there is silence. The time period is shown with minute details. Transition of black and white scenes is a great way to show two scenarios at a time. Scenes and there cuts are wonderfully taken. You will not feel any abrupt shot or moment. Not a single scene is wasted to elongate the movie. Overall the acting of each actor was exceptional especially the protagonist himself 'Cillian Murphy'.

The first half has very strong buildup to the big explosion, but the delivery is severely lacking. Just search images of 'nuclear explosion milliseconds' and see what wicked visuals and dramatics were possible. Instead, you could set a can of gasoline on fire, scale it up a bit and you'd get the same result as in the movie.

Many people have mentioned some shortcomings such as no mention of the Trinity downwind sufferers who got cancer from this, no showing of The local workers involved they don't even appear on the screen, it's all white faces, and of course no perspective of the Japanese who were slaughtered innocent people who were slaughtered, Oppenheimer was no hero!, for what it's worth I'm sure it has been demonstrated clearly that the bombs didn't have to be dropped despite all those who say it ended the war the war had already really ended, look it up!, don't just read the history of the victors, also the story jumps around way too much, it's like who's who of atomic energy and quantum physics but so what, a snoozefest to be sure, why all the hoodoo?

I absolutely adore Chris Nolan. However, last film of him just disappointed me for sure. But with this movie , Chris Nolan just made his own artistic masterpiece. In my opinion, this is the most artistic movie of Chris Nolan. The way he picturised the guilt of Oppenheimer is just blown my mind. The scene where Oppenheimer gives his speech against his guilt just proved Chris Nolan knows how to use his artistic inspect to show the horror of scene without showing the consequences that happens in real world. The emotions of the movies is also very beautiful and emotional,making the movie as an arthouse film.

I had an awesome time watching Oppenheimer. It had me gripped the entire length of the movie. I felt like the three hours flew by. Cillian Murphy's performance was incredible. His look captured the intelligence of Oppenheimer and his eyes also communicated the haunted feeling that the story expressed in the creation of the atom bomb. Yet there was also a commitment to the job, too. Murphy held these contrasts well. Wonderful acting. The supporting cast was great as well. I especially appreciated Robert Downey Jr.'s performance as Strauss.

The story behind this movie is pretty boring. Then you whatch and see a great script, a stunning direction, incredible cast, amazing soundtrack transforming a boring story in a great, breathtaking, thrilling 3 hours movie.

A star studded cast, an excellent background score and a creative director. All combined in a movie that had me engaged till the end as the plot became more and more intense as time progresses, 3 hours passed very quickly. Definitely recommended for people who love biopics. Most importantly, you need to feel the movie not understand it as Nolan said. The colour scheme was so very perfect, the attention to detail was also pretty eye catching. Ludwig Gorannsen did an excellent job with he background scores. Overall, nothing short of an exciting experience. Finally I'll end it with this quote "Now I am become death, the destroyer of worlds" - J. Robert Oppenheimer.

I really liked Oppenheimer. But! I was kinda disappointed by the atomic bomb scene because i thought it would be more impressive! He should have actually made it more like a real nuke, that's what i think.... . . . . . . . . . . .. . .. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .. . .. . .. . .. . . .. . . . . . .. .. . . . . . . . .. . . . . .. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .. . . . .. .. . . .. . . .. . .. .. . . . . . .. . .. . . . . . . . .. . .. .. . . . .. . . . . . . .. . . . .. . . . . . . . .. . . . . . . . . . . .. .. . .. . . . .. .. .. . . . . . .. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ..

Oppenheimer was a perfect redemption from Tenet. Murphy performance was masterful. The differentiation between of the black and white and color scenes added tremendous depth to the film. Consciously can say this was the quickest 3 hour movie I have ever watched; no scene felt like it dragged on for too long. There were some quirky dialogue lines throughout the film, but were easily washed out by the sheer beauty of the cinematography and performances by the rest of the characters. Nolan is a known physics lover, which is again evident through this film, but at no point was the viewer ever concerned that they would not understand what was being discussed by the scientists. 10/10. Nolan does it again.

I used to love Nolan movies, but I was very disappointed in Tenet and the movies he made afterwards. I had great expectations for Oppenheimer, but except for the Trinity test scene, none of the scenes impressed me. They even bored me.

Review_Title: History was made by the explosion.
Review: I don't like Christopher Nolan's Dunkirk. I think he always makes Sci-fi type cinema. And he's great at it really. But when I heard about Oppenheimer I thought that Nolan can manage to make it great. Because life of the father of atomic weapon is a real sci-fi. And I was right! If you think that 3 hours long historical talking movie is boring, then go and watch the Oppenheimer. This movie has great cast, intense action, and interesting plot. I mean I know many people who hate history but they genuinely like this movie. I think it's great in times like ours movies about atomic weapons should be shown everywhere. As a historian I want to shake Nolan's hand. Since i'm sure he made people enjoy history. 10 out of 10.

Review_Title: Haunting, Fantastic Biopic Masterpiece With a Tragic Theme
Review: Acting, editing, writing, pacing, and character study are all top notch, and when the final scene arrived, it solidified its' status as one of the greatest biopics of all time.

What's wonderful about art and movies is that it's subjective... I couldn't wait to leave the theater... I just wasn't feeling this movie and I'm sure I'm the one percent... I find Christopher Nolan hit or miss... After you read about the history of Oppenheimer and the atomic bomb, it's a very sad history what followed the Manhattan project for the local people; tragic. Look it up...

Review_Title: Exceptional, Incredible, Mature and Somewhat Depressing
Review: I walked into Oppenheimer expecting something incredible, and that is what I got. Oppenheimer is truly Christopher Nolan at his best in terms of script writing, directing and film making. The score, the cinematography, everything about this film is fantastic. Some may find the 3 hour runtime a bit daunting but it doesn't feel like 3 hours at all! The performances from all the cast are amazing and they make the characters truly believable, but Cillian Murphy shines the brightest as he finally gets the lead role in a Nolan Film. His performance is worthy of an Oscar Nomination if not a win. This film is a 100% go see! Watch it in IMAX, it's an incredible experience. However, if you don't like dialogue driven movies then this might not be for you, but I would still recommend you see this work of art. It is a mature story with some sex scenes but if you're 14, mature 13 I would say it's fine.
For me, maybe, the best biographical film of all times.

It's hard to articulate all the thoughts, but y'all remember when we used to be kids and watched Batman and lived the character for a few days? Cillian Murphy had a similar impact on me. Ludwig Göransson's score was perfect and will not let you miss Hans Zimmer. Screenwriting is something Christopher Nolan has mastered since Memento. Can we call Oppenheimer Nolan's best work? I'd say no! But this will be considered a film that is unique from the other films he has made. Can we call it Cillian Murphy's best role? A big yes! Because of the superhero movies, we often forget how great an actor Robert Downey is. As Lewis Strauss, he blew everyone's mind! Magnificent actors, Incredible storytelling and Engaging music. A simple 8/10. The only complaint is the run time. I felt like 15 mins from the court room drama can be trimmed.

Excellent movie ! There's some astonishing execution of the views and the things and the acting was top class .... These kinda movies are really rare and worth watching ... The roles were perfectly presented and executed and every detail was looked over precisely.. I mean I have seen people making some funny reels and memes on it as they couldn't understand but honestly I couldn't connect more and be indulged in it and it needs patience and focus to feel it ... so it wasn't meant for the ones looking for fun or casual enjoyment but it was meant for the actual good contented watchers . I would recommend people to look for themselves and not be influenced by the reels and memes people are making !

I left the theatre in awe of this film. The story is so compelling and expressed the duality of creating a weapon that can save and destroy masterfully. The performances are sublime, Cillian Murphy will rightfully collect plaudits from everyone for a stunning performance as the titular character but RDJ and notably Emily Blunt deliver some breathtaking performances that I am amazed by.

Stereotypical Barbie ("Barbie") and a wide range of fellow Barbies all reside in Barbieland, a matriarchal society where all women are self-confident, self-sufficient, and successful. While their Ken counterparts spend their days engaging in recreational activities at the beach, the Barbies hold all important job positions such as doctors, lawyers, and politicians. Beach Ken ("Ken") is only happy when he is with Barbie and seeks a closer relationship, but Barbie rebuffs him in favor of independence and female friendships.

Literally a three-hour documentary! The pace was quite good till the end of the Trinity test, which was shocking and exciting! However, the rest part I think it was just redundant! (Also because I almost can't hold up my pee so I can't really enjoy the latter half) Maybe Nolan thinks the later part was just echoing the right beginning, with due respect, I don't think so, to me it's just another hour's torture cause the rest of the plot is no longer hooking me and makes the ending chaotic. Yes, as the atoms and neutrons in an A-bomb would be, the 'great' Nolan adds his pacifist, anti-nuke ideology ingredients till he's done. I'm done, too.

You'll have to have your wits about you and your brain fully switched on watching Oppenheimer as it could easily get away from a nonattentive viewer. This is intelligent filmmaking which shows it's audience great respect. It fires dialogue packed with information at a relentless pace and jumps to very different times in Oppenheimer's life continuously through it's 3 hour runtime. There are visual clues to guide the viewer through these times but again you'll have to get to grips with these quite quickly. This relentlessness helps to express the urgency with which the US attacked it's chase for the atomic bomb before Germany could do the same. An absolute career best performance from (the consistenly brilliant) Cillian Murphy anchors the film. This is a nailed on Oscar performance. In fact the whole cast are fantastic (apart maybe for the sometimes overwrought Emily Blunt performance). RDJ is also particularly brilliant in a return to proper acting after his decade or so of calling it in. The screenplay is dense and layered (I'd say it was a thick as a Bible), cinematography is quite stark and spare for the most part but imbued with rich, lucious colour in moments (especially scenes with Florence Pugh), the score is beautiful at times but mostly anxious and oppressive, adding to the relentless pacing. The 3 hour runtime flies by. All in all I found it an intense, taxing but highly rewarding watch. This is film making at it finest. A really great watch.

I've been a HUGE Christopher Nolan fan. Every movie he's made, Momento through Interstellar, I've loved. Flawed maybe, but loved them nonetheless. Movies that not only wow'ed me as a technical achievement, but moved me emotionally too. But lately...Nolan's films have taken a different trend. Stories that were once a perfect ratio of spectacle, plot, human drama and fascinating character work, have now been replaced with spectacle & plot-driven pieces devoid of character and heart.

Review_Title: Three hours waiting to see the explosion that never shown
Review: People giving a good review for this movie are just giving it because they love Nolan..

Review_Title: Cinematic Masterpiece that will stand the test of time
Review: Sincerely lost for words after Oppenheimer. Murphy, Damon, Blunt, Pugh, Oldman and absolutely every one else (literally everyone, be it 10 seconds screen time or 3 hours) at their absolute finest. You are captivated for every single second and feel like the film is only 1.5hrs long. I couldnt genuinely watched another hour. You're held on by every word.
**Oppenheimer: A Captivating Portrait of a Complex Genius**

I might get hate for this but this movie is better then Barbie. It's a masterpiece everything about this movie was good the timing the pacing everything including the acting . My heart was pounding and I loved every second of it holy this was good. Form when it begins to how it ends it explores openhimer before the Manhattan project and then to after the war it's incredible Christopher Nolan deserves every single award they get for this movie bravo. Christopher Nolan take a bow and take in what you created and enjoy our beak I hope to see another masterpiece set in ww2 I can't wait for it bravo !

During the Cuban missile crisis, the crew onboard B-59, one of the four Foxtrot-class Soviet submarines sent to waters around Cuba, had been out of contact with Moscow for days. Infrequently picking up civilian radio transmissions, the nuclear-armed submarine was too deep to be in sync with the outside world, to know if war had already been broke out, as it's been busy hiding from American naval pursuers. Captain Savitsky and the Political Officer Maslennikov, risking the chance that a war had already begun, decided to launch a nuclear torpedo, the authorization of which normally requires only the confirmations from the two officers. The launch, according to military estimates, would have caused a chain reaction, resulting in a thermonuclear conflict destroying the better parts of the northern hemisphere. With reputations preceding him, Executive Officer Vasily Arkhipov utilized the special circumstance requiring the confirmations of all three officers, objected to the launch, preventing the onset of nuclear war. Roughly 20 years later, a similar fate was averted when officer Stanislav Petrov at the command center of the Soviet early warning system Oko decided that the multiple reports of intercontinental ballistic missile launch were false alarms, disobeying military protocols requiring him to relay the alarms up the chain of command (at the likely cost of his entire life and career), otherwise leading to a retaliatory attack with unimaginable consequences.

Review_Title: Great movie by Nolan was a fast at moments but its okay. if people don't like this movie stay away from such people.
Review: Great movie by nolan man i was not ready for this movie shows the side of oppenhimer and other Scientists as well the mental problems of Scientist facing the idea what they created and political point of view on the matter. Just great movie. So much thing in 3 hours. END of THE MOVIE WILL BLOW YOUR MIND.

I'll start off by saying I was a little disappointed. But only because my expectations were 10/10 high. I had no issues with the performances, cinematography, pacing, music or length. In fact, those were all near perfect.

Despite the anticipation surrounding Christopher Nolan's latest work, the film might not meet all expectations. The grandiosity of the movie, driven partly by Nolan's stellar reputation and the extensive marketing, creates a halo effect that might be misleading.

Review_Title: Great Story, Brilliant Acting, Phenomenal Experience
Review: Despite the 3 hour runtime, it's able to keep audiences entertained and on the edge of their seats throughout the film between the organic dialouge of perfectly cast characters and the build up of the intense scenes. A complex and intriguing story of brilliance, deception, human will, and an urgency to force progress. Just when I thought they couldn't top the test bomb scene they executed the stadium scene absolutely perfectly by keeping you guessing between silence and the crowd cheers until... explosion. An immersable experience where you are contemplating both the scenes from the movie and your own morals by the end of the film.

Don't get me wrong, I don't think the film is pointless. I came away with a better understanding of Oppie than when I went in, but was that it? There was no context. Why were the Americans so concerned about Communism? Perhaps because the USSR had control of Eastern Europe? Or was supporting Mao in China? Or was pushing their ideology in South America? And what about Japan? Poor Oppie had to deal with the guilt, meanwhile in Japan 10,000s were living with radiation sickness. Was the second bomb justified? Oppie seemed happy enough with the spurious argument that it had to be done to show they had more than one bomb?

Review_Title: Arguably Christopher Nolan worst project to date
Review: What a drag! Jesus. Three hours, really? I almost fell asleep two times during its span, my partner shook me up. Long, long, long, just boring. Goodness me, just how boring it is. If it was cut by half, it wouldn't be short enough even then. I understand the need of character development, but this? A horrible waste of time by moaning, whimpering and regret forever. Those feelings were there for sure, you just shouldn't watch them for three hours as an entertainment. The story is sublime of course, but the screenplay is bad and so is the execution. This movie, with all the hype around it, is a big let down. I am severely disappointed.

One of the best movies of all time. To start, Christopher Nolan did a phenomenal job at forming the movie and how he revealed certain secrets. He spent lots of time developing Oppenheimer and just the right amount with other characters such as Lewis Strauss. The cinematography was on a whole different level. Definitely Oscar worthy. Different colorings for different time periods was a very smart choice, and it helped me understand the movie a lot better. During a scene with yelling, the contrast got a lot brighter like a bomb detonating;). You can also see objects shaking in the background the louder it gets. The acting by everybody, even a character who was in one scene storming out of a room, was amazing. Cillian Murphy was the perfect casting choice for a character like Oppenheimer. He conveyed the emotions extremely well and is definitely deserving of at least an Oscar nomination. Nolan really outdid himself and all the hype paid off. I have one slight criticism and that is that there was a very brief period of time near the beginning of the movie that seemed to move a little bit fast but since the movie was 3 hours, it didn't bother me very much. All in all, movie of the year, decade, and maybe even century. Don't believe me? Go watch it and you're sure to be speechless as soon as the credits roll.

The best movie from Nolan every day it is very slow no action full lag but we need to know that this movie is about a scientist who first created a atomic bomb so to tell about how Robert Oppenheimer made that atomic bomb and how many difficulties he faced in making it and after making it Nolan did an absolute fantastic way of telling the story amazing plot and this is the main reason it is slow to make sure everyone understands j.robert Oppenheimer story but if it would have amazing dubbing for different countries it would be more successful that is little dissapointing but however Nolan story way of expression and directing way every one can understand his depth of excellence work simply the most greatest movie ever made absolute masterpiece
How can one describe something that opens up your mind, challenges things you've read and known and make you appreciate the genius of actors and their art? Nolan does a fine job at all of it.

Review_Title: A competent Biopic that doesn't rival Nolan's best work: reviewing in IMAX 1.42:1 70mm
Review: This isn't a film about the creation of the Atom bomb: this is a biopic meant to exonerate Oppenheimer. But let's be honest: Robert J Oppenheimer is not exactly the star of his own life at this point; in the same way that Dr Frankenstein now shares the name with his monster, the Oppenheimer we know is: Father of the Atomic bomb. That is his enduring legacy. Until now.

While I regret missing my history class, this movie proved to be an excellent substitute, bringing the history of the Atomic bomb to life with engaging storytelling and powerful performances. It highlighted the complexities and moral dilemmas faced by Oppenheimer and the team, making it a thought-provoking experience. As a software engineer, the film reminded me of the significance of innovation and the responsibility that comes with te
In conclusion, the movie based on J. Robert Oppenheimer was a remarkable cinematic journey. It not only satisfied my curiosity about the history of the Atomic bomb but also resonated with my interests in science and technology. The film's meticulous attention to detail and accurate portrayal of historical events made it an educational and emotionally compelling watch. Whether one is a history enthusiast or a technology professional like myself, this movie offers an enriching experience that leaves a lasting impact.

Review_Title: Best movie I've seen in a long time
Review: This movie is truly a work of art. The frames, the expressions, the actors, the scenery, everything. I cannot put my finger on one particular point that made it great, because the movie in whole is great. I know everyone says it is, but that is because it genuinly is!

Review_Title: Effects of global impact of Manhattan Project not capitalized on
Review: Nolan's signature visual style was overshadowed by the excessive use of confusing time jumps that seemed more like a gimmick than a well-thought-out storytelling tool. The attempt to blend historical events I with a fictional narrative felt forced and disorienting, leaving me detached from the supposed emotional impact of the story.

Review_Title: Coukd not take my eyes off the screen
Review: This was an experience! 3 hour long film that I was not only able to sit through, but was afraid to take my eyes off the screen anxious not to miss even the smaller twitch in the amazing performances. This is a movie completely carried by the actors, the perfiormances are insanely good. The importance of silence is crucial, and it made the film so much more impactful in the short moments of utter silence, there wasn't even breathing in the cinema.

I wanna start this review by warning you: the movie is long; there are long scenes of silence, contemplation and instrospection. A person who's not used to watching slow movies can still enjoy it, but there are plenty of senes that added very little and coulda been trimmed to make the movie shorter and more emphatic.

I watched this film. I went to see this film considering it as a film made on science fiction and scientific community, but in this 3-hour film, the story went on for only 15 to 20 minutes, after that there was a heated debate about American communist politics in closed rooms.

The music for this movie is the best I have ever seen in a movie before. The build up of the explosion of the bomb with the music connected with it made nervous for it. Even though I already knew the outcome, that the bomb was going to go off. The music was what stood out to me the most for being breathtaking. But everything about this movie was great. To the film writing, to the great room of actors that were in this film. The acting was on point. I personally thought the pacing was very good. When a 3 hour movie feels like an hour an a half long so thing is done right. I was hooked with every part of this movie, with having no boring parts in the film. With the show being mostly dialogue, it really says a lot. Amazing work by Nolan as usual.

Review_Title: One of the most significant movies ever made.
Review: One of the most significant movies ever made.

Nolan's 'Oppenheimer' is a gripping masterpiece that delves into J. Robert Oppenheimer's life, brilliantly. The film navigates his genius, moral dilemmas, and the making of the atomic bomb. Nolan's direction, creates an engrossing narrative that lingers long after the credits roll. I can clearly say this is a piece of art with its multi-dimensional narrative style and engrossing concept. A thought-provoking exploration of the consequences of scientific advancements and the complexities of human ambition. The film's thought-provoking exploration of the consequences of scientific advancements forces the audience to ponder the moral implications of innovation in warfare and the enduring impact on humanity. As the story unfolds, the weight of Oppenheimer's choices resonates deeply, leaving viewers contemplating the responsibility that comes with knowledge and power.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer A Visually Stunning and Thought-Provoking Biopic Cillian Murphy Gives a Tour-de-Force
Review: Oppenheimer is a biographical drama film about J. Robert Oppenheimer, the scientist who led the Manhattan Project to develop the atomic bomb. The film explores Oppenheimer's moral dilemma as he grapples with the implications of his work and the potential for nuclear destruction.

Review_Title: Brilliant acting in a deeply absorbing story of J.R. Oppenheimer
Review: This is a great film in all respects whether acting, cinematography, or music. It's a slow burn though and builds up to a crescendo till the main event --the A bomb explosion.

The movie was great, the theme of stars, space, and light inside Oppenheimer's head with music in every scene at the start and through the movie was perfect, at first, young Oppenheimer was amazing, and really interesting to know at the beginning, however I would prefer to keep the story in chronological order, not jumping from young Oppenheimer to the older one, and showing suddenly scenes at different time and place, I am not a writer or director, and I know that the story is very long to reach the plot, but it will be really great if the build up was slower at first, starting from young to old, and then things get exciting, there are some scenes that can be avoided, and the questioning process took very long at the last quarter of the film, maybe instead showing the atomic bomb explosion in japan beside the experimental explosion would be awesome, and more screentime for Einstein!

I kinda like this movie ehh... or (maybe not) btw it's not that interesting i thought would it be that movie disappoints me big time. Too much talk going on this one and the "showstopper" trinity test is Disappointed me as well wtf. That scene supposed to entertained us but it did nothing it lacks the wow factor. Overall in historical/biographical view of point this movie maybe hit hit but i think in my opinion who's a big Sci/Fi, Fantasy and Thriller genre fan this movie is too Boring and Overrated. That's the biggest reason i avoided myself to go to watch the biopics or any kind of historical movies in theatres.

I am going to say that this movie is a masterpiece!!! Christopher nolan is a pure genuis for making these kind of movies. When the movie finished i was speechless i didnt talk for fifteen minutes after that i explained how good was this movie. Cillian murphy deserves an oscar. The cast was awesome i literally know everybody in this movie. The bomb scene was amazing first the silence but after the explosion like wow. This movie deserves so many awards. Thanks to christopher nolan for this movie it was one of the greatest movie ive ever seen!!!!

Review_Title: Not a bad movie, but the marketing campaign made me expect a lot more than I saw.
Review: I am a big Christopher Nolan fan and went to see Oppenheimer with great enthusiasm. The marketing campaign presented the movie as something innovative, something you should definitely see on IMAX to get unforgettable emotions, but unfortunately the movie didn't live up to my expectations. The movie is good, not a bad plot, very good performance of actors. But going to the movie by CRISTOPHER NOLAN, you expect more than 3 hours of dialogues to a tense melody and 1-minute scene of the "Test" atomic bomb explosion.

Review_Title: Overhyped and boring, with giant holes in its scenario
Review: This movie was overhyped to the death starting months before the screening. It was hailed as the film who is going to save Hollywood, and humanity.

Review_Title: Truly stunning film carried by Murphy
Review: Oppenheimer is not a film, it's a symphony that we could never before fathom. In my opinion, it is one of the most important films to ever exist. I remember feeling like this regarding a few films, such as this past year's phenomenal all quiet on the western front but this movie is the biggest and scariest true account of what it means to be alive. The deep sadness that overcame me after experiencing this film glued me to my seat. The fact that our supposed holier than thou goverment could inflict so much pain on a single man really broke me.
The best thing I liked about the movie is the character makeup.

Review_Title: Fast paced editing tightly written screenplay. Exciting & Brilliant
Review: The feel the look of the movie takes you to that time that era of history, the fast paced editing of dialogue scenes makes the movie exciting,even though the movie is very much based upon dialogues , conversations but short lenghth of scenes and fast paced editing takes down all the boredom & movie feels very fast. 3 hours long but time flies. Not 10 because of no action but that is understandable as the movie is a biopic. For the biopic genre also the movie feels very intelligent & brilliant, the screenplay is tightly written & the the non linear timeline makes you to give more attention to the screen as you don't want to loose & left behind. Christopher nolan never disappoints.

This is unlike any other movie Nolan has made until now. While going to the theaters, I thought this movie would be about Manhattan project and the psychological effects of the bombings on Robert Oppenheimer, about how he thought he was responsible for the deaths and misery caused by his creation but this movie is much more than that.

Review_Title: Incredibly well written and astonishingly shot
Review: A deep-seated reverence for meticulous cinematic production design results in a dazzling world class performance of Christopher Nolan's staggering achievements in this historical biopic masterpiece, which features the philosophical atomic concepts of American theoretical physicist, J. Robert Oppenheimer.

Review_Title: Great minds are immortal after all
Review: I hold this movie in high regard and show much respect for Nolan's decisions and choices in this movie. The genius director made some important choices to move the plot forward. This movie had so much scientific and political information, dialogue, and script; it was a lengthy story and movie, but Nolan made it one great cinematic piece. Every scene and dialogue was well thought out. Some might say that the sound was overpowering the dialogue at some points, but I trust Nolan's decisions because he has shown himself to be an expert. I like his taste.

This movie was HUGE on dialog and nowhere near enough real action. Probably afraid to hurt anyone's feelings. The layer of music over top of the voice track was too much and made for too many missed words. All along I kept wishing for closed captioning so I could follow the story. For a 3 hour movie I completely expected more action. Sound decibel level was impressively loud. I expect some cinema grade loudspeakers got blown and probably startled a few Barbie movie goers in the theater next door. Time will tell if this was a hit. Might catch more streaming views so we can follow all the spoken words.

Review_Title: Not for everyone, still a masterclass in film
Review: My expectation for Oppenheimer was far different than the product that was delivered. I've been looking forward to this movie since July 2022, but I; intentionally; did not read or watch any media about the film. I read the book 'The General and the Genius' some years back (the film is based on American Prometheus), so my expectation was that the film would center around the relationship between Oppenheimer and Groves. That was not the case. Instead we get a deep dive into the man that was J. Robert Oppenheimer. This alone lends itself to a more abstract storyline, with which some may find it hard to follow.

Review_Title: A beautiful looking but very long documentary
Review: It was ok... I learnt some history, however, with the hype and Nolan I expected more. This movie felt lacking in cinematic creativity. The scenes of Oppenheimer experiencing internal turmoil whilst holding a tough exterior were great. I really liked the editing and effects during this speech scene and was wanting much more of it. I also hoped for more from the sound design throughout. It had beautiful cinematography as expected and the story is interesting enough but I don't think it will be a rewatch. It definitely didn't blow me away.

Knowing Nolan's skills, I expected an excellent film firmly grounded in history. Unfortunately, this film watches like a transcript of conversations on Teams. It's boring, overdone and chaotic. The timelines intertwine so that you can't figure out what times you are watching. We watch characters talk to each other and discuss what others have said. Oppenheimer himself has been made into a slightly crazy type who basically doesn't know why he is working on the atomic bomb. I still don't know what his motivation was, it was so hard to tell from the acting. Well, that's right, the acting. With so many excellent actors, Nolan gives us such flat and poorly drawn characters. Oppenheimer's wives, in particular, look like characters artificially glued to the plot. They might as well not have been there and the film would have lost nothing and gained nothing. Unfortunately, I will not recommend this film. It is probably the worst Nolan film I have seen.

This is one of those movies that makes you want to learn more. Not only was the story told with such vivid images without showing any. The acting is emotionally complex and layered. The sound track was amazing. The use of silence was amazing. Loved everything about this movie and plan to watch again and again.

Review_Title: Could had been a masterpiece if focus was on interesting science & psychology and not trivial trials.
Review: Movie was fine. I was expecting more physics and engineering and excitement of real science and emotional phases of Oppenheimer, suspense before tests, not focus on trivial human trials by dumb politicians. Since its about great geniuses, i cant rate it low. Could have been better!

The story itself was a disappointment for all human beings and spiritual people are living in Japan. But showing them as a hero with people that they destroy countries I don't see the point over here. And mixing it with lots of emotions that went so deep.

Surely it is a film worth-watching! Of course, it's not a documentary so don't go with the hope to know exactly how the atomic bomb was designed, learn about science or quick course in history... US and Russia were fighting together the nazi, finally someone mentioned... Good touch was to say that the bombs allegedly ended the 2WW. For your information, Japan resigned afterwards when Russia was destroyed and invaded their Army in Manchuria.
Greatest filmmaker of his generation has done it again!

Review_Title: The moments after the test in Los Alamos felt like scenes straight out of a horror movie.
Review: Is it a popcorn flick??? Oh hell no. Watch Barbie instead. Is it dense??? Oh yes!!! It's way too big.

Saw Oppenheimer last night! It was a lot to unpack so I'll try to be super direct:
1. The acting! Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey, Jr. And Emily Blunt will ALL get Oscar nominations, and may even win. This was by far Cillian Murphy's best performance, you can tell he dove into this character and really did his best and it shows. Robert Downey Jr. Played his character Lewis Strauss as well as he played Iron Man honestly. Emily Blunt played the extremely rough bitter wife and that was some of her best work I've ever seen her do. Even Matt Damon did great as well.

It is a long movie. Yet, at no moment it felt like it is just uselessly padding its runtime by adding unnecessary details, subplots, etc. Great visual effects, yet the amount of explosions and/ or CGI was kept to minimum, on the characters, instead of "nukes go boom".

Oppenheimer is a film that boasts amazing directing and clean visuals. Cillian Murphy delivers an amazing performance, one that truly deserves an Oscar. The dialogues of the movie are particularly noteworthy.

2 negative things which i felt :
1) Background music is a strong tool to use to increase the impact of a scene. A fast chaotic BGM signifies that a scene or a sequence of scene is moving towards a crescendo.

The film lasts approximately 3 hours, it is more like a Documentary. Where all the problems that arose when creating the Atomic Bomb are analyzed. The performance of Florence Pugh, Robert Downey Jr. And Cillian Murphy, among others. It has no discussion, very good actors. The R rating is for about 3 nudity sex scenes. But outside of that, it's all talk and talk. They are also suspicious of historical data that were previously secret. We hope it will be nominated for an Oscar, even though true stories are almost never awarded. People compare the Barbie Movie with Oppenheimer, when it cannot be like that, since Barbie is all fictional and its rating is PG-13, when Oppenheimer is a true story with an R rating. I recommend it to 95% to see it, it is very good. Go see it!!
Out of all of the films I've seen within the year, this has to be the best. From the brilliant casting to the amazing story, or the overall incredible cinematography, it was phenomenal but long.

Nolan's Oppenheimer (2023) is astonishing as it is confrontational about humanity's folly. Everyone who knows the background of these historical events would be looking forward to how the a-bomb was created, and the explosion. But what I saw the inner turmoil of brilliant mind in the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer / Oppie.

This movie was a master piece ...how well conducted the story line is ..... And sound effects are Just too Awesome to explain ...you will regret missing this movie. This Movie already Have legendary actors but still They performed Thier roles with such Fine acting ...each and every actor showed their every single emotion and They put their heart sweat on this movie and I clearly saw that.... I expected a lot from this movie ..and yeah i.can clearly say... it stands upto my Expectations...WHAT A GREAT MOVIE.... Everyone Should Watch this Master piece ....I am sure you will not regret after watching this movie. THIS MOVIE SURE DESERVES AN OSCAR .. THEY BETTER GIVE THE OSCAR.

I really have no negative thoughts to express about this exceptional movie. I was able to go through the whole thing in the cinema without a single distraction, which is a rare occurrence having in mind the state of the film industry of lately.

Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer film is an absolute cinematic marvel! From start to finish, it takes the audience on an unforgettable journey through the complexities of history and human ambition. Nolan's masterful direction skillfully weaves together a gripping narrative, stunning visuals, and thought-provoking themes.

Review_Title: Stunning cinematography that conveys the reality of truly dark knowledge, but leaves something to be desired
Review: Christopher Nolan per usual produces a great film. The sound design is mesmerizing and shocking, and he depicts the madness, moral turmoil and hypocrisy of a very dangerous, erratic genius extremely well, and with stunning cinematography.

NO SPOILERS: I saw Oppenheimer and I have to say, incredible. I have been a long-time fan of Christopher Nolan going all the way back to the days of Memento & the Following. Nolan has a gift similar to Steven Spielberg of the past, of being able to understand your audience enough to put them in the driver's seat of the main character. This movie has such a great pace and keeps you on the edge of your seat for 3 hours straight. Oppenheimer is a must-see in IMAX! Probably the most amazing aspect of this film is that Nolan achieved the effect of detonating an atomic bomb without the use of CGI. Film making at it's finest. I'd put this film up for BEST PICTURE next to 'Sound of Freedom'. Also, there was VERY little gore or violence, the R rating was mostly for nudity and language, that would turn-on anyone whose into sapiosexuality and the choice of actress totally fed into that as well, my fellow comic geeks will love that Black Widow treat. The whole movie is practically a NERD orgy. SEE IT! And in IMAX don't wait to stream it, you will miss out.

First, you don't have to watch it in imax. So, you can save lots of money. About the movie...Actors are good. Cinematography is good. However, the story is very hard to follow. You need prior knowledge about the politics of post second world war. Otherwise, you'll find yourself asking other who is this, why is he doing this, what does he refer to, etc. I enjoyed watching scientists struggling to make the right decision and materializing the consequences of their actions, but that is it. To summarize, a very overhyped movie. I believe someone will make a movie about oppenheimer in the future because this couldn't deliver.

What's there to say that isn't already on the screen. I knew it was bad 20 minutes in. Begged my companions to leave the showing but we stayed since we already payed. Tenet was a big miss, but wow oh wow. Oppenheimer made Tenet look Oscar worthy. There are no redeeming qualities about this film. The narrative is boring and disinterested in explaining itself to the audience. Bomb scene was whatever. Last half an hour was painful to endure. Christopher Nolan is a great filmmaker. Or should I say was. Last two outings have been terrible. His better days are behind him. I sincerely think he has lost what once made him one of Hollywood's finest filmmakers.
This movie... the values it portrays and the history it has combined with the brilliance of C. Nolan, Van Hoytema and the cast put it into the 'must see' section.

I just watched the most amazing movie ever and I can't wait to share my thoughts with you! It was a masterpiece of storytelling, cinematography, acting, and music. The plot was captivating, the characters were complex and relatable, the visuals were stunning, and the soundtrack was perfect. I was on the edge of my seat the whole time, laughing, crying, and cheering. It was an emotional roller coaster that left me breathless and satisfied. I highly recommend this movie to anyone who loves cinema and wants to experience something unforgettable. It was one of the best movies I've ever seen and I'm sure you'll agree with me once you watch it too!

Review_Title: A true masterpiece - a history lesson that makes you think
Review: This was the first movie that made me think for hours after it ended.

"Oppenheimer" is an absolute masterpiece that captivates and educates its audience on multiple levels. With exceptional direction and an outstanding ensemble cast, it brings to life the complex story of J. Robert Oppenheimer and the creation of the atomic bomb. The film seamlessly blends historical accuracy with powerful storytelling, leaving viewers in awe of the scientific and moral dilemmas faced during that era. Every frame is a visual delight, meticulously crafted to transport us back in time. "Oppenheimer" deserves nothing less than a perfect 10/10 rating for its compelling narrative, exceptional performances, and its thought-provoking exploration of humanity's pursuit of knowledge and its consequences. A must-watch for history enthusiasts, science lovers, and film connoisseurs alike.

Nolan is a director who is holding 10 jugs of water which he pours in all different directions, yet all the water seems to pool in one exact spot no matter what. The movie feels like everything going is leading you to a moment, you can feel it coming, you can feel you are being led to it.
Just got back from seeing Cillian Murphy in, what I believe, is a career best performance.

Review_Title: Seriously, what is the real struggle in Oppenheimer's life?
Review: I'm not an action junkie, i said Schindler's list was good. But i asked once again? What is the real struggle in oppenheimer's life? Because he made the trouble himself. His womanizer behaviour, he makes fun of strauss making strauss framed Him. He's making a bomb that could kill millions of life but then regret doing so?

Oppenheimer: This film was everything I expected it to be. An exploration of the man within a divided scientific community during WW2 in the backdrop of a nuclear arms race between the Axis and Allied powers and then between the US and Russia. But that's only half of the essence of the film, the other half is the politics behind this race which leads to the rise and fall and then rise of Oppenheimer in the corridors of power in America. There is more courtroom drama than science drama. The screenplay and treatment with which the various periods are juxtaposed make it feel like JFK by Oliver Stone, who incidentally was close to making a movie about Oppenheimer.

Why IMAX? Contrary to all of the previous Christopher Nolan films that managed to deliver intelligent stories and visual spectacle at the same time, there is nothing visually spectacular to behold here, yet they are announcing this as the "must see in IMAX experience". The movie is a political drama of people talking in rooms that has too many gratuitous nudity but almost nothing of The BOMB in action, which is what most people expect to watch on the giant screen given its premise and because it's a Christopher Nolan movie after all, the marketing clearly exploits those factors.
What a pretentious waste of 3 hours this movie is. So much talent, wasted.
A film that lives up to the story it tells: an atomic story.

Review_Title: A Masterpiece Nearly Ruined By The Sound
Review: Cillian Murphy is incredible. Robert Downey Jr is as well. The supporting cast is strong. The story is interesting and enlightening. It's a lesson in physics and politics. I can't heap enough accolades on the acting, directing, set design, cinematography, score and production - everything but the sound mixing and editing. It's abysmal. Without this problem the movie is a 10.

"Oppenheimer" (2023) is a biographical thriller, drawing inspiration from the 2005 biography "American Prometheus." The film intricately explores the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, an intellectual and charismatic physicist entrusted with leading the Manhattan Project in Los Alamos, N. M., during World War II to develop the atomic bomb. The narrative centers on Oppenheimer's academic pursuits, his pivotal role in the Manhattan Project, and his eventual demise consequent to a 1954 security hearing. The director adeptly portrays Oppenheimer as a pivotal historical figure, yet poignantly naive, highlighting the profound gravity of the project and its profound repercussions on humanity.

Review_Title: Exceptional biopic about a forgotten man
Review: Tells a brilliant story about one of the most influential people in recent history. The nitty details about Oppenheimer's life are mesmerizing. Everything from his affair which ultimately semi-led to his downfall to how he orchestrated one of the most important scientific breakthroughs of all time captured how this man needs more recognition. This picture paints his story very well with a lot of aspects covered that would not normally be in the limelight. Performances from Murphy and Downey Jr were captivating and gave truth to the history which once was. The cameos we're not unneeded and the practical affects were jaw dropping.

Review_Title: The most intense biopic I've seen
Review: This movie is 3 hours long, and in this time it tries not to be boring for the viewer. The intense shifts of flashbacks and flashforwards are keeping the movie fascinationg to watch. The scenes from Oppenheimer's life and other people related to him is like a puzzle, that is interesting to collide into the whole chronological picture.

Review_Title: The story of nuclear physics meeting politics
Review: Who does not know the name Oppenheimer? Even if you are not interested in physics or the history of war, you come across this name.

Review_Title: Movie about 30 minutes too long! Nolan falling off!
Review: I love a Christopher Nolan film as much as the next fanboy and I was definitely intrigued. I haven't been this excited in a while that I purchased an Imax ticket months ahead of time. A 3 hours film length doesn't frighten me as long as the film flies by which only happens if a movie keeps you engaged the whole time. Unfortunately, I feel it was a little too long and should have ended soon after the atomic bomb was a success and Oppenheimer comes to grips with the powerful self-destruction creation he made. Instead Nolan chose to drone on about Oppenheimer's bureaucratic problems he encounters and beats a dead horse on the moral problems he comes to grip with. I felt it was answered enough in the previous 2.5 hours and I admit I was beginning to clock watch and wondering when it was gonna wrap up. All I can say is that Nolan is indeed the greatest director of this generation but peaked with Interstellar for me which was truly a top 10 film. That movie deserved multiple viewings with a similar runtime but keeps you engaged the whole time. This I feel comes up way short behind his other masterpieces such as Interstellar, Dark Knight, The Prestige, and Inception.

Such a captivating film throughout. Theres a lot of information and dialouge to this film but each scene is short and fast paced, like it resembled the pressure and urgency of their task. The short, fast paced scenes keep you interested and on the edge of your seat as the film builds and builds up to the point of the test. My only critism is the explosion itself, although the sound was okay, it didn't feel as dramatic as there were a lot of loud scenes leading up to the explosion so it felt underwhelming in comparison. I also feel that the visuals of the bomb was slightly underwhelming. However, I believe Nolan didn't want to use any CGI for the explosion so considering it was done with real explosives, it was still impressive. Nolan never fails to suprise me with his films. A must watch.

Review_Title: Decent biography movie, but overrated and overhyped.
Review: To be honest, i watch this movie yesterday at IMAX cinema. But find it disappointing with the bombing scene only "just like that"? I can have better visualization in Discovery Channel or National Geographic or other in Youtube. It is to much exaggerate the Kodak 70mm feature in this movie, while 4/5 of all movie duration wasting on the discussion, court scene, and talking session. I must be honest, what for the IMAX or Kodak 70mm for this movie?

Review_Title: Boring, too long, confusing and too loud.
Review: Boring, too long, confusing and too loud. I was looking forward to this but it's such a mess. How could you make a film about developing the first atom bomb and not only make it so boring but set the bomb off with an hour still to go.

Nolan's greatest weakness as a filmmaker has always been found in the convoluted stories he tells. When he gets lost in parts of it to a level that the story itself gets lost as well (see: Tenet). By the nature of this story, he was already protected from that. With that safety net in place, he soared to wonderful heights. This may well be the best cast he has ever assembled for a film, and they carry it beautifully. It is a deeply troubling film that causes us to look ourselves in the mirror. Is the prize worth the price? This will undoubtedly, and deservedly, garner several Oscar nominations, as it should. This very well could go down as Nolan's greatest film. A wonderful achievement given his catalogue.

Review_Title: OH MY LORD!!!! What a MASTERPIECE!!!!!!
Review: Let me start by saying this. I haven't heard of Oppenheimer before, when I heard the hype about this movie I decided to watch the movie but I wanted to read about this character and understand it. I read and learned some information and the next day I went straight into the theater... and oh Lala what an experience. Even though I watched it on Digital IMAX. The visuals, the sound design, the music, the acting, the storytelling, the feelings, the emotions, and the tension were all top-notch. It couldn't get any better!

A mind-blowing masterpiece of cinema Oppenheimer is not just a movie, it's an experience. Christopher Nolan has outdone himself once again, creating a stunning biopic that explores the life and legacy of one of the most influential scientists of the 20th century. The film is a visual feast, shot in IMAX and 65mm film, with breathtaking cinematography and practical effects. The cast is phenomenal, especially Cillian Murphy, who delivers a career-best performance as the brilliant and tormented J. Robert Oppenheimer. The screenplay is smart, complex, and emotional, weaving together historical facts and artistic liberties in a captivating way. The music by Ludwig Göransson is haunting and powerful, enhancing the mood and tension of every scene. Oppenheimer is a cinematic masterpiece that deserves all the praise and awards it can get. It's a must-see for anyone who loves movies, history, science, or just great storytelling. It's the best film of 2023, and possibly of all time.

Oppenheimer (2023) Review
Movie Runtime 3hrs

Review_Title: A Fiery Fusion of History and Drama!
Review: This movie is quite different from Nolan's usual style. As the title suggests, it primarily focuses on Oppenheimer's life rather than the anticipated nuclear blasts. The highly hyped nuclear blast scene didn't meet the grand expectations, though it did create some tension for a short while.

Review_Title: a striking reality that makes you feel empathy to the fullest
Review:
I watched the movie when it was released. But now I find the strength to comment...
I can say that it is one of the best movies I have seen in my life. Again, Nolan did not surprise and gave people what they needed. Cillian Murphy didn't act for the movie, he almost lived the movie. Murphy, we watched how Oppenheimer was, how he did not want to stop his achievements, how he always wanted to support science and be a pioneer, and how much he enjoyed being promoted professionally. We learned and felt what a feeling of conscience is under all this fame and intelligence. Every second of the three hours is worth watching.
Murphy is excellent and will obviously be nominated..rest of cast are also very good ...

Review_Title: literally the best movie i have ever watched
Review: We all know Christopher Nolan works are the best all around the world but this movie literally crossed my expectations. It is a very long film indeed but there wasn't even one moment where i felt bored bcuz mystery was everywhere. Nolan might have put in his his best effort while making this extraordinary masterpiece.

Review_Title: technically great but also a disappointment
Review: This is a mini-series treated as a 3-plus hour movie. The direction, special effects, scenery, and editing are great. But the movie bogs down early with tedious, boring dialogue, pretentious posturing and emotional sterility which bleaches any life out of it. This is a tale about the creation of the atom bomb treated like episodes of Days of Lives. Murphy is flat and two-dimensional as Oppenheimer, though he looks the part. He has two or three expressions which are over-used.. Robert Downey Jr. Easily walks off with the acting honors.

I am not a fan of Christopher Nolan. He ruined Batman, Dunkirk was a mess and his other movies are overly complicated story mad libs. He is a competent director but his brother is a better writer. All that being said... I think this was his best film since Memento.

Oppenheimer is a cinematic gem that pushes the boundaries of storytelling and captivates the audience from start to finish. Cillian Murphy's exceptional portrayal of the enigmatic J. Robert Oppenheimer is nothing short of extraordinary, elevating this film to an unparalleled level of brilliance.

Oppenheimer combines both stunning visual and audio experiences! From the beginning of the movie all till the end, you can find yourself on the edge of your seat. The way Christopher Nolan is able to capture the fear in the characters is uncanny. Cilian Murphy delivers extraordinary acting and I'm sure he will be up for an Oscar nomination. The fact that there is not one single shot of CGI further proves the fact of how amazing Nolan's directing is. The movie centers around the man and not the bomb and 3 hours of runtime went so fast no one actually felt it due to the grasp of the story. Thank you, Nolan, for delivering the story of the modern Prometheus in such a way!

This is Christopher Nolan's terrific Excellent gripping intense movie to Date despite the 3 hour runtime this movie flew by very quickly Cillian Murphy is excellent in the role of Robert J Oppenheimer I really hope he gets nominated for the Oscars for best actor also Robert Downey jr Is fantastic in this movie as well Matt Damon is incredible in this movie also Kenneth Branagh is great in movie Emily blunt is also great in this film go see this movie on the biggest screen you can go watch this movie in IMAX Or IMAX 70mm this is the best movie of 2023 this film is my number 1 favourite Nolan movie after Dunkirk.

Perfect literally perfect , the famous oppenheimer speech was done so good by Nolan/Cillian Murphy and this movie is not good its a masterpiece that should be no only Oscar winning but best film ever award.if u haven't watched this and ur reading these reviews just know this is a massive loss if u don't watch this in imax or cinema alone , I rarely go cinema but this was a must and such brilliant actors in it , build up was perfect ending was perfect and the bomb well wow never experienced a heart attack until that moment I was so nervous when I was counting down and when I went off wow I was so worried and scared and wow what a film , watch now!!!!!!!- Jack wing.

Review_Title: One of the top 5 films I have seen
Review:
This film is both interesting and fast paced for a three hour film it doesn't drag, could not recommend this film any higher and cillian Murphys performance is as good as anything I have ever seen. His character is supported well by one of the best casts in recent yrs high praise to Emily blunt and Florence Pugh ( another great role by her )
Could not seriously think of a negative part of this film instant classic.

Review_Title: One of the few gems untouched by wokism
Review: It's a rare relief when a film is released that isn't laced with left wing political messages, and doesn't incorrectly cast white men as either women, black, or both. We need more films with 90% female casts, but we don't need to lie and pretend history is different

Quite disappointed. Story and timeline were all over the place. If you have never hear of Oppenheimer, you are still quite lost because the story line missed connecting to the audience. Really felt like I wasted 3.5 hours on a nice Sunday afternoon.

I never thought I will be the person who praises the movie so much right after it's premiere. Usually I like to take my time before speaking my thoughts but the newest movie from Christopher Nolan really moved me, it moved me to the point that I created account to write this brief review.

Review_Title: Compared to 'The animation game': a six
Review: Well, I am spoiled with 'The animation game'. Compared to that movie I give 'Oppenheimer' a six. Oppenheimers character was not as sound displayed is Turings... Cracking the German code is also not so controversial as developing an atombomb... Mixed feelings.

3 hours I can't get back. I fed into the hype. The countless news articles and YouTube videos about the movie. And then I watched it...Boy was I disappointed. I should've known better. Oppenheimer is a very boring and tedious film. It requires your FULL attention and I'm not a fan of that. The scenes were way too long and the pacing was slow as a snail. What did I expect? An action film or a thriller? It's a biography about the brilliant mind(s) behind one of the most pivotal moments in world history. Having said that, it doesn't make the movie likable in my opinion. On a positive note the acting and cinematography was great. Everything else was meh.

Review_Title: Nolan refined all his tools to deliver a Masterpiece!
Review: This is not possible without Nolan's previous projects. The non-linear storytelling, the thunderous score reverberating the tension. The storytelling being told masterfully via the cinematography. The sound design calculatingly setting the tone. Those techniques have been refined for a razor sharp 3 hour bio of one of mankind's most important/ awful creations. The more you come in with knowledge of the events, the more you'll get out of it. And still a great entry point for those who want a kinetic re-telling of of a complex subject.

Having just returned from the cinema, I am left speechless by the brilliance of 'Oppenheimer,' and I must say that Cillian's performance as the lead actor is truly outstanding. This movie has transported me to another dimension with its powerful and impactful scenes. It is undoubtedly the best movie I have ever seen, and Cillian's portrayal adds an exceptional depth to the film. Cillian's portrayal of the character was nothing short of mesmerizing, leaving a lasting impression on my mind. The movie's ability to evoke such intense emotions is a testament to its brilliance. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking an unforgettable cinematic experience.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer is, quite literally, a bomb.
Review: With a duration of 180 minutes, we are granted the virtue of witnessing a masterful representation of how the human being can set aside their own humanity when obstinately clinging to their ideals. It is truly admirable how the film delves deeply into moral themes and how its messages impact and move the audience, leaving an indelible imprint on the human psyche. The unique narrative of this film far surpasses any other production based on historical events, even if the latter may not be rigorously precise. However, it is precisely in this imprecision where its charm lies, for the film does not seek to be a mere documentary; rather, it is an emotional and profound portrayal of a range of feelings experienced by the protagonist throughout the film, including guilt, resilience, anguish, and many others.

Review_Title: JUST HAND HIM THE OSCAR ALREADY. AKA (Cilian murphy)
Review: Where do i start i came into this movie thinking i will not understand anything and coming out of it i felt i was still in that cinema watching. Great acting by Cilian murphy give him his oscar now he really deserved it and shoutout to (MATT DAMON) who made the only joke in the film. Its really intresting and never has any boring parts and really liked Robert Downey Junior for great acting. And again another masterpiece buy (Christopher nolan) the one thing i really liked about this film is that you is how oppenheimer was soo serious and a fun character at the same time really liked emily blunt.

Review_Title: The best film by Christopher Nolan
Review: In my opinion, Nolan made an excellent movie that talks about Oppenheimer, the plot is not only about the atomic bomb, it also has to do with the Manhattan project and what happened after using the bomb, the cast is perfect, all the performances are good, but the performances by Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr. And Emily Blunt are spectacular, Ludwig Göransson's soundtrack is very good, the direction and photography is impeccable, I loved that they didn't use cgi, for all those reasons it's one of my movies Nolan's favorites and they will possibly win many Oscars For example, Best Supporting Actor for Robert Downey Jr. Best Picture and the Oscar for Cillian Murphy.

Review_Title: If it went on for another 3 hours I'd of gladly watched
Review: Go see it in Imax and the slight increased ticket price is worthy of your money, it's a visual and audible feast, good value entertainment is hard to come by these days and this delivers. I'd dissuade anyone from going just for the explosion this is a biopic based around a key point in Oppenheimer's life, not just building a bomb. After reading some reviews I thought it'd be challenging to keep up with a few timelines but it was a breeze, the pace although on the fast side makes for compelling storytelling. The score and sound are perfect and exactly what you'd expect from Imax, the well placed/timed loudness adds to the experience and makes this a well constructed immersive look into the life of a controversial historical figure. Just on my way to binge all Nolan's movies now.

The movie drags and drags until your last two brain cells stop working. It was painfully long. You even consider stepping out of the theatre. Apart from that the casting was great. Acting by Cillian, Emily, Florence, Robert Downey was exceptional. We actually feel that we are in the 1940s as the costume, makeup, set was perfect.

Review_Title: Best Nolan Movie. One of the Best of our Time! OSCAR CENTRAL!
Review: This movie is near perfect. A wonderful character study/political drama that ultimately reminds us all the potential of being sent back to the Stone Age. The potential of having Nukes sent to you at any moment is akin to having a gun held to your head 24/7. What if you grow up in a society that was born with a gun to its head? It's easy to forget it's there.

Review_Title: It's more of biography so don't expect action as in other Nolans movie
Review: I should not even mention anything about direction as we know the director and that's why we go and watch his movies. The story revolves around oppenheimers inner fight of need to create the bomb and guilt of after effects. He is passionate about what he is doing but after the test he goes to guilt and hence wants to stop the escalating and research on making more bombs. Please do not expect any mind boggling action and adventure from this movie. It does not even show how the actual bomb got dropped. Once the test was done the work got over for oppenheimer.

Review_Title: The most overrated, overhyped movie I've ever seen
Review: The first hour is jumping between different rooms where people are having lengthy conversations about physics over dramatic music. The second hour is more of the same with a sprinkle of moral contemplation. The final hour has 20 minutes of drama (spoiler- they drop the bomb- horrible of course but the only plot point that held my attention) and then another 40 minutes of guilt and buck-passing.

The movie does an exceptional job in transmitting Oppenheimer's feelings from the events that lead to the construction of the bomb to the consequences of its use. Even though the film is presented in a complex manner, going back and forth from past to future and changing whose perspective is being presented, Christopher Nolan used visual effects as clues very well, like black and white when it is Dr. Strauss perspective and the electron orbits in Oppenheimer's imagination getting more under control as he grasps quantum mechanics.
This movie is nothing other than perfection. The characters, the plot, cinematography, acting, all was 10/10.

Review_Title: Beautiful, artful biography from Nolan - his best so far (with spoilers)
Review: I've seen this movie three times in theatres and could easily see it three more. It's got incredible scope, breakneck pacing, and a kind of narrative and character-generated complexity you don't see in a lot of Hollywood releases. What I like most, though, is how Nolan continues to treat his well-known themes in new and interesting ways.

Review_Title: They won't fear it until they understand it and they won't understand it until they've used it.
Review: My brother and have been fans of Cillian Murphy since the dark knight and more recently peaky blinders. We planned to go see this months in advance. We saw it Saturday opening weekend at 1145p. Not the smartest idea considering it was 3 hours long. Ok. I came in with high expectations. It's Nolan. It's Murphy, Downey, Blunt, Damon, and much more. Listen. I couldn't stop thinking about this movie. Not just the historical significance but its brilliance as well. I was blown away. I forgot about the time. A cinematic masterpiece. In a world full of superhero films and over the top CGI. I needed this. So good. I really enjoy the little gestures of each character and the little bread crumbs Nolan leaves throughout the film that round it out in the end. At one point I was sad thinking the movie was over and then upon glancing at the time realized there was an hour left. The best was yet to come.

Review_Title: This is the best movie I have ever seen. Nothing to say, it's great.
Review: Very different than Nolan's recent films, especially the Sci-Fi ones, but shows that Nolan can master the Biopic/Drama genre just as well as he can any other genre he tried to tackle yet.

This is Nolan at his finest. Never was I bored and the actors all performed really well. Goosebumps when Einstein gave his wise words at the end. I mean, this was probably one of the greatest movies of all time and I'm so glad I watched it in Imax in 70mm. There's really something special about seeing a movie in 70mm and this is a great example of one to do it.

I love most Nolan films including Tenet but Dunkirk left me disconnected resulting in a tedious experience. I much preferred Oppenheimer yet this emotional disconnect from the characters and plot was present at least to a lesser extent. The film is evidently meticulous in its production with outstanding acting yet it felt somewhat mechanical and disconnected amidst its pummelling of events. I was riveted by Dark Knight, Interstellar and Tenet yet Oppenheimer and Dunkirk far more so saw emotional resonance with the characters and care for the films outcome lacking. I've definitely had films belatedly connect with me on subsequent viewings, however, I am concerned personally with this and Dunkirk's style yet most including the Oscars are likely to say otherwise.

Although it's still too fresh for me to come to any certain conclusions, "Oppenheimer" may be Christopher Nolan's finest film. In it, Nolan takes his visual acumen and talents for melodrama, ensemble casts and intelligent screenplays, and channels it into a true story he's obviously passionate about. While there's much to say about this film, I'll only give a few thoughts.

Review_Title: Give me the technical version of oppi
Review: First, it is a good movie overall with great actors and an interesting story. Second, it is highly overrated and most people (americans) out there see "Nolan" and start screaming it is the best movie of all times blablabla. This was adapted from a book so dont expect anything mindblowing in the story, it's just what it is: a biography.

Review_Title: Don't dare dismiss this film as trash, psuedo intellects will call you a dullard
Review: This movie takes a very interesting story and turns it into absolute boring garbage. If you dare say that, the pseudo intellectuals will call you a dullard, and claim that you don't know anything about the Manhattan project. Read a book on the subject, you will garner more knowledge and excitement than this film could ever provide. This is hands down the biggest disappointment of a movie in years, and I am usually a fan of Nolan. This film touched on none of the interesting aspects of this subject. No mention of the demon core, no mention of the science and knowledge it took to make any of this happen, no mention of the ethical and moral implications and consequences most scientists felt. This film drags on for hours while never deserving to do so. Anyone who says they like this movie is a phony intellectual neckbeard.
I'm still processing how good this is man.

Review_Title: Leaves you thinking about this movie for miles on end after watching
Review: Where do i even begin with this movie! This is one of the many examples of nolan being what he does best, a director. I do recommend that before watching this film the viewer should do a small amount of research however so they could understand the exact meanings of the historical event. I was quite confused at first on why Nolan recommended this film to be on IMAX but when I watched the film i truly understood why. The environment that surrounds you makes you truly feel that you are part of the story, and that you are really looking at J. Robert Oppenheimer. Cillian Murphy being Oppenheimer is the best choice for this film. Bravo Chris!

Oppenheimer was the manifestation of the type of story Nolan had been itching to tell all his career. It represents him in a microcosm - a deep, emotionally layered story, harrowingly combining scientific, social, and political intricacies of the 1940s.

The feeling that this is a historical event is well renowned in this movie. Nolan did not leave a bit of error in this. I movie is bold and quite intense. You not only see the history but also the truth that Oppenheimer realises about his deads. And also how each of his close friends and family were involved with him.

Review_Title: Christopher Nolan reaffirms his place among the very best of all time.
Review: Wednesday, July the 19th. Opening night in Paris. The audience exits the crowded room in dead silence, having witnessed yet another masterpiece from the director who doesn't require any introduction. While being so typically Nolan, Oppenheimer also separates itself from the rest of his filmography. No Tenet-like action sequences, no mind-bending elements, no confusing timeline. The movie unfolds slowly but surely, and the 3 hours go by without being felt. The final hour in particular, might just be the best I've witnessed in a long time.

"Oppenheimer" is the ultimate cinematic triumph, that finally showcased on a global scale the incredible talent of Cillian Murphy! Murphy's captivating portrayal is nothing short of mesmerising, perfectly capturing the depth and complexity of the character with unmatched nuance.

Personally this was the most anticipated movie this year, if not the most anticipated in the last 5 years. Considering the pile of ... subpar production that is overflowing the industry lately it definitely deserves your attention, however I was left with the feeling that it could have been so much more, and sadly it wasn't. Since I am not an expert, I am not going to delve deep into the cinematography and I am pretty sure there aren't many people that are in position to criticize or evaluate Christopher Nolan when it comes to that. For me, personally, the action felt too fragmented at times, which disrupted the flow of the whole movie too much and left me with this unsettling feeling that the story could have been told better. I understand the logic behind the retrospection and I know that this technique has served Nolan beautifully on previous occasions, nevertheless I reckon it was exploited too much here. Moreover, the soundtrack was too intrusive at times and it was forcing your attention into the moment instead of guiding it.

This movie is not what we all have been conditioned to through DC and Marvel movies. Therefore , I urge you not to listen to the haters. Nolan truly takes us through a journey of Oppenheimers life. One can expect to go through various emotions while watching this movie. The cinematography was excellent and acting by all actors was brilliant. The movie does have some technical words from physics that may be tough for some to understand. Especially those who have a small attention span. In an era of tik tok, reels and short movies with lots of action, Nolan makes a movie that demands your attention and it doesn't feel too long. It's brilliant. I want to Thank Christopher Nolan for giving us the masterpiece. We are truly witnessing a genius at work. I am also thankful to all the actors for their brilliant performance.

Review_Title: Overhyped but Nice to Look At
Review: Christopher Nolan's obsession with hyperbolic noise and graphics comes to a head in 'Oppenheimer' in a long-foreseen bang, but the aftermath is short lived.

Review_Title: Bad men giving a genius a hard time
Review: "Very rarely go to the cinema these days - rip off candy bar, can't pause it to take a break to stretch, pee, or a smoke for smokers.

This movie is insane! It has everything and Nolan is able to pace it so well, all the tension during dialogue, movie of the century. Not to mention all the great actors and actresses, wow Cillian Murphy was phenomenal, his eyes could talk, Emily Blunt nailed it with the so called non trial scene, Matt Damon was very subtle but his acting was so deep and solid, last but not least, RDJ was so great, we all know he's great but he was under the ironman shadow, he shook it off so damn well.
