What a masterpiece... Everything designed by Nolan without CGI. You know when a movie directing by Christopher Nolan,you gotta see that movie on IMAX that's an unwritten rule and I can easily say this was the best IMAX experience that i've ever had. The quality of sounds was made me feel like I'm inside of the movie. Especially,this cast OMG! Even the less important role in the movie was played by an actor who has at least Oscar or any award. Probably only Nolan or Tarantino would bring them together and seeing this movie,learning all kinda things about the facts in the history was an indescribable experience.

Review_Title: A breath of fresh air for Hollywood
Review: I though the movie was a breath air for Hollywood, all year bad movies have been pumped out, but this feels like it has heart. Unlike certain other movies, this one does not rely on bad jokes to take up most of the runtime.

I highly recommend this movie. It's so informative. I didn't even felt bore for a second. This movie is one of the best movies of all time. Christopher nolan and cillian Murphy is a good team. Hope to see MORE from them in future. Specially the bomb explosion moments. And the story before that. I really felt so real at the moments of Oppenheimer's shock. The regret of him. Those moments were really good. I loved the cinematography. And robert downey junior's acting was top notch. At first i couldn't even recognise him. He was totally in the character. And florence pugh was amazing as well. So many favourite characters together. Felt like "avengers end game last scene" everyone was there. SO GOOD!!!

OPPENHEIMER, starring Cillian Murphy and directed by Christopher Nolan, is definitely a treat for history buffs, but this film in particular is about the origins and/or the summarized development of the atomic bomb and therefore everything that shall come after, but really this film explores majorly the psychological turmoil of its subject: Oppenheimer himself, all during an age of McCarthyism and quote-on-quote government-sponsored censorship of not only entertainment, but political dissent. Blacklisting, Defamation of Character, Violation of Civil Liberties. Only Objection: Too Long, 3Hours. Pacing in On-Point for an Educated Audience. Not for the Lowest Common Denominator. Still Accessible - Acting Onpoint - Traditionalist Through and Through. This is What Keeps It Going - Straight Dramatic, Eye Contact - Cunning, Thrilling, and Mysterious At Times and Selectively Downright Philosophical. END OF REVIEW.

The cinematic genius Christopher Nolan is undoubtedly one of the finest stars in the film industry. With his unique talent and boundless creativity, he has crafted a new cinematic icon (Oppenheimer) that will undoubtedly be immortalized in the world of cinema. It will stand among the greatest works ever seen in the realm of cinema because Nolan only delivers iconic masterpieces.

Review_Title: Very good but maybe not exceptional
Review: Here's what I liked. The acting was superb. Cillian Murphy (Who is this guy?) was outstanding. Oscar winning performance. The supporting cast was terrific including Robert Downey Jr. You felt the characters were real. Only Matt Damon's role felt forced. The script was intelligent (for the most part) and it's a good story. Nuclear weapons is admittedly a touchy subject and the movie kept its balance until the last hour when it became a tad one-sided. The short scene making President Truman seem like a bumpkin was disappointing, for example, even though I read that a couple of quotes he said in the movie were true. Still, it made me wonder how historically accurate the movie was. From what I read, Oppenheimer was more flawed than the movie indicates, and I left the theater wondering what kind of man Oppenheimer really was, besides being a competent director and a womanizer. I also thought the use of imagery showing what Oppenheimer was thinking at times was too speculative and overdone. All said, this was a good film which offered a lot. However, it's not Nolan's best movie, in my opinion.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer: A Cinematic Symphony of Action and Emotion
Review: " Oppenheimer" is a breathtaking masterpiece that skillfully combines the elements of action, audio, acting, direction, and scene design into an unforgettable cinematic experience. Directed by the visionary filmmaker, Christopher Nolan, the movie takes audiences on an electrifying journey that weaves together heart-pounding action sequences, immersive audio design, exceptional performances, stunning visuals, and meticulous direction. This review delves into the movie's prowess in each of these crucial areas, showcasing how it harmoniously creates a symphony of emotions and adrenaline.
Oppenheimer - 7/10

Review_Title: Nolan in Steep Decline Since Dunkirk
Review: Up until Dunkirk, I loved Nolan's films. I saw Interstellar 3 times in the theater. The Dark Knight trilogy may be my favorite in the superhero genre. I had high expectations going into Oppenheimer. Sadly, I was falling asleep and checking my phone by the end of the first hour. So boring. The only thing in this film maybe worth watching only when it's available at home were the performances. Murphy and Damon mostly.

Review_Title: This is definitely a Christopher Nolan film.
Review: I just watched this movie, and it is an ambitious film in portraying Robert Oppenheimer. The cast which you may know were in the movie and some you didn't know had small roles were all excellent. I thought Murphy and RDJ were the standouts. The one role who I thought seemed superfluous was Florence Pugh's character. To me she didn't seem too vital to the story aside from seeing her boobs in IMAX. Nolan could've put anyone in that role, and it would have had the same superficial effect. Aside from that the only quibble I have is the score is sometimes so loud that I could NOT understand what some of the characters were saying. As for the rest of the film it was relentless in telling Oppenheimer's story. It was as well made as cinema can get nowadays. You were absolutely immersed in the mid to late 40's . So much so that if you aren't a person even mildly knowledgeable about the subject then you may get lost as this film does not hold your hand in explaining what is occurring.

Wow, what a monumental & sensational film! Nolan reinvents the three-Act structure to extraordinary effect. Oppenheimer is an intense and thrilling film that grabs a hold of your attention from the first frame and never let's you go. A mesmerising and powerful drama that unfolds like a thriller; Nolan builds the tension to a breathtaking climax, but thereafter does not let go, when it morphs into a thrilling and tense courtroom drama. The performances are all uniformly incredible, but Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Junior, Emily Blunt and Jason Clarke are the clear standouts. Every performance is a fully realised characterisation. Nolan has crafted a masterful film with the highest technical achievement, from the cinematography, to the production design, to the film's epic and haunting score from Ludwig Gorranson. This is Nolan's masterpiece!
From the moment the movie started it set a tone which got the viewers ready for a new level of cinema. This movie will be known for changing cinema in a good way.

When you watch this movie for the first time you feel mix of sad, angry, terrible, more feelings in the same moment.. But you can not understand all of scents from one watch.. Nolan makes physics more easier with the audience and amazing.. He used to do that in his all last movies such as interstellar and inception..Nolan is a genius director..
One watch is always not enough...
He has a magic survival powerful as he make every body in the cast did more than the best of him.. One day Nolan will lead cinematic world to make a new way to moviemakers..if i were Nolan.. I will work 24 hours a day and product more & more to make better and happiest world.

I don't think there will ever be a greater film experience than this. You get what you give. Give this movie your absolute focus (maybe eat an edible prior), and you will be impacted by this movie in a way you never have before. You will leave the theater certain that Oppenheimer will likely never be surpassed in terms of quality. I loved it on Imax and I hope the Imax brand can stay true to a collection of movies displayed on it that are at the top of the class in cinematography and an provide interesting historical events or insight into what our world and universe have to offer. Don't miss this in Imax (also sit a little further back than the middle;)

From the direction of Christopher Nolan. To the amazing soundtrack that makes every intense scene get you on the edge of your seat. To the beautiful acting of Cillian Murphy, and Robert Downey Jr., and Matt Damon, and Emily Blunt, and so many more. When I went to the theater watching this film, I thought in the back of my head that I knew the story and I knew the outcome. But Christopher Nolan still manages to dive deep down in reveal the story in ways I never thought. It's gonna be one of the best movies for a very long time. The only thing I can say is go out watch this movie. And do not miss a second of it because every scene and every word spoken matters. I can't wait to see what Christopher Nolan cooks up next!

By no means is Oppenheimer a bad film - in fact I would recommend anyone looking for an experience to go check it out. However I do believe the film is a bit unorganized and is largely saved by good performances and great cinematography, at least up until the last one-half to one-third. After that, the story takes a more "traditional" route and cleans everything up nicely, barring a few things which I wish were done differently.
I waited so long to see the film, and it was worth it. I'm a big Christopher Nolan fan and I've seen his most popular films and I had high hopes for the film.

So today I watched Oppenheimer and it was good. I was extremely excited for this one and my expectation meter was quite high but it turned out to be just good, not extraordinary or beyond expectation, it was a good movie.

I mean I don't know what most people saw here, but this was a bore fest. Amazing cast, great acting , superb cinematography and sound. But that's about it. Except few moments in the movie, rest was complete borefest. Half my theater was sleeping after 45 minutes. Werner Brothers might buy some reviewers to give great reviews and Nolan fan boys might go ga ga over it,.but that's usual with most of his movies. Box office, it won't last over few days.

Review_Title: Absolute masterpiece - filled with perfect cinematography, music, and pure acting
Review: A typical Nolan film that forces the audience to have full engagement and use their head throughout the entire film to fully understand the surrounding plot. The plot is designed perfectly and depicts Oppenheimers life much more deeply than I suspected walking into the theatre. The cinematography was beautiful, as expected with Nolan. The music and theme was fantastic. The acting was absolutely phenomenal, and Nolan's ability to build each character deeply was crucial to the plot. Finally, the ending was perfect, it brought everything together and gave the audience a chilling sensation as they left the theatre with a jaw dropping experience.

This is one of the greatest cinematic experience a person can have and it is the best movie after interstellar in my opinion the visuals are perfect the cinematography is outstanding. The acting is commendable especially the acting of Cillian Murphy and Emily blunt. The personal and professional life of Oppenheimer is portrayed beautiful. And the Mastermind behind all this Christopher Nolan again gives us a Masterpiece which will be talked about till decades. At last everyone should experience this movie and that to in cinema theaters because this movie is made for that and on a TV, laptop,mobile etc screen will not give you the perfect experience.

Review_Title: The best thing I've ever seen
Review: I don't know what Christopher Nolan does to turn his films from mere entertainment to experiences. What I can say is that I expected little from the movie Interstellar when I saw it, and due to my ignorance, I didn't imagine it to be a Nolan movie, except when it was late and I had already loved it. I would say that the engaging narrative and the construction of tension are primarily responsible for my passion, but today I would argue in favor of Nolan's masterful direction, which has been perpetuated in the present film. His predecessor, Tenet, is, by contrast, one of the worst and most confusing experiences the director has ever provided to his audience. An injustice only compensated by the existence of openI would say that the engaging narrative and the construction of tension are primarily responsible for my passion, but today I would argue in favor of Nolan's masterful direction, which has been perpetuated in the present film. His predecessor, Tenet, is, by contrast, one of the worst and most confusing experiences the director has ever provided to his audience. An injustice only compensated for by the existence of Oppenheimer. Everything is in its place: characters, motivations, historical fidelity and a good documentary basis, although it explores and deepens distinct themes. The book is exceptionally large and it would be impossible to adapt all of its content. However, I hope many people will see this film.

Review_Title: After rewatching the movie, it's a pure masterpiece
Review: When I had wached this movie I gave it 9/10 because of missing some details as the first half of the movie was so fast and there had been alot of names but when I rewatched it my rate is 10/10 . At the second watch I understood everything the timeline in the movie was alittle bet hard to understand but when yous see that for second time its wow . Cillian Murphy's performance deserves oscar , even his eyes was acting he was really the best cast . Robert Downey Jr. I wished he has more scenes but his scenes in the second part of the movie was really good and I forgot that I am watching Tony Stark. Mat Damon and Emily Blunt were also lovely. The most thing I have loved in the movie is the sound effects it made super atmosphere. Finally I love to say Nolan is GOAT.

Review_Title: Interesting, but not enough raw and serious
Review: Oppenheimer is an excellent personal history and a story of international cooperation in physics. There is an interest in philosophy and morality, but no understanding of the actions and consequences. All the time there is too much political witch hunt and game in the US and too few mentions and scenes of the effects of radiation, humanitarian crisis and suffering in Japan.

Review_Title: An instant classic. A technical wonder. An incredible story.
Review: Oppenheimer, almost feels like he was made for Christopher Nolan. For once in a Nolan film, he doesn't have to come up with a larger than life idea, with a complicated man at the helm of it. Because that kind of story, the kind Nolan seems to be so interested in, was Oppenheimer's life.
Oppenheimer was an experience.

Just out after watching this movie. Nolan is maturing well and how. The story telling has become simpler (vis-a-vis Prestige for example :P). Has an Amadeus touch to the story line. Cinematography, lighting and camera work is superb and lends itself well to the story telling. Nolan remains customer obsessed as ever, treating his audience with intellectual respect. The actors are extremely good and the best compliment to them is that you don't feel them. Only thing which could be better was the music.

Another Christopher Nolan masterpiece, as it started out, but was quickly changed the tone when nudity was added in for no real reason at all. It honestly took away from the overall character of the film and ruined getting a pg-13 rating which would have been able to be seen by even more fans. It felt like something added in by producers to get more views or add something spicy to the content. It film was unreal, the acting was amazing, and the overall feel of the movie was left confused by the length and seemed drawn out more than his other films. It could have been a hour cut off in just unneeded dialogue.

Review_Title: Lot of internal US politics than science
Review: I was expecting something like Interstellar, but not 15 minutes of Quantum Mechanics, Nuclear Physics, or any sort of Physics throughout the entire 180 minutes of the film. Instead, there were lots of internal politics and spying investigations of the US Government at that time. As I am not North American, I couldn't relate to all these backstories regarding what went wrong with Oppenheimer back then. I will surely accept that it was my mistake not to check the genre of the movie. Apart from that, I didn't like the usage of the Sri Bhagavad Gita in the movie. They could have shown him reading it in the lab or something. Also, when Jean Tatlock asks him 2nd time to speak Sanskrit script, again Murphy just translated it.

Review_Title: Science, politics and history in a master piece
Review: It is possible to combine science and politics with a very deep and catastrophic story, a very rigid and complex protagonist, and a very rich and enjoyable middle and end, despite the number of important and historical names and characters in that context to understand and not miss any detail.

This movie was absolutely fantastic. Quick paced. The score was powerful and emotional. Acting was exceptional. The last 45 mins were a bit much for me, so I'll take away a star for that. Also the nudity was unnecessary. You could have communicated the romantic tension without it, so I remove a star for that as well. Doing a little research on the biography of Oppenheimer afterwards, I believe the movie was very faithful to his character and personal life. Over all, I believe Christopher Nolan's film was a masterpiece that will always be remembered positively. As long as that movie was, I can't wait to see it again.
This movie is probably one of the best movies I have seen in recent times and is going up there with movies im going to rewatch the rest of my life.

This movie starts off very much like any other Chris Nolan film. The first 30 minutes are nothing more than rapid fire scenes bunched together introducing the main characters. I'm not gonna lie...I was immediately aggravated with the typical Nolan style introduction. "Here we go...this is nothing more than The Dark Knight style editing mixed in with the same boring ass score." And honestly...thats pretty much what it is for the entirety of the 3 hour run time.

Review_Title: "And now I am become death, the destroyer of worlds"
Review: A Masterpiece in every sense of the word, the editing and masterful score kept me invested and engaged during the whole 180 minutes.

This movie has reached its expectations and was even better. The story telling of this movie was absolute Masterpiece and told us everything about oppenheimers life, told us what was happening in his head. The cinematography of this movie was also amazing but what else can you expect from Christopher Nolan. The pacing of this movie was almost perfect and I have enjoyed every second of this movie. I have felt every emotion that oppie has felt and I had the feeling that I have lived those moments. I loved the process and the switches between black and white and colourful cinema. The scene when the bomb went off had my heart pounding and the end had me thinking for many days. Plus the music was excellent. One of the best endings of a movie if not the best. AMAZING 10/10 must watch in IMAX for the full experience.

The movie itself is not about the Manhattan Project. Its merely depicted. It instead heavily focuses on Oppenheimer himself. The movie is tasked with answering a single question throughout the entire movie: Is Oppenheimer a man to be trusted? The development of the movie is very well designed. Oppenheimer is a complicated man, with strong beliefs and who is entitled to those beliefs, and yet he is constantly interrogated for not just being the man who invented the atomic bomb, but for whether or not he is being loyal to America. Forces beyond his control and people who plot against him, but he has the wit and strength of a scientist who must prove to no one that he is in fact human.
Today I watched this movie in IMAX and boy, every penny spent for the movie ticket was worth it.

The pace of the movie is too alert for my taste. Scenes and frames and events changing every 3-5 seconds, the audio goes from 0 to 100 I had to cover my ears. The editing simply made me sick as if I was in a speeding car on a windy road hitting lots of bumps. The acting is 10/10 and the quality is impecable. I kinda wished the movie had shown some insights into the Japanese side as well, like maybe the story of a simple family living in Hiroshima, for example, to get some balance and more nuanced cultural insights and sides to the same story. It felt so unilateral even with Oppenheimer's hallucinating guilt. The main antagonist in this story is some guy playing political tricks I didn't care about which just made the story difficult to understand or get emotionally invested into at times.
From a cinematic standpoint, Nolan's directorial skills are unmatched.
It's by far Christopher Nolan's best work and easily the best movie released in the last 10 years. It is a little bit long coming in at 3 hours and 9 minutes, but it's worth it.

A Masterpiece
I may consider myself lucky to be alive to watch Christopher Nolan Works which get better by years.

I write this review for this unexpected occasion thinking of christopher nolan and other producers this movie cast is very high rated in acting but the acting of cillian and rdj is so amazing. First of all i amazed when i saw this movie cast then i really agreed that this movie is a new masterpiece in hollywood and also in christopher nolan's career. Oppenheimer has offered the audience an outstanding story, casting, and definitely acting. Cillian Murphy and Robert D. Junior have excelled and went beyond everything they've done before, and showed everyone how great they are. The music was employed perfectly, and it was successful in heightening the emotions of every scene (kudos to Ludwig Goransson)

For me this film felt like a disappointment in comparison to the trailer. I understand that trailers often show a glimpse of the film, and it is difficult to say whether it will actually actually meet the trailer expectations.
We liked the film that it was based on a true Story, The cast was brilliant and like in every Nolan Film the special effects were great and the story was written great

Like other Nolan's movie ;
it's not for everyone. If you aren't willing to be forced to think for 3 hours straight, this movie aren't gonna suit you.

Review_Title: Wait to see it on cable
Review: If you are completely unfamiliar with the life of Oppenheimer, it's interesting. But if you've read a biography or two, it's not completely accurate, but still just as depressing.

Review_Title: An Instant Classic of American History!
Review: It is an incredibly well done movie! It was confusing at times, just for the confusion to be an excellent catalyst for the ending. It was truly shocking!!!! I was never bored during the film, and it kind of felt like three movies in one, that thoroughly connected. The movie may not be what y'all are expecting, but it is a truly great piece of cinema. It gives great insight into the time period and the man's life. The whole movie flows seamlessly, and definitely deserves to be watched multiple times! One of the most incredible things that I realized 2/3rds of the way in, is that the actors did such an amazing job that I truly forgot it was the same actors for the majority of the movie. I truly dropped my jaw remembering that Cillian Murphy is the man planning Oppenheimer, but also played Scarecrow (in Nolan's BatMan Begins); they feel like two completely separate human beings! The only one who felt like himself was Robert Downey Jr., but that was pretty much because he was the only one who didn't have a completely different voice from his usual self. Downey Jr.'s performance was still magnificent to be clear! The whole movie is truly a masterpiece and should be remembered as an American classic!!!! I never say this, but during the last 30 seconds I had goosebumps, it was a truly, deep and meaningful, emotional experience.

Christopher Nolan depicts an epic biopic of the life of Oppenheimer. There isn't a single flaw with this movie. The pacing is perfect, with the use of time jumps Nolan provides an entertaining look into the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer. The artistic use of black, white and color gives the viewer two different perspectives on the movie. The acting performances from Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey jr and the entire supporting cast are nothing short of exceptional and just go to show that Nolan's casting is perfect. Once again Nolan has proven he is not limited by genre by making his best work. Truly a masterpiece, I expect it will pick up various awards as what I believe to be movie of the year.

Review_Title: A must-watch/have movie experience in Theatre
Review: I don't think any other movie will cast this perfectly and deliver a dominating performance from each character. Nolan proved why he's one of the greatest storytellers of this generation. The Acting, Cinematography, Music, Background score, Screenplay, Direction, and everything were so perfect.

Review_Title: A magnificent spectacle of a movie!
Review: Have just walked out of the cinema absolutely riveted by this moral rollercoaster. From the cinematics to the acting and the writing of this film, it was all beautifully executed to make such an enjoyable movie experience. I hope that all credit is given as it's due, cannot recommend this film enough!

I loved the effects in the movie and the sound was fantastic. The sound experience was indescribable. It may not suit everyone's taste, but I'm sure whoever loves this type of movie will like it. The cast was amazing, elite actors. Cillian Murphy's performance was amazing, he mastered the role of Benheimer more than him 😂 and he also gave the character his own flavor because of his unique facial features. In short, the movie is worth watching the money and time It is also not suitable for children under 13 from my point of view, but I wish they showed the effects of the nuclear bomb on the human being from the center of the bomb until the last trace of it.

Review_Title: Probably on of the most important movies to be made in recent years
Review: Made an account just so I can hype up this masterpiece. The movie is a must-watch. Had me hooked from the very beginning. Nolan is an incredible director and even though I understand that some people may have had slightly different expectations, this movie serves incredible atmosphere, character complexity, story progression and depiction of monumental historical events, without any hint of romanticization. The cast was picked perfectly and served amazing acting. Personally I didn't find it too long, in fact it didn't feel like 3h at all. Would strongly recommend watching it in theaters rather than waiting to stream it at home. Also wouldn't recommend it to anyone who is not into history at all. No need to be a history buff, but would recommend looking up the some information about the Manhattan Project and everybody's involvement just for a better feel of the plot, though one can watch the movie without any prior knowledge whatsoever. The plot is rounded-up beautifully and it sparks further need for discussion and thinking, without feeling ambiguous.

Review_Title: Focus of the story is wrong
Review: The main focus of this film is on the political story after making the bomb. There's not enough detail on how Oppenheimer lead a group of Nobel prize winning scientists to overcome various challenges in the Manhattan project (e.g. How they extracted enough uranium, design choices of the bomb). The success of the Manhattan project overall the biggest achievement in his lifetime and what people should know more about, not the intrigue with politicians and such detailed security trial.

Every things is perfect a great piece from Christopher Nolan there is no mistake in it and absolutely there is no movie greater than this
it does not disappointed me at all what can i say
i hope will be more movies like this in the future
Christopher Nolan respect the art in his work and this movie an Example how cinema industry should be the acting is Historical i think the crew will sweep the Oscar awards and of course the music was the bomb in this year
this film will be in my mind so long to forget it is my favorite film thank for reading my article about this great work and this is everything.

It's the first time I have this thought about Nolan' a movie . This movie I just feel disappointed. The movie wants to make like a combination of documentary and story. But it just don't go . Einstein is not an old retired old man walking around the river to tell u what it's right . And I don't get any point about those two naked scenes. Literally it doesn't help anything but make the film level to R . Oppenheimer is one of the greatest scientists ever . And he doesn't know if he made this the government wouldn't throw it out ?it's so joke when they said cuz culture they don't throw it to Kyoto. Like peoples life are nothing than culture.

We came away from watching Oppenheimer with mixed reviews and everyone agreed the movie was confusing. First, the narrative about a famous, soft spoken American is masked by "mood-music" throughout most of the film. As a result, the viewer is forced to read lips in order to understand the plot. Second and typical of Nolan's films, the plot skips around to the point where it becomes difficult to follow. This Hollywood "Hop-Scotching" produces audio & visual enhancements, but it also shrouds the spinal message of the movie. Additionally, the film also contains dozens of actors making it impossible to track who is who and what their positions are. Oppenheimer is technically accurate but not smooth in its presentation. I would recommend to those who have't seen it to read up about Robert Oppenheimer beforehand so you can gain an appreciation of his controversial biography. Oppenheimer is worth seeing, but it'll be awhile before I'll view the film again, perhaps with captions, so I can digest what message Nolan is trying to portray. Non-fictional movies about a major historical event shouldn't be fragmented in its message, as the Trinity test suggests.
This film is a masterpiece of Christopher Nolan.

That was a masterpiece, this Film was Gripping yet frightening. I could not take my eyes of the screen, i find the science behind it all so intriguing but so scary at the same time. I would like to say as well that Nolan always hits it right with the Composer for the Soundtrack to, it felt so right if you get what I mean. I found 3hours flew by and when I left the cinema I had so many thoughts running through my head, so many questions you know. The film has been on my mind for a few days now which is how you should feel leaving the cinema. Hats off to Cillian Murphy a fantastic portrayal of Mr Oppenheimer.

I just saw it on IMAX 70mm, I would say I have seen lots of movies in my life till now but Oppenheimer is the first FILM I have ever seen. Must be watched on IMAX 70mm (that is the way Nolan and his team made it), if that is possible (because only 30 theaters in entire world are capable to show this movie in Imax 70mm) and you do so I promise you will experience something very special that you never did and you will never forget.

Oppenheimer (2023) is an extraordinary film that captivated my senses from start to finish. This historical drama, directed by the brilliant Christopher Nolan, weaves a mesmerizing narrative that delves deep into the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the brilliant physicist whose work changed the course of history during World War II.

Review_Title: One time to watch Oppenheimer, is not sufficient.
Review: The movies indeed has excellent story telling and it is very long complex story, covering it in 3 hours should be challenging task, but but are talking about Christopher Nolan, so it will be casual for him. I'm saying it, is and should be excellent a movie. I confess I did not understand all the movie, I think will take 4 or 5 times of watching.(I don't have five hundred characters for fill my movie review to post this review, so I'm posting my predicaments of filling five hundred characters in the review so it become five hundred characters. Oh god it need more characters, twenty more to go. Done)

Stop comparing Oppenheimer to anything at all what's important is everyone knowing the truth about J robert Oppenheimer, people are supporting a fictional character movie instead of a biography of the greatest person ever existed, his sufferings, the misbehave, the boycott, the pain, Oppenheimer changed the world, Oppenheimer ended world war, Oppenheimer invented the great thing ever to exist, but people think something else is more important than that, but people laughed in the hall where Oppenheimer was playing, the sad thing is that people don't even understand the movie this movie is a feeling.

Unnecessarily timelines (that in memento were reasonable), too much presence of scientists (should have subtitles scientists name in their appearances)i think most viewers were from science background, they could have been comfortable if scientists name appeared as subtitles , background music was as expected, enjoyed it to fullest,cillian murphy is at his best. I expected Hiroshima scene ,should have been in to add some emotions, christopher need to learn a lot from Rajamouli in adding emotions,frankly speaking those who are admiring the movie are not rating honestly, half of viewers were leaving out in half time.
Christopher Nolan is BACK!!! This movie was everything that Dunkirk tried to be, but couldn't.

Review_Title: Meh? Why all the hype? Are movies that bad anymore?
Review: 6.5 at best. I'm mid-60's in age and grew up with the fear of atomics. I've always been fascinated with this era and at some level, very interested in the technology used to develop and test the device, and the politics and military's demand to use during war-time. This movie did touch on some of the thinking present during that time leading to the decisions. I enjoy learning, reading, and watching anything to do with WWII. My father was in the war, so I have some ties to this. Growing up on the West coast (of CA) I was in close proximity to many of the research areas, such as Stanford, and Lawrence Livermore Labs.

Review_Title: Caught at firt my attention and ended in a boring disaster
Review: As a movie fan I consultetd some critics before I went to the cinema. I already apprehended that the movie would just scratch the surface of the complex oppenheimer-saga.

I didn't even know who Julius Robert Oppenheimer was until the announcement of the movie was made (forgive me that I only focused on histories in my country), so I did a lil bit of research before watching the movie and learned all about the Manhattan Project, Navajo miners, the Trinity Test, the Oppenheimer security hearing, the Chevalier incident, and McCarthyism.
Probably the best Nolan movie ever.

There is a moment. Right after the detonation. We see the horrific realisation on his face in a realm of silence. The pure form of terror in its most subtle form as he understands what he has done. And just for a moment you realise along with him that the world has been changed.

I've never watched a movie where i had to sit down after. I watched the movie with friends and whats crazy too there was no discussing the movie after. Everyone just sat down quietly and let that masterpiece sink in. Watched in in 70 mm and it was amazing. Felt like i was pulled into the story. The cast is elite, the screenplay is gorgeous to look at and the soundtrack fits the movie perfectly. I've read many criticisms about the pace but all i can say is that everyone i saw in the cinema was watching the movie amazed with undivided attention. The ending also was made so elegant that it blew my mind for a second. In conclusion: Oppenheimer is probably the best movie i've ever seen.

Apart from exceptional acting, what grips you is the handling of the storyline. The way things move in about three timelines doesn't let you feel the joy of the Trinity test. The celebrations by the team of scientists, though we found reasonable at the time, it also connects us with the absurdity of the nuclear arms race. The revelation about Strauss comes at right time. There are so many thoughts one comes out with introspecting about. Loved the storytelling, art of movie making. The background music and the sound effects are excellent in raising the anxiety and other emotions. Cinematography is excellent and creates the period before us.

Review_Title: An immensive cinematography with an immersive story
Review: As expected nothing less from the legendary director, the movie doesn't fail to meet up your expectations in fact it exceeds your expectations through the roof.

Review_Title: A little overly ambitious, but still a good film
Review: The pacing will take you aback at first; Oppenheimer meets and divorces his wife within 5 minutes, but it's the price to pay to set the context for the two big moments later in the film.
Wow, a three non-stop caprivating hours at the cinema. Fantastic acting actoss the board, especially from Cillian, Robert and Emily, they all deserve Oscar nominations.

Christopher Nolan is a mastermind at coming up with novel concepts like in Inception, Memento and Tenet. That's what makes him Nolan in my humble opinion. He has also proved to be a genius when it comes to action fantasies like in The Batman Trilogy. Nolan is also the best when it comes to thrillers whether they are sci-fi thrillers such as Interstellar or war thrillers such as Dunkirk or psychological thrillers such as The Prestige and Insomnia. So he experiments with different genres and here he is, yet again, embarking on a whole new genre, biographical movies! Most biographical movies are boring, lame and empty but this one is the best biopic I've ever seen. I mean, the black and white scenes, the loud bombing in the IMAX theatre, the storytelling and the phenomenal score in the background, all of that fits together really well in a 3 hour screenplay that takes you away from reality and makes you lose your sense of time. When the credits rolled I was in shock knowing that 3 hours had just passed by because to me it literally felt like 30 minutes. It was unbelievable. However, I think Chris Nolan is poor at writing drama. It's his biggest weakness and unfortunately Oppenheimer is only about personal drama so it doesn't have any aspects at which Nolan could show his strengths. The drama in Oppenheimer was not deep enough and didn't hit hard enough. I would give it 7.5/10 but this website doesn't allow fractions so I can only choose between 7 or 8 and I went with 7 haha. I think you can find poor drama in all Nolan movies as well but that's not always obvious because most of his work is not about drama alone unlike Oppenheimer. The most obvious example is Tenet, it doesn't have any emotions or drama and If not for the brilliant concept in Tenet, the whole movie would have been a total waste of time. I don't know how can Nolan improve in drama writing. It's the only flaw in Oppenheimer. Nonetheless, I'm a big fan of Christopher Nolan and I enjoyed watching Oppenheimer.

At the end of the day, what is the ultimate goal of any movie? It's to present a character or a list of characters in such a way that you give a damn about what happens to them. You care about their successes and their failures. They may be the type of people that you personally have never met, or ever will, yet you still see some common human element between yourself and the character/s in question. Oppenheimer is a failure at the level of making me care about Oppenheimer the person.

Review_Title: Exactly what you expect: literally blown away by this superb art
Review: From the moment I say the first trailer, I knew I had to see this movie in the cinema's. Luckily, I was able to see the movie in a IMAX cinema yesterday and boy oh boy. This film ticks all the boxes. With ease it joins the ranks into my top 20 movies of all time. And that for a movie enthusiast that has seen a lot of excellent movies (top 100 idmb e.g.).

Nothing is perfect but Nolan makes it seam like it is eazy. The cinematography is beautiful, characters are human really relatable and grounded, there is a journey in this movie. The topic is everpresent and shows the first light of Atomic age. The man plagued with his doings not only the atom bomb but the implications of it, which only becomes evident after the first successful testing of the bomb in New Mexico,but the biggest turmoil in Robert is yet to come when he realises that the bomb will be used on civilians the real struggle begins. The movie doesn't shy away from the ugly and disturbing but it doesn't show it directly but Nolan lets our imagination run amok putting bits of information that are like a partial puzzle which we complete in our minds. Can't say a bad thing about Nolan's work or this movie he had more beautiful ones but never so human and never close to us. One more thing the practical effects on the blast and the way it is was filmed my god breathtaking, mesmerising to look at in short a treat for eyes and mind.

Review_Title: Now I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds
Review: It is a wonderful movie and I enjoyed watching it. The movie contains the wonderful drama that we miss in our time, and it also contains many beautiful dialogues that make you live every second in the movie and also the characters in the movie who played their role in an impressive way such as Cillian Murphy who quoted the character and also Robert Downey Jr. And all the actors with sound effects and the good thing is that you did not use visual effects and that makes you live the reality and live that era in time (Now I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds) It's really cool, great work, Nolan.
Fantastic.......

"Oppenheimer" is an extraordinary cinematic achievement that delves into the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the brilliant physicist and leader of the Manhattan Project. The film skillfully weaves together historical accuracy with captivating storytelling, offering viewers a deep insight into the complexities of his character and the moral dilemmas faced during the creation of the atomic bomb. With outstanding performances and breathtaking cinematography, "Oppenheimer" keeps audiences engaged from start to finish. A must-watch for history enthusiasts and anyone seeking a thought-provoking cinematic experience.
Enjoyable things a person can do. When we feel joy, we watch a movie, and on holidays and feasts, we watch movies. Even when we feel depressed, we can only see a movie.

Review_Title: A Mix of Quality Ingredients and Missed Opportunities
Review: Oppenheimer is a very typical Christopher film in that it features many of his routine trademarks, strengths, and weaknesses. It has the loud, intense score and sound design that he is known for, which I found effective here. It has beautiful production design and cinematography. It has a wonderful and very deep cast. Cillian Murphy is fantastic. However, that wonderful and very deep cast includes very few women, and Emily Blunt and Florence Pugh are largely wasted.

I love Nolan's films for their ability to pierce my mind with emotions, to bring tears. I didn't expect it to be the same with this biographical drama, but I was wrong. Repeatedly catching the state of numbness of the body, a lump in the throat and the inability to move, the tears themselves came out involuntarily. A whirlwind of wonderful visuals and an unsurpassed musical part just slams you into the cinema seat and keeps you in suspense for a long time.

I wanted to rate this higher, but it was a struggle to watch the first two hours. We saw this in a Regal RPX theater and the musical score was deafening. I don't know if others feel the same way but there were many parts where I didn't make out the dialogue. The jumping around between scenes combined with the booming soundtrack underneath made it extremely difficult for me to understand what was happening at all times. I'll have to watch this again, at home, with the subtitles on. That being said, the third and final hour of the movie absolutely blew me away. Wow. We already know Oppenheimer made the bomb. We know the bombs were used on Japan (and WHY didn't Nolan show us that!??) But the AEC security commission review "trial" and the Senate nomination hearings for Lewis Strauss (Robert Downey Jr's role) could have been a standalone movie all by itself and I loved it. I read a lot of people didn't like the third hour but I completely disagree. It's the other way around for me.
Pathetic jump scares. Unnecessary nudity. An hour too long.

This movie is a literal masterpiece. One of the best movies I have seen. The story is truly astonishing, the cinematography wonderful. It feels like there is always something happening in the movie, its a complex story with lots of ups and downs but i you actually get the story and what is happening, it feels like a truly amazing film. Probably will be the best movie of the year. I will recommend this film to anyone just maybe not children under 14 because of sex scenes in some parts of the movie. I love to watch it again and experience this astonishing movie. I cant say nothing more than just go and watch the movie, cant say anything about it.

In the world of film, Christopher Nolan holds a high bar for storytelling. With 'Oppenheimer,' he once again proves why he's at the top of his game. The film is a rich tapestry of skill and creativity, leaving the audience captivated from start to finish.

Before I start this review I would very much like to declare that I am a Nolan fan and without a doubt amidst this 'Barbenheimer' phenomenon I watched this biopic of one of the most controversial administrative theoretical physicist in and around second world war. So I'll talk about the bad things first
After I came out of the theater I was perplexed ,jarred,astonished by this sheer creation. But I wasn't able to entirely attach myself with the character of Oppenheimer. I think non linear timeline works very well with a thriller ,political drama, scientific discovery with a race against time ,but it wasn't able to bring out the vastness , depths of oppie's character. So what we've got is an edge of the seat thriller at the expense of deep emotional connection with the protagonist,like when you see Forrest Gump you feel like him, life actually becomes a box of chocolates,when you see Shawshank redemption you want redd to find where Andy is and their union brings tears of joys to your eyes. But in Oppenheimer when after a long legal battle you remember how the pawns are placed and power game is played ,director doesn't give you a breathing moment to understand Oppenheimer's own version. Was he a commie? Was he not ? Who knows ?

Nolan is back again in the game. Always using great shots, good actors, nagnificent performances and scenarios, making it ideal. The trama is good, it keeps you in the edge of your seat, nail bitting conversations, and helping with the memory on flashbacks to the characters with a lot of lastnames and not too many background for each (except Einstein), to improve the experience of the mlvie. Even with 3 hours long, it never felt like more than a 2 hour film, because it was so intense and you are so deep in the trama, that you dont see the time flow. Romantic scenes are short and precise, so it is a great overal movie to watch. Band reminds you to interstellar and Batman, so it is a great gesture. Psycho is intense with mind blowing scenes that leave you thinking on what could happen.

Review_Title: The best movie of Christopher Nolan
Review: Oppenheimer is one of those films that manages to continue catching you despite reaching its ecstatic point (When the trinity test ends) and that manages to link a story from which there are so many points of view. The characters are excellently portrayed, a special mention to Cillian Murohy and Robert Downey Jr, they must be at the Oscars. The music is not far behind, it accompanies the scenes very well and manages to create that drama. One of my favorite scenes is when Oppenheimer gives his speech in front of the participants of the Manhattan experiment in Los Alamos after breaking the news of the "success" of the Atomic Bomb, it is here where we see the change of thought and behavior of a man who, trying to save the world, started a war worse than he expected. A movie is good and unique when it lasts 3 hours and during the 3 hours you are attentive to what happens in the plot, Oppenheimer manages to do that and keep viewers on edge throughout the movie.

Review_Title: This isn't just another film, this truly reveals...
Review: This isn't just another film, this truly reveals what a moviegoing experience still can be in todays age. Absolute masterclass on complicated filmmaking sequencing, Nolan's entire filmmaking career has led up to this film. The film was not too long it was literally the perfect length for the range in timelines, the people complaining have the attention span lesser than a goldfish. (Keep in mind people are creating new accounts to lower the rating of this film lmao) Nolan likes to space things out in his movies, but Oppenheimer comes together like a crescendo at different rapid pace. I especially want to mention how movie theaters are doing less screenings every year now, people think it's the end of movie going. It doesn't have to be because 70mm perf. IMAX is a solution, yes it is expensive to film and distribute. But the grossing numbers keep climbing every single day, breaking box office records and also constantly sold out in true 70mm 5-perf. IMAX showings.

Review_Title: One-off concession to my own rule to stick to perfect scores
Review: I am contemplating a biopic.. my own. At 62, I have grown larger than I could have, had I had a hurdle free life much larger than I could have envisaged when I arrived in a new country at 25. And I was researching movies that I would rate 10, or some thing I could watch over and again and still find domethong new to take home. And kept a log of my research through imdb reviews.

This movie will become a classic. I watched this movie in theaters and it will certainly take a while to process. Its essentially a biography of Oppenheimer's life, but with a focus on the period around the manhattan project. It was truly a very ponderous movie that presents many moral questions, especially pertaining to the the atomic bomb. The inclusion of practical effects by Christopher Nolan added levels of realism and immersion that left me feeling like I was really at the trinity test. I left the theater astounded. My only strife might be that the short nudity and sex scenes didn't really add much to the story. Overall an exceptional film.

Review_Title: I expected lots of things - certainly not what i got
Review: Christopher Nolans Filmography is one of the most respected of all time. And I think it´s deserved. But this time Nolan did not nearly reach the level of his previous movies. Oppenheimer starts so confusing you can not grasp what is going on. The timelines switch almost randomly and scenes that feel important are stopped just to pick them up again at a random point later on.

Review_Title: Even by sheer force of will I couldn't bring myself to watch this movie
Review: Even by an effort of will I couldn't bring myself to watch this movie. I wanted to understand why this movie made everyone around me crazy. What's so interesting about it. But I couldn't, for me watching this movie is a real torture. The most tedious, useless movie and without any sense in the history of cinema. What does this movie carry? What does this movie teach? What is interesting about this movie? Where is this world going? It is safe to fall asleep while watching this movie. A total disappointment in modern cinema. When movies like this "about nothing" collect all the awards. Two and a half hours of wasted time.

Its the beat movie that i have watched in a while the acting the cast wow people who understand movies will know how good this movie was done cilan the actor whi played oppeenhaimer deserves oscar for his roll Hi's acting was priceless just beautiful You fell like your experiencening the movie with the actors in ever way and shows you how the bomb really changed the word einsten was a beautiful touch to the movie also i hope people understand how a good of a jop they did in this movie and understand how nolan and cilan give it there all in this movies they definitely deserve unaward for this movie..

Review_Title: Go watch this Movie In IMAX right now !!!
Review: Holy moly . Where do I start . I was dreading going to watch a movie three hours long but Wow , just wow . This movie does not feel long as you get sucked in to the story and the excellent performances by Cillian Murphy , Robert downy JR and the rest of the excellent A list cast .
It is filmmaking at its best. This is CLASS A. It is in my Nolan top 4 for sure. Not ahead of Inception or Tenet, but somewhere near Dunkirk.

Review_Title: Feel the Weight of The Bomb
Review: The power of this movie, one of the absolute best in at least two decades, lies in it's amazing ability to make you the viewer experience the weight of the decisions and the gravity of the engineering the people involved made in making their choices. It's certainly a poignant drama about the people involved, and a biopic, and a wonderful delve into the physics, but the movie also engrosses us in the extraordinary revolutions of the time - including topics such as relativity in physics, communism, women's rights/equality, and at moments, even art. Blunt is amazing as is Murphy. Experience this in 70mm. The world changed in ways we still cannot fully understand, and everything else changed with the revolutions in science and thought. The genius of it lies not in its categorization of biography, but in its gripping, first person dramatization making you the viewer experience the emotional complexity of the decisions Oppenheimer and all the others made - and the haunting reminder that these weapons are forever with us all now, looming every second.

Review_Title: THE RAIN DROP WHAT HITS THE PUDDLE HARD: CONFLICTS OF THE GREAT AMERICAN PROMETHEUS
Review: "Now I have Become Death, the Destroyer of the Worlds"

Best movie of the year by a country mile.... All the aspects of the movie are just great. The story telling, acting, score, screenplay, cinematography,editing... just brilliant. This has to be Nolans magnum opus. Tenet was not so good.. Dunkirk was great... but this is just way ahead. His directing here is top notch.

Review_Title: Too fast, too many cuts, Am I getting old?
Review: Maybe I'm getting old, I don't know.. Im 31 so I guess that's not the case probably. I love love love love Nolan's movies. But this one didn't quite get me. Of course really good acting and the story was intriguing.

The way that Nolan show the things sometimes objective sometime subjective made the film to understand the way it goes to. I thought only before bomb scenes were there and I really thought that film is finished when the bomb drop down to Hiroshima. In the interrogation scenes the way turnover is like WOW. And while you watch the film you are into it you feel every emotion. Of course I don't need to say actors were really perfect. Casting was really fitted their character. I liked the Nolan showed politics not straight. (eg: He didn't mention Nazis at all) I mean that we are just watching oppenheimer not World War 2.

Review_Title: Important movie, but unnecessarily difficult to follow
Review: So... saw the movie "Oppenheimer" last night on opening night. Happy to see that against "Barbie," a movie about history was doing relatively well-theater packed. But this movie was done in typical Christopher Nolan film, most shots lasting 5 seconds or less resulting in a jumping narrative style, that when combined with the technical jargon and the too loud "Hans Zimmer-like" soundtrack made it difficult to understand, even for a physics-degreed guy wearing hearing aids.

One thing I don't like about this movie, there is a scene in this movie when oppenheimer was doing sex with his gf and using Hindu scripture Geeta phrase. If Christopher Nolan known for reality instead of VFX why doesn't he used real video reference and create separate scene for that movie. Before releasing, there was a hype about this movie because of Oppenheimer use the Geeta phrase after dropping the bomb by US army that was a reason, I was curious about to watch this movie but if you are not aware about physics & history, my suggestion for you do some RND first then you can watch this movie otherwise you will going to sleep on the chair. I think director doesn't explain movie so well.

I cannot find a word to express how I felt watching the movie, and not even a word to explain how I felt after. This film is at the top of the top, I believe this might be the best film in history and I am serious about that. I even feel grateful for being able to experience this journey. Nolan simply doesn't stop impressing, and I would like to thank him for creating this masterpiece. Cillian Murphy delivered the best performance I've seen, he was incredible. They deserve the oscars.

Review_Title: Most realistic portrayal of a biopic
Review: Your concience and eyes should be fully on the screen . Even a glimpse of a wavering second may kick you out of the plot. Consider reading a little history of Oppenheimer before watching, if you wish not to be Barbie in Physics class. Nolan with his brilliance has once again portrayed a majestic work. Casting has been perfect and you must spot mainly Cilian Murphy , Robert Downey ,Emily blunt and Matt Damon. Nolan gave significance to each detail of these characters . The explotion and the physics behind is shown in an intersting way. Oppenheimer's psychological state before and after bombing has been observed closely. The political tensions at that time and the egocentric attitude of leaders are shown well. Casting has just been perfect and an average cinephile may know all. I strongly recommend everyone to watch .

I've read so many books, watched so many movies, listened so many songs about the Herosima and Nagasaki incident. But for the first time ever my eyes were wet when that bombing part came in and also after finishing this film. I really felt for the poor japanese, I really felt the same guilt that Oppenheimer felt. Also, the timing cycle, the shifts, twists and turns of telling the life story of him(Oppenheimer) was brilliant. That's the success of the director and the whole team. Moreover, this film is worth watching. Although it's more than 180 minutes, I don't think anybody will feel bored. It also contains a great message for the world leaders and a warning sign for the coming future. At last, I think this is one of the most important films of the twenty first century.

If this movie does not win an Oscar for the best picture of the year... One of the best movies of all time, PERIOD! There is not a better way to portrait a story of the father of the atomic bomb and Christopher Nolan is the only guy right now, who could have done it. So many A-list actors. Through out the movie, you see more and more familiar faces, such as Casey Affleck and Gary Oldman. It never felt too long. We are so lucky to live in this era of Hollywood and to witness such movies. And what makes this movie even better, that there is ZERO CGI. Everything you see (or will see) is practical.

Review_Title: It's but doesn't deserve the Oscar
Review: Was expecting a lot from C. Nolan but he didn't deliver as expected. Music score was alright. Bomb detonation scene was solid. But the scenes following the detonation were boring. Half the audience slept half way through the movie. I think they really stretched out the whole thing a bit too much. Endgame being 3 hours made the audience sir tight every frame but it's the exactly opposite for Oppenheimer. Should have been a 7 max but the Bomb detonation scene being filmed without CGI made it a 8. Compared to Interstellar or Inception this is 5 i swear. I love Nolan but this isn't what i expected.

This film is great. Visually Stunning. Sound Mixing is top tier. I saw this a day before theatrical release in IMAX and if you want to get the full IMAX Experience, let it be this one. Whether you see it in IMAX or not you will fall in love with this film. But seeing it the way it was intended to be seen, it is an other worldly experience. The performances in this film are just phenomenal. Murphy is completely absorbed into this character and it is very clear through the screen. Emily Blunt also gives a very strong performance on screen, to be frank, she crushes it. Flat out. All I have to say is, see Oppenheimer in IMAX.

Review_Title: Overall a decent movie but not worth the hype
Review: The kind of movie which peaked at the moments leading to the main event rather than the main event. Honestly, was a bit disappointed considering the hype it got . The politics , which is there substantially in the film was kind of boring and lengthy . Not a fan of the explosion or the sound effects considering the hype the film got in that part

In one's life some things that come along simply blow you away and this movie is one of those things,! The cast of this movie not only were well chosen and brilliant acted. This has to be seen. It's hard to review this movie and not give away too much, but it's a complete and immersive experience which also explains what goes on in the back ground. I simply knew that people built a nuclear bomb and that two of them were dropped on Japan which bought the end to world war 2. A terrible time in our history. The audience in the cinema we went to were very respectful and the brilliance of the movie is why I hope movies like this continue to be made.

This was an exhausting movie. While Nolan shows respect to his audience by providing a challenging plot to keep up with, viewers must actively listen to all the dialogue to follow along, a task which lasts the entire 3 hours. While the music and some of the visuals are great, the characters were not likable. Their complexity was evident but somehow non of them were relatable. The plot was detailed but seemed somewhat revisionist. The communists, the Japanese, and the protagonist himself were shown to be unjustly victimized. The movie is full of tension but never quite delivers. The payoff was entirely un-atomic. I don't see myself re-watching this movie.

I did not enjoy this movie. The trailer led us all to believe it would be about the development of the atomic bomb. Instead it was a very convoluted and hard to follow story about the witch-hunt that followed involving Oppenheimer. Tedious in the extreme and way too long. What I disliked most of all was the nerve jangly, incessantly loud and constant soundtrack noise. I know Nolan likes to do this but it was out of control in this movie. It was like leaving your teenage boy to play death metal at full bore whilst you are try to meditate! I must have looked at my watch 50 times as to when it would be over. I very much appreciated Nolan's storytelling talents, and the excellent acting, but seriously, edit this movie please. I suggest a test audience cut instead of the directors cut.

What more can anyone say about Nolan movies!just his name on any poster make it an instant classic and blockbuster
The cinematography is at its best and soundtrack is really good and the acting from Robert Downey Jr is spectacular! Him and Cillian Murphy will be nominated for the Oscars for sure, and Emily blunt was great specially in a scene nearing the end of the movie.

Review_Title: Nolan has set a new bar for Cinema through Oppenheimer.
Review:
The story is adapted from "The American Prometheus" by Kai Bird and M. J. Sherwin, a Pulitzer price winner book. Nolan being an exemplary director, depicts why J. Robert Oppenheimer should be or shouldn't why he wasn't America's Prometheus (a Greek Titan who stole fire from gods and gave them to mortals and was chained to eternity for this act). The movie covers every aspect of his life, his highs and his lows, his selflessness and his pride and strives to achieve an accurate depiction of an character as complex as "The father of Atom Bomb". But it's not just Nolan that shines in this film, almost everyone on the screen is at their best. Cillian's portrayal of Oppenheimer must be his best job till date and that isn't an simple statement considering the actor of his caliber, so do Matt Damon, Emily Blunt, Florence Pugh and Robert Downey Jr. In their roles. Camerawork and Sound is another thing, Christopher Nolan has mastered, and like his most other movies, Oppenheimer is no different when it comes to
Cinematography and Sound design. I haven't seen it in 2D yet, but the movie seems to be explicitly tailor made for IMAX, so it comes as no surprise that movies seems even better in it.

Review_Title: A deep dive into physicist J. Robert Oppenheimer's life
Review: Oppenheimer is a dialogue heavy film that covers the development of the atomic bomb and the devastating impact and threat it posed to the world at the time and even nowadays.

The cinematic marvel titled "Oppenheimer" stands as an unparalleled testament to the power of visual storytelling. With impeccable videography and visionary direction, the film transcends the limitations of spoken language, captivating audiences through the sheer force of its evocative imagery. Every frame is a brushstroke on the canvas of emotion, crafting a symphony of visuals that speak volumes beyond words.

Review_Title: "Mesmerizing Masterpiece: Nolan's 'Oppenheimer' Stuns with Gripping Drama, Stellar Performances, and Immersive Cinematic Brilliance!"
Review:
SYNOPSIS
"Oppenheimer" is a gripping historical drama directed by Christopher Nolan, delving into the life of renowned scientist J. Robert Oppenheimer, who led the development of the atomic bomb during World War II. The film portrays Oppenheimer's moral dilemmas, political struggles, and the profound impact of his creation on humanity. Cillian Murphy delivers a mesmerizing performance as Oppenheimer, supported by a stellar ensemble cast including Robert Downey Jr, Emily Blunt, Matt Damon, and Florence Pugh. The film presents a compelling narrative intertwined with Nolan's signature non-linear storytelling.

Review_Title: Best acting and cinematography I've seen in a long long time.
Review: Where do I start?

With a decent screenplay and camerawork, Oppenheimer stands just above the surface of the worst. It's Cillian Murphy who makes you wanna sit and enjoy the 3 hours with his acting. The other cat members are also supportive to Nolan's good direction. There are certain scenes which are quite different from Nolan's previous movies, that's because it's a biopic. The first person experience and the court drama would make you feel bored but the sudden adrenaline of senses the music triggers just want to make you sit and watch what's gonna happen next. This movie and not for action lovers. It's kind of an new direction experiment film to Chris Nolan.

This is the first time writing here and surely is worth it. Watched the movie last night, after running in two places to find a spot, but was well worth it. The way Nolan mastered to give us the life of Oppenheimer, played exceptionally by Merphy, was something extraordinary with all the ups and downs on his life. Also it has made a 3 plus hour movie run so smoothly like i could go for another 3. All the cast was very good, but again Cilian Merphy has outdone himself, the look on his eyes for most of the movie, it's giving me goosebumps even now that am writing this. And of course what can i say about the cinematography! Go watch it in the best screen you could find.

Review_Title: Nolan, please return to the science fiction and adventure genres
Review: Oppenheimer is a good drama and biopic, but not an extraordinary movie like Nolan has done previously. As a fan, I would highly encourage him to return to his unique genres.

Review_Title: Well done but I just can't enjoy it.
Review: Great acting, extremely well made and constantly questions about the dangers of inventing nuclear weapons as you would expect.

I get the movie and length may not be to everyone's taste, but good lord did this film have me hooked for the entire runtime. During the trinity test sequence, I was biting my fingernails and could feel my heartbeat in my chest. I can't remember the last time I was at the cinema and a movie had me feeling like that. Murphy, Downey Jr and Blunt were outstanding in their roles, and everyone else was great too. The score and sound design were incredible too. The scene in the gymnasium was genuinely terrifying and will stick with me, I thought it was handled perfectly. I would highly recommend watching this at the cinema if you could!
One of the best movies that I have ever seen. Just amazing. Three hours of authentic Cinema.
Best acting performance ive ever seen in my entire life robert downy junior deserves an oscar.

This movie is one of Nolans best works so far. You see that his experience in previous movies comes together in this 180 minute journey. It's a mix of different ingredients, such as a history lesson, drama and thriller.
I have just read an article from CNN where they say that Openheimer is a film about the history of the creation of the atomic bomb.

Review_Title: Too fast for a 3 hour movie
Review: If you look somewhere else for a brief second you will miss a key detail or a line and it really ruins your day , for a three hour movie it really is hard to focus and understand but if you manage to stand still it really makes you think about perspectives and peoples point of view ,other than that it really is a masterpiece. You really feel the view of Oppenheimer and it makes you think about how unsecure people believe the whole world shapes around them. At the end though i dont have any think to say really, for a Nolan movie you probably can not leave the movie theater more satisfied and relieved.
Not sure why people are giving this a perfect 10, I'm also not sure why it's made nearly a billion dollars at the box office.

Review_Title: NOLAN DELIVERS A CHEF-D'OEUVRE - A VERY IMPORTANT FILM DISSECTING THE MIND OF THE MOST IMPORTANT MAN TO HAVE LIVED
Review: Magnum Opus! Is the word and feel that comes when you are watching this film. I am very grateful for having the opportunity to cherish this epic film by Christopher Nolan. It is grand - it is cinema at its finest. This film is one of the most important ones as it directly affects and influences our lives. It is about the man who gave the world the power to destroy itself!

Review_Title: Should have been a limited series
Review: In the middle of the "over the speed limit" pacing of the movie i was pretty much annoyed by all the lound music and jumpy cuts and moving your focus with lightning speed from one thing to another .

Review_Title: If Nolan was not directed this movie, then how would you rate it?
Review: I am a huge fan of Christopher Nolan, and I was really excited to see his latest film, Oppenheimer. I drove 45 minutes to the theater to see it in IMAX, and I was prepared to be blown away.

Review_Title: A1 to the cast, the soundtrack, and the direction. Nolan delivers yet again, and he delivers brilliance.
Review: Yet another massive achievement by Christopher Nolan; indeed a culmination of his entire life's work. Cillian Murphy exceeded expectations with his extraordinary performance. I'll be surprised if the man doesn't win an Oscar for this one. He was....something else. He was magical. The soundtrack was so brilliant, it almost carried the movie on its back; It made the simplest scenes/ shots of the movie SO incredibly powerful, I had goosebumps the entire time I was watching it. Every single actor (esp RDJ and Matt Damon) gave an incredibly special and memorable performance that I could not help but but wish to give them a big hug for the exceptional delivery. The movie was a tad bit long, but I believe that the extra time was needed to give the audience proper context, to ensure that the audience 'feels' the ending the way Nolan intended for them to. A masterpiece, truly.

Known for his science fiction, Christopher Nolan has always bent the boundaries when it comes to cinema. However, the way he managed to balance everything together was nothing short of almost perfect. There is no CGI in this movie, and the way he was able to capture a miniaturized explosion with that level of visual is just captivating. He's always been able to manage balancing innovative visual ideas and constantly manages to keep the story interesting while managing to respect the viewers themselves. When they test the bomb in the movie, I told my girlfriend to get ready and I had my feet braced like I was there for the test. What came next was silence and then pure power! The score to this film is beyond anything I've hear either. I was extremely interested when he chose to not to use Zimer as usual for his scoring of the film. However, Ludwig Goransson's music will have you melting in your seats. I've don't have the words to describe it. My head followed the camera. My ears were constantly on alert. The scenery was almost to good to be true. I really thought what he did with Dunkirk and stepping out of the sci-fi realm was his best work, but I can't wait to watch this again. 10/10.

This is just a cinematic masterpiece, but, the minutes leading to the bomb test moment and reaching that climax... the entire room just suddenly became absolutely silent. You couldn't even hear people breathing, it would literally be possible to hear a fly... what a moment that was. From that moment on until the end of the movie every body was apprehensive. I think is the best way to put it.

Review_Title: A Great Director Explores How Great Men Fall
Review: What happens to a man after he has made his finest achievements? How does he react to being sidelined when his usefulness to those in power runs thin? If you're expecting Oppenheimer to be another Nolan high-concept premise, these two questions are as close as you'll get; what you'll get instead is perhaps Nolan's first masterpiece.
Where to begin..... Oppenheimer is a movie 3 hours long, Christopher Nolan has cleverly set the pace of the film to make it feel like you're only there for 2.

I had an exceptionally delightful day watching a movie by one of the greatest directors of our generation. This film truly captivated me, from the very first scene until the last. I must confess that when the movie concluded, I found myself gazing at the screen, with one thought endlessly repeating in my mind: how remarkably cruel people can be. It left me craving more of this masterful masterpiece. In this movie, Nolan presents the true battle between good and evil in a dramatically captivating way. The music in the film was absolutely outstanding, earning a perfect 10/10 rating. I wish there were more scenes of Jean.

Review_Title: A snooze and then lip read
Review: Chopping back and forth eras during the story was annoying and completely unnecessary but what was most annoying was that the dialogue was overwhelmed by background 'music' so the ability to lip read was an advantage. I beg you to refrain from adding 'music/noise' when the excellent actors were speaking as it degrades the product. Undoubtedly the acting and actors were superb as, could have been, the story line. In my opinion the film could have been 140 minutes long. Again, I feel compelled to add that, at times, it was extremely difficult to hear the dialogue. Please consider the audience of all ages.

Cillian Murphy was not an ordinary actor, he was a robot controlled by Chris to show the performance and personality in this way. At a moment I felt that this is the life of the real Cillian Murphy and not acting. I expect the Oscars to be settled for Killian. To be the highest rated movie in history. The film's shortcomings are few, including the way in narrating the events that is not considered a defect, because Chris liked to move between the past, present and future frequently. In the end, some people may not like this type of film, and this is normal, but I think that they are less than affecting such creativity. If you want a sentence to describe the movie (creativity at its best)

Review_Title: Good but not easy to unterstand
Review: Hello guys, first of all I'm sorry for my bad English I'm using my translator microphone. Hard to understand because it's going very fast. People who don't know about history, probably won't understand anything about the movie. Some scenes took my breath away.. I cried. At the beginning of the movie, I felt like the whole film is like a trailer. Because 80% of the movie is with background, music and talking. I liked it, but I wish it was a little bit easier to understand the actress also was perfect. Laughter you can see famous actors like from Drake and Josh or Mr. Robot. Have a nice day and sorry for this English.

I don't know what compelled me to watch this movie in theatre IMAX. They truly spend a lot on marketing, and it worked. I was one of those who thought Tenet was one of the worst movies ever made, but I gave Nolan the benefit of the doubt because of Interstellar. Lo and behold, he went right ahead and made another long and pointless movie about nothing.

Review_Title: Exactly what you need when you want to feel something.
Review: The acting and directing are amazing. The lines hidden within every series of act will stuck with you. Very precise storytelling, it make you feel what exactly how you have to feel with every minute of it. The plots are complex but not confusing. All the conversations put together can be a little overwhelming, but overall, it draws back to the point every once in a while. Cillian Murphy is killing it, an awesome acted piece, same, makes you feel exactly how you need to feel with Oppenheimer. You can easily cry hard just watching the takes of his big close ups. The whole cast wonderfully acted as well. The soundtrack, the editing, it's a film with all fine arts putting together.

Review_Title: A Masterful Journey Through History: Strong Message, Cinematic Triumph
Review: Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer delivers an immersive blend of sadness and fear, unfolding the nonlinear narrative of J. Robert Oppenheimer's life. The portrayal of human folly and pursuit of power is chilling. Pacing, sound, and editing create an unparalleled cinematic experience. Cillian Murphy's astonishing performance deserves Oscar. Robert Downey Jr. Shines as his complicated associate. Background knowledge enhances the film's impact. A future classic with a powerful historic message; challenges the audience to contemplate the consequences of human actions; a must-see for all film lovers.
