It's very rare you come across any medium of art which captivates you with just one glance. And I can say for sure that Oppenheimer was that very reality. There is absolutely no doust that Nolan is a brilliant visionary and above all, he is a genius when it comes to story telling and cinematography. His mind bending techniques in movies are praiseworthy. In Oppenheimer he delivered everything to its finest be it the production, direction, cinematography or music. When it comes to acting, I want to applaud Cillian Murphy for his outstanding performance. With so much of screen time, his performance was nothing but a cohesive masterpiece. He is a wonderful and one of the finest actors we have and to see him give his heart and soul to this character truly makes you realize of his talent and passion for acting & movies. Emily Blunt, Robert DJ, and the entire supporting cast were at their best. The movie is a wonderful cohesion and amalgamation of pure excellence. It has to be one of the best movies we have seen in a longest while. Nolan as always lived upto the hype and it has to be one of his best works. It's a must watch and definitely a 10/10!!

This is Nolan's best film by far and Kilian Murphy's work is amazing. He played very inspiring, if not for Killian I think Oppenheimer would not be so interesting. I really liked the fact that this film, although about science, managed to combine love, humor, and much more, and the viewer does not get bored watching the film. Every minute is interesting as Nolan himself stated. I'm still collecting my thoughts after experiencing this film, Cillian Murphy might as well start clearing a space on his mantle for the Best Actor Oscar. This film is a masterclass in weaving narratives and different time periods while exploring the profound depths of a man whose actions altered the world's trajectory forever, for better or worse. Nolan brings us into the complexities of Oppenheimer, and all the moral conflicts stirring within him. Murphy's portrayal is so riveting that the long run-time became an afterthought. Robert Downey Jr also offers a great performance and Nolan's push and pull with how he uses sound design throughout is the cherry on top. Some viewers might need a brief refresher on WWII and Cold War history, but any film lover should be happy to willingly lose themselves in this film for hours on end.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer: The Movie That Will Make You Wish You Had a Bomb Shelter
Review: Oppenheimer is not just a movie, it is an experience. It is a movie that will take you on a journey through the mind and soul of the man who changed the course of history. The movie is a masterpiece of filmmaking, with amazing acting, directing, writing, and production. The movie is visually stunning, with scenes that will make you gasp, cry, and marvel. The movie is also audibly stunning, with sound effects and music that will make you feel every emotion and tension. The movie is not for the casual viewer, as it requires some prior knowledge of Oppenheimer and his era, and it does not shy away from the dark and disturbing aspects of his story. But if you are willing to invest your time and attention, you will be rewarded with a movie that will enrich your mind and touch your heart. Oppenheimer is a movie that you have to see on the big screen, as it is a spectacle that will blow you away. It is one of the most movies that I like, and I'm sure you will agree. This movie deserves all the praise and recognition it can get, and I hope you will give it a chance. Trust me, you won't regret it.

"Oppenheimer" is an extraordinary cinematic experience that leaves audiences awe-inspired with its mesmerizing visual elements. The film's visual prowess is unparalleled, taking viewers on a breathtaking journey through time. From the elaborate set designs to the captivating special effects, every frame is a work of art that transports you to the World War II era.

I expected more to be honest , I was all hyped up for this film just for it to be 3 hours and I didn't even understand anything , all talk and the bomb just explodes in like 20 minutes or sum , you should never ever mix between future , present and past . That's what he did , Gave it a 7 because filming was good so were the explosions also comedy in it is kinda good , I was happy that it didn't contain CGI , honestly if I watched mission impossible it would be better . I really am sad and that is the reason , after all the hype and they say its gonna be the best film in history,best film of the year,etc...

I've watched a lot of movies in my 18 years on this planet but never have I been this focused on a movie, and that for 3 hours. There wasn't a moment during the film where I was wondering when it ended or when I got bored and wondered off with my mind. No, for every second of this movie I was completely immersed with what played out on screen. I'm a massive fan of Nolans work but this movie surpassed all of my expectations tenfold. The only possible grade i could give it is a 10 just because of how amazed I am. The sets looks amazing and the visuals are stunning. The fact IMAX made a new camera just for this movie says it all about Nolans work. He, just like Oppenheimer, is a genius.
I imagined those people face who went to watch explosion but end up getting their own head explode.

This movie is very well done and the actors are top notch. Excellent soundtrack! However, it is rather boring. Like an unnecessarily long, overly complicated, theatrical documentary. Beforehand I was concerned that I might have to go for a toilet break during the THREE HOURS. Turns out I didn't, but I could have gone anytime between minute 30-90 and basically in the whole last hour. Also, Emily Blunt's obvious Botox/fillers really disturbed the experience for me - it made me very aware of the fact that I was watching an actress and not the character. I get the whole "double punishment" debate but don't think it has a place in the movie industry without context. It only messes with the absurd beauty standards even more to normalise it.

Review_Title: One of the Best work from Christopher Nolan, Simply Extraordinary
Review: My favourite movie of all time is Christopher Nolan's 2008 Batman Dark Night. He did it again, delivering historical magic to the Imax cinematic world, and also changed our modern filmmaking method. Astonishing performance from Cillian, with beautiful cinematography capturing the magnificence of an atomic explosion. A refreshing and innovative film highlighting the challenges Oppenheimer faced as the person controlling the life and death of people through his invention, his struggles due to his background and his jealousy of his peers.

Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer is a sweeping, epic biopic that tells the story of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the theoretical physicist who led the Manhattan Project to develop the atomic bomb. The film is a visual and intellectual tour-de-force, with Cillian Murphy giving a tour-de-force performance as Oppenheimer.

"Prometheus stole fire from the gods and gave it to mankind. For this he was chained to a rock and tortured for eternity."
What a way to start this rollercoaster. Christopher Nolan has more than succeeded in giving his audience what they expected with the epic biopic Oppenheimer, in which he revisits World War II after Dunkirk. As with all of Nolan's films, with the exception of a few glaring points, this is undoubtedly one of the best blockbusters to come out in recent years. While expecting a more understandable and plain editing compared to Nolan's other films since this being a history film, Oppenheimer was perhaps one of his most difficult films to follow. Nolan, who persistently refuses to make a movie in chronological order, avoided writing a linear screenplay for this movie as well.

Biopics are often well presented and offer a deep storyline to keep you immersed. Nolan rightly chose to work on this film as I believe it's the best film I've ever seen. I'm lost for words when asked to describe my experience and thought of this film and I often resort to simple vocabulary like "it was amazing" or "I loved it" and not many people will recognise what I truly mean by that. Oppenheimer, directed by Christopher Nolan is a story based solely around J. Robert Oppenheimer, a Quantum Physicist who played a large role in the development of the atomic bomb. The film explores his life, his work and it is all presented through his eyes.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer: Christopher Nolan's Epic Journey into the Complex Mind of a Scientific Giant
Review:
Background:
"Oppenheimer," directed by the visionary Christopher Nolan, is a historical biopic that delves into the fascinating life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the renowned physicist known as the father of the atomic bomb. Set against the backdrop of World War II and the race to harness the power of nuclear fission, the film takes the audience on a riveting journey through Oppenheimer's personal struggles, scientific genius, and the profound moral implications of his groundbreaking work.

Review_Title: Probably the most serious film I have seen in theatre in a good way!
Review: Not your typical Summer Blockbuster but WOW what an amazing movie. If your going in expecting a lot of explosions and action scenes, Tom Cruise has you covered.

Nolan made some odd choices in this one, but nevertheless, it's a glorified version of "Fatman and Little Boy." Without giving away SPOILERS, the third act is about a Senator creating a fake file in order to smear Oppenheimer in order to keep him off the Atomic Energy Commission. Nice of Nolan to illustrate the overreach of both the FBI and the US Government.

Just had the most INCREDIBLE movie in years! Mesmerized by the visuals, and the SOUNDTRACK? It had my heart pounding the whole time! And let's talk about Cillian Murphy's eyes. Deserve an Oscar all on their own! Chris Nolan's brilliance shines through again! This is one of the best movies you will ever watch. Cillian absolutely steals the show. I have never imagined Robert Downey Jr. Giving such an immaculate performance. Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and all other supporting casts did an incredible job. A huge thanks to Chris and the incredible cast & crew for giving us this unbelievable cinematic experience.

Review_Title: Was this a film or a three hour trailer?
Review: This was a great film. The writing, characters and acting were fantastic, but I couldn't get over the feeling I was watching a three hour movie trailer.

Imagine arriving at the airport, ready to board a flight, only to discover that the plane has no engines. Consequently, there will be no trip. Well, this movie is no different. It lacks taste, is tedious, excessively long, and lacks a solid vision or cinematography. Christopher Nolan's amateurish script, underdeveloped characters, unnecessary soundtracks, and arrogant cinematic perspective have ruined the film. I fail to comprehend the overhyped praise surrounding this movie. Furthermore, the recommendation to watch it in IMAX theaters is baffling. Additionally, the movie focuses on Oppenheimer, yet even after enduring a lengthy three hours, there are numerous gaps in the storyline, leaving me feeling the need to conduct extensive research to grasp how and why these events occurred.
Murphy and Robert both does an incredible performance. For how little Robert is actually on screen, he makes such an impact that he is always on ur mind.

Oppenheimer was a great and very well crafted historical interpretation from Chris Nolan. Even as someone who doesn't know the ins and outs of this particular era of history, this movie served as a great look into the past. I had been waiting to see this movie for months ever since I heard it was going to be released in July. I think that with other movies that are highly anticipated sometimes they let you down even if they aren't that bad, it's just because they weren't perfect. In this case the anticipation was not a problem and after the movie I can wholeheartedly say this is one of if not the best movie I've ever seen, not only in theatres but ever.

Just back from a Dolby Screening of Oppenheimer and I thought it was a mind blowing experience and Nolan pulled a rabbit out of the hat with this team. Screenplay and editing made the movie move at a rapid pace despite the movie fundamentally is a dialogue driven drama. Technically its easily one of the best movies made. That includes cinematography, editing, sound mixing and visual effects.

Christopher Nolan does it again Oppenheimer has got to be one of the best three hours that I've experienced in 2023. I was really excited about this movie when it was announced and it did not disappoint, even though it is three hours long I feel like that's the adequate amount of time that it needs. Cillian Murphy's performance of the character is just beautifully done, he nailed it. I was also a big fan of the music used in the background throughout the movie. It's just amazing the scenery that it takes place it's beautiful. I like how they tease you with the atomic bomb throughout the movie until the final moment. Cillian Murphy definitely deserve an Oscar for his performance.

This film changed me, christopher Noland art of the cinema is at its greatest here and this experience is second to none other than interstellar. If you can, watch it. While the plot can be slightly complicated after the moment (which is without a doubt the most nerveracking scene ever made) the film still maintains its unbelievably powerful nature. I am someone who is rarely emotionally affected by films however this film was the second to ever make me shed tears. While I was close to crying the entire film, it finally broke at the intense ending, which I believe will stay with me for the rest of my life.

I love this movie so much. This is Christopher Nolan's chance to finally show off at the Oscar's, Oppenheimer is definitely in the Top 2 of his filmography, but Nolan isn't the only one who is a candidat for the Oscar's. Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr and even Emily Blunt are all contenders at the next years Oscar's. The score.... probably there's soooo much recency bias in me, but I consider Oppenheimer to have the greatest score ever composed. Yeah, above Interstellar, Inception and everything else. This is a clear 10 out of 10 for me. Alone the fact how much money this movie makes at the box office as an R rated biopic, is incredible.

The acting and production values are up to Christopher Nolan's standards. Cillian Murphy was a great choice to play J. Robert Oppenheimer - that said, there were long stretches where his deadpan portrayal evoked little emotion (in me) regarding his complex character.
Highly intriguing, best screenplay with Openheimer's state of mind in the centre.

Review_Title: Watched a good movie and Disappointed
Review: I went to the movie with an expectation to see a Nolan movie. In Memento, he stimulated our brains to ask questions about human memory, in Interstellar about the dimensions of the universe, time and gravity, in Tenet about time, in Prestige electricity and teleportation, in Inception... you got my point. Even on Batman series, his touch was able to make it the most grounded comic movie and achieve intellectual stimulation.
Matt Damon as a fatter version of himself, playing a general with jokes. Totally unconvincing. Just doesn't have the gravitas to play a military general. Miscasting.

This film is a 100% accurate telling of oppenheimer from his early days of studying university of quantum theory right through to the day the he gets old and tells us the powerful yet terrifying story of the atomic bomb on hiroshima and the destruction it causes and how it destroys the life of its creator and the regret in his eyes that you witness after he's launched the bomb along with a haunting witness viewing of the film the soundtrack is hauntingly beautiful which fits really well with the soundtrack a few quotes I will never forget "I have blood on my hands" "they won't fear it until they understand it" "they won't understand it until they've used it" "theory will only take you so far " "I don't know if we can be trusted for such a weapon but we have no choice" you see his the breakdown of his relationships and people turn against him the entire government after what happens in hiroshima at the end you have a shot of oppenheimer in shock after the bomb hits hiroshima and the devastation that it has caused and the sadness and shock in his eyes which you see throughout the process of the bomb and regret and uncertainty from him and his scientists about what he's doing and the ending sums up his journey from the beginning to the aftermath of bomb and what he's done with an atomic weapon of mass destruction and they're plenty of stunning shots and at the beginning of the film you see hints of the bombs explosion which looks beautiful as well as terrifying and you see his ptsd affect him the trauma of the bomb that must have given him nightmares forever
This is a must watch a serious 1-1 documentation of oppenheimers life on the atomic weapon a must see for historians or anyone interested in Oppenheimers work I a stacked cast of well known faces that make the movie all the more interesting and its a rarity to see a lot of famous cast together in one big movie event Cillian Murphy as Oppenheimer delivers a powerful. Performance as oppenheimer as you see the terror in his eyes and how he uses his eyes to act is just incredible and really does steal the show I hope that he gets nominated for an Oscar as he knocked it out of the park and the director the 🐐 christopher nolan who directed and produced this movie should get an Oscar for a scary ride of emotions of shock and fear throughout as I mentioned in my previous post the cast all do incredible with what they're given and deliver powerful performances like Jean tatlock and kitty and their character develoment with oppenheimer the sex scenes are powerful and beautiful to witness. The star studded cast is also what makes this film special and you feel like you are transporter back in time to this very moment this is a masterpiece I give this film a 9.5/10 a must see movie that I cannot recommend enough.

My husband and I watched this movie last night and it could not be any better. Right from the opening scene, the movie captivated us with its breathtaking cinematography and mesmerizing soundtrack, which heightened the emotional depth of each moment. Cillian Murphy's portrayal of J. Robert Oppenheimer was nothing short of exceptional, as he brilliantly conveyed the inner conflict and moral dilemmas faced by the scientist during his involvement in the Manhattan Project.

Review_Title: Nolan's Greatest work of all time
Review: I literally have no words to describe the movie.

Despite being a long film(180 mins) it is a pleasure to watch from the first to the last minute of this absolute masterpiece. Even people not interested in physics can enjoy watching because it contains a lot of thoughts that are relatable and very actual. This film contains a lot of emotions, expressed in the best way by the actors. Thanks to the cinematography you can experience historic facts almost in first person and it leaves you a large range of thinking about the story we have made. A truly masterpiece by Nolan, I enjoyed so much watching it with a bunch of friends and speaking of it after the ending was enlightening.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer in-depth review - new Christopher Nolan masterpiece
Review: It is safe to say that this film is exceptional in every aspect: acclaimed director Christopher Nolan does not disappoint and brings to the big screen not only a film with a good historical narrative, but also a superb cast and, of course, a mind-blowing visual experience. However, it is important to keep in mind two aspects that for many could be negative and that I will discuss in this review after commenting on the positive aspects.

Review_Title: Cillian Murphy and Christopher Nolan work together to create a masterpiece of a character study.
Review: Oppenheimer's depth and unique suffering is elegantly portrayed by Murphy in this Oscar-worth performance. Whether it is the minor facial expressions which represent a thousand thoughts or the surreal look in his eyes throughout the majority of the film.
Side note: I loved tenet. A spy block buster palindrome. Total mindfuck and most of all. RE-WATCHABLE!!!!!

Christopher Nolan proves once again why he has become such a well renown and respected director in such a competitive industry. The hype for this movie was real and as much a product of Nolan's incredibly reputation as it was the subject matter and man the film was based on. The movie is a slow burn and harkens back to an older style of film that Nolan has become so beloved for in an era of CGI bloated blockbusters. Void of CGI and overblown set pieces Oppenheimer is akin to an older film simply because it is carried by its drama, themes, and outstanding cast performances more than it is by spectacle. The cinematography is second to none , using both visual and audio cues to tie into the films deeper themes. The one that comes to mind is the stomping that Oppenheimer hears in his head throughout the movie that grow louder and louder almost like an oncoming train , the source of the sound that tortures him for most of the movie is revealed closer to the end. He is also haunted by quick cuts and flashes of the bomb exploding and fire expanding etc etc. Before the trinity test scene even happens. The way the trinity test was presented was tasteful. Going on premiere night in a sold out theater, you could hear a pin drop in the room during that scene. The movie tackles heavy subjects as Oppenheimer wrestles with moral qualms and guilt over what he helped create. While powerful I do believe that the latter half of the movie involving a hearing for Dr. Oppenheimer with regards to his ongoing security clearance for the U. S. and it's nuclear program could have been condensed a bit. While I do believe that the tail end of the movie used it's time effectively to bring some weight to the movie after the trinity test and tie together some strong themes that become clear by the end. I do believe that these hearing scenes could come off as long winded at times. At best the latter half of this movie and thus it's run time is appreciated by those not bothered by long run times , who likely enjoy other long dramas in vein with Oppenheimer like The Godfather, Scarface, and more. Even those not normally used to sitting in the theater watching a movie for so long might find the film and the superb performances to be engaging enough to justify its runtime. At worst Oppenheimer suffers from an ending that feels drawn out and caused the pacing of the film to suffer. Some modern audiences who do not understand or appreciate much of the important historical context to this movie as well , might find themselves bored sitting through what feels like a court hearing towards the end of the movie. For those type of moviegoers , they probably came to see the spectacle of the trinity test scene, likely thinking it would be a finale of sorts. But on the contrary the trinity test scene merely serves as catalyst to move into the second half of the movie (thematically) speaking. I suppose the latter type of audience is not who Oppenheimer was intended for exactly. If you are a fan of film, if your a history buff, If you don't mind a slow burn and enjoy a good character piece with some good drama and themes, then Oppenheimer is a great movie for you. If you are someone who didn't know who Oppenheimer was before they announced this movie, if you don't care much for history , If your a casual movie goer whose looking for an action packed thrill ride or just decided to check it out to see what the hype was all about... then you might get mixed results. Best advice is to tailor your expectations accordingly. For me this movie was not perfect but it came pretty damn close. It's cinematography, themes , character studies, historical significance, actor performances, audio work, and of course Nolan's signature dedication to practical effects combine to deliver a film that weights up to the reputation of a man who for better or for worse changed the world as we know it. This movie solidified Nolan's place amongst names like Martin Scorsese, Stanley Kubrick and more... in other words the best of the best Hollywood has to offer! Nolan is one of if not the last of a dying breed of director. His contributions and dedication to his art help keep the original spirit of filmmaking alive at a time when the majority of what we see in theaters encompasses very little of what made the roots of the art form so compelling and special.

Review_Title: Nolan trying too hard as usual
Review: Nothing Christopher Nolan makes is easy to watch. Which I guess is one of his biggest charms, while also being his biggest downfall. You can't just sit and enjoy his movies, you have to surrender yourself to the fact that he wants to make you earn it.

Review_Title: It was great til it was borinf
Review: Up until trinity I would say the movie was done really well. The last hour felt too long and unnecessary. Although I will say the last 15 minutes captivated me again. I just felt like it was hard to stay focused. I don't think they needed to go on that long about Strauss. I also didn't think the deposition needed that much time either. I think the movie needed to expand on what happened in Japan, because maybe for the people who don't know much about the history of Hiroshima and Nagasaki it could have been more understandable why Oppie struggled with his creation of the bomb. Anyway I just thought it got rough to keep watching. My bf said he almost fell asleep during the last part too.

"The film is good and meaningful, especially as it attempts to be documentary-like. Similar to other Christopher Nolan films, it is quite mysterious, particularly when it comes to understanding what 'Openheimer' meant by hanging or not hanging the curtains??

First let me start by saying this is the best experience I have ever had watching a movie. I have seen it in theaters 5 times now so as you can see I am a little obsessed. But I have a fair reason to be. I'll start with the acting. Cillian Murphy blew me away with his performance as Oppenheimer. He portrayed Oppenheimer's messed up mind perfectly, his flaws and his good parts. He showed Oppenheimer regrets and triumphs with great emotion. I have never seen a better performance from a supporting actor the RDJ. He showed Strauss' insecurities and envy against Oppenheimer perfectly. The story itself carries you along with the amazing directing from Christopher Nolan, and the visuals are stunning. Please watch their movie you will not regret it.

A 3hrs long movie that won't bore you. Brilliant acting by cillian Murphy and all the great actors including blunt,damon etc. Such a wonderful cast. And the timeline and the progression of the movie was so amazing that it left the viewers in awe even till the very last moment. Amazing soundtrack and composition by ludwig. It has to be his perfect soundtrack. Even the last scene of the movie is soo satisfying that it leaves the audience in amazement. Use of black and white film was spot on. It correctly conveyed the subjective perspective of the two sides. Huge respect for nolans craft. Nevertheless, a nude scene in a movie like this was not really needed. Oppies extamarital affairs could have been conveyed without those scenes.

A ridiculous achievement in filmmaking. An absurdly immersive and heart-pounding experience. Cillian Murphy is a stud and RDJ will be a front-runner for Best Supporting Actor. Ludwig Göransson put his entire into that score, coupled with a sound design that made me feel like I took a bomb to the chest.

The story was amazing and great acting,directing I'm sure will Oppenheimer to nominees for best actor, best supporting actor,best director,best sound, best cinematography, best picture, my favorite Christopher nolan movie ever , cillian murphy acting was great my rating for Oppenheimer 9.5/10. It's a wonderful experience for my life,one day I will become a director, my idol is Christopher nolan I genuinely believe the movie was done incredibly well but very much slow paced which is why most people dislike the film but I understood everything from beginning to end and the points that were made as well as by the end when Oppenheimer feared of his own creation finally settled in.

Review_Title: Captivating Portrayal: Exploring Science, Morality, and Humanity in Nolan's Tribute
Review: This film stands as a remarkable tribute to the scientific genius of the past. As both a science major and a history enthusiast, I found myself utterly captivated by every aspect of the film. Christopher Nolan's directorial prowess shines through, placing us firmly in the emotionally charged, morally complex shoes of Robert Oppenheimer, and showcasing Nolan's ability to transcend the boundaries of action-centric narratives.
Another masterpiece of Christopher nolan. No doubt hes exceptional director with science fiction but he proves hes can make bio pic a totally different genre.

It's always good to witness parts of the history through the lens of a filmmaker. It's a big subject to make a movie about and who better to do it than Chris Nolan. It's great to see Cillian Murphy leading the cast and he does an exceptional job. Him and Nolan have managed to create a good balance for the character so it's not clear to the audience if Oppenheimer was driven by good will or by his ego. Although, just like other Nolan movies, the dialogues felt too explanatory at times, it's a small price to pay to watch another great movie from one of, if not the most ambitious filmmaker of our time.

Review_Title: A good watch that could have been great
Review: Oppenheimer is truly a complex character and it feels and reflects in the Christopher Nolan's adaptation. The film largely works and the 3 hour run time doesn't bother you too much. Acting masterclasses are on display in Cillian Murphy and RDJ and excellent support from Matt Damon.

I was pretty eager to see this film, despite its 3 hour length, and just went today to see it. For about half of it, I have to say, I was so bored. The acting was amazing don't get me wrong, and the bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki have always been interesting subjects to me, but this was just boring..

Review_Title: ITS WORTH THE HYPE AND EVERY PENNY
Review: The Best of Christopher Nolan ever Made This Far.

Review_Title: The greatest movie I have ever seen in my life !!
Review: This movie is the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life Literally everything in the movie is perfect and absolutely wonderful, effects, acting, directing and sound, and I really liked the sound effects and the fun music that makes you detach from the world and put your full focus on the movie and gives you an amazing viewing experience truly! ! And even though I didn't see the movie in IMAX, it was an amazing experience and Cillian Murphy's performance is truly legendary, which is what made the movie so great that it undoubtedly deserves an Oscar! For this performance!! Also, I liked the performance of Matt Damon and Rami Malek, and really. This is really high quality art that had me making it with them inside the movie!! And live with them everything that happens!! And all of this is wrong while watching, no exaggeration. This movie is definitely a masterpiece that will go down in historyas one of the greatest films ever made.

Well in the beginning with the scenes of the "atoms" in oppenheimer's head i was already blown away. The way Christopher Nolan made used of flash forwards in black and white were so good, you realy get into the story of him. Nolan used al lot of music but that is makes the movie so much better you really get sucked into the movie. The actors did there part realy good, they casting was perfect. Personlly i realy liked Einstein. Cillian Murphy's acting was so good the way that he express himself in to the movie and let his feelings get across to the viewers. I would recommand this movie to everybody. It is for me a 10/10 movie, one of the best or maybe the best movie i have ever seen.

Oppenheimer is not a typical Nolan films like Inception or Interstellar. It is a three hour long biographical thriller film which was running like a fast moving car. As an IR student i've found it very relatable but thats not the case with most of the Indian audience. This movie has lot of characters like Strauss, J Hoover, Roosevelt, Kennedy and many more American scientists. You should have fair idea about their role in American history then only you could relate it better. First half was very much setting up the plot of the film which revolves around Oppenheimer's Journey. But the second half right from the "Trinity test" to the mystery of the end was an absolute amazing. The background score was tense and will held you till the end of the movie. Cillian Murphy and Robert Downey have given their career best performance. Eventually, all i can say it is more of "Dunkirk" kind of film rather than Dark Knight or Interstellar. If you love watching serious cinema then it is a must watch movie, you will surely enjoy it.

First of all, everything that follows is my personal opinion, everyone can have a different opinion and that's a good thing. The complexity of the film is a major point of criticism for many, which I can understand in some ways, although I see it differently. Because the complexity of Nolan's films is why I love them so much. It's a change from the dull action films that are too haf produced. It is true that Oppenheimer is also mentally demanding and makes your head pound, however me and my 4 friends (all 15 years old) enjoyed the film very much and learned a lot about the story of this brilliant man and the film despite the well understood at different time levels. Not completely, of course, but you have to be prepared for that with a Nolan film. One can't rave enough about the acting cillian murphy and robert downey jr's performance was absolutely superb and definitely worthy of an Oscar. The rest of the cast is also incredibly strong. I thought every 5 minutes "what? You're playing too?". And as if that weren't enough, everything is staged in an absolutely grandiose way and during one scene my mouth just dropped open and I just asked myself "how???". And last but not least, the absolutely ingeniously adapted music makes every single scene perfect.

Review_Title: Hands down, great cast! But even better musical score to set the tone.
Review: Even more impressive was the musical score. Love the pivotal point when the music stopped. But not forever. The cinematography subtle change led to an even more emotional response to these amazing actors. Casting was amazing and "Kitty" and her character were crucial to understanding the mental stress that he was trying to process. She was the sanity check in his unbelievable world. Tellar, I think represented all of us, going along for the ride and trying to be decent people, but still afraid to speak out against what might feel wrong in the world but also wanted to make a name for ourselves as well. Even the fact that it was mentioned, be it small, that the land should go back to the native Indians that occupied it before he bought the land, was true to history. Nowadays, it crucial we tell the truth and not hide from our ugly history. We are who we are. Go see it.

Review_Title: Overrated, More a Documentary than a Movie.
Review: It's good, but it's not worth anyone's time. It is incredibly overrated, I love Christopher Nolan, I had very high Expectations. But what I got was 90% politics, and 10% actual blockbuster. It's sad, because I was expecting to see more of the bomb, or the suffering of the Japanese, but all we got to see was 5 seconds on the tv that the bomb hit it's target. We where forced to see 2 hours of building the bomb but only 5 seconds of the actual impact? What's the last hour for then? It's all about Oppenheimer still having his seat on some absolutely boring politician whatever. And they even made the second part more important than the first one? Who cares about that. I was expecting to see some Christopher Nolan, tenet level like action or something but I got an documentary. I know I'm too harsh, but there were ways to make it more epic. It's not even creepy or anything it's just plain boring. And Downey Jr. As a villain? Doesn't work for me, don't know about everyone else. The movie was one hour too long, everyone ran out of the theater after 3 torturing hours. Movie was good, especially the church scene, but not 8,0/10 good.
If anything but it is fictional testament to the people that lived in that era. Real humans with their own strengths and struggles. A vivid reminder of their existence and historic challenge.

Yep, just watched it. The whole 3 hours of it. True, it is a nice film. But man, the first hour there is not even 3 seconds to breathe. Just dialogue over dialogue over new character over new character.

Review_Title: Boring old news trapped in the past
Review: I used to have respect for Nolan before I realized he doesn't embrace the change of times. It' very simple. You either embrace great changes, grow, and become better or you just become old news trapped in the past. And this is the case with Nolan.

Review_Title: Sympathy for the father of the atomic bomb
Review: Thoroughly enjoyed the movie. Need to watch a lot of documentaries to understand and validate what was shown to be honest. Nonetheless this movie certainly will aid the people to develop sympathy for the father of atomic bomb and also make them scared of what's to come next. The cast was brilliant throughout the movie. Robert Downey Jr. Was so good as Lewis Strauss that you will feel the urge to punch his face. Words cant describe how amazing Cillian Murphy's acting was, you really need to see it to judge it. I always thought that we will remember him as Thomas Shelby but now that we have seen him as Robert Oppenheimer you might need to overwrite your memories.

Review_Title: Cillian Murphy was the perfect casting decision for documenting one of the most important developments in history.
Review: Unbelievable movie. Cillian Murphy is a brilliant actor. Nolan's approach to documenting the levity of such a pivotal moment while accurately injecting the pursuit of science amidst the poison of politics is really beautiful to watch.

Oppenheimer is a 3-hour movie that, in contrast to Nolan's more recent sci-fi movies, demonstrates his mastery of the Biopic/Drama genre. The movie moves quickly while tackling significant themes and giving a thorough character analysis of our culture. It was one of the most frightening scenes in recent memory, making theatergoers uneasy and serving as a reminder of the full power of the film experience. With a remarkable cinematic achievement and a poignant reminder that cinema is still alive, Oppenheimer is a winner on all counts. I have already seen the movie once and intend to go back to the theater at least a few more times in the near future. It is highly recommended for everyone.

Okay so I watched Oppenheimer twice. The first time in 70mm and to be very honest ... I didn't like it the first time around. I felt it to be slow paced and confusing at times with a lot of things happening at once. It honestly felt like a documentary. However, I also like close to one of the world's 30 cinemas that project the movie in IMAX 70mm and I had booked the tickets a month earlier. When I tried to get a refund and cancel the tickets after watching the movie the first time, the customer service at the cinema said that they couldn't cancel my ticket at the moment, and the cancellation was only possible after the movie had been played and my ticket shouldn't be scanned. So I decided to go again as I thought it was a once in a lifetime experience.
"Oppenheimer" is a masterclass in filmmaking, boasting exceptional cinematography, an engaging story, and a stellar cast that leaves a lasting impression.

Review_Title: I will be seeing this again as soon as possible.
Review: This film is nothing short of spectacular. It is obvious that every detail has been painstakingly thought of to a very high degree and nothing is either done or not done accidentally.

Review_Title: An enjoyable historical drama if a little long and overhyped.
Review: So let's start with the good bits: A fascinating story well told and easy to follow despite the usual non linear format of Mr Nolan. I also thought it ended well and had great acting and a brilliant cast. I would have given it more stars had it not been overhyped so much which left me with my expectations too high. Now for the bad bits (with spoilers!): Watching any film on a Cinema big screen with surround sound is a nice experience. However, I am not sure why this film was a 'must see' on a big screen. I am guessing for the overhyped bomb detonation taking place two hours into the three hour film. I was expecting so much more from the detonation sequence, I did not time it, but it seemed to be over so quickly with a flash, fireball and some shockwave bangs. Mr Nolan missed a trick here as he could have made it last so much longer with so many more effects. Then it was back to the slow but well told drama for the last hour. So, with the exception of a couple of minutes in the middle a big screen is no more a required for this film than for a courtroom drama.

Christopher Nolan's first biopic keeps very true to its inspiration, American Prometheus. The casting was superb with what is Cillian Murphy's best performance on the big screen so far, and additional stellar performances from Robert Downey Jr and the remainder of the cast.

The first half or so of the movie has a strangely energetic and frenetic pace between scenes of what is felt like important dialogues, with an almost constant super-dramatic movie score. It's like an intense thriller movie with flickering changes between important dialogues that I felt could have been complimented better by a slower pace.

Review_Title: Absolute garnish, save your money and more importantly, Time!
Review: Terrible film overhyped and mislead you with an outstanding cast and director. Unfortunately the film lacked execution and suspense. It was too one dimensional and totally boring!!! That is to put it plain and simple.

This is Nolan's magnum opus. A beautiful movie visually; with a haunting, attacking, physical score. The acting is elite, specially Murphy who is at his apex as an actor. There are so many actors in this movie who you've seen elsewhere but have no idea what they're names are - and all of them hit out of the park. I left the movie theater defeated mentally and emotionally. The intentions were to do Barbie later in the day, but after watching this masterpiece I didn't want to do anything but sit and ponder. I must suggest seeing this movie in IMAX to get the full experience. 10/10, 5 stars, all the awards.

Review_Title: It's greatest movie I've seen ever.
Review: When I got out of the movie, I thought well... will i watch another movie with this whole Cinematic creative power ? It is good in dialogue, scenarios, producing music and great characters. The only thing that can be considered negative is the acceleration of the dialogues in the last hours, but this obstacle does not prevent from watch this again. This masterpiece does not appreciate its existence outside cinema halls, especially IMAX, Finally, the film is not for fans of action ratings. It tells about Oppenheimer's autobiography in the Manhattan Project, and how his life was before and after the bomb, with regard to political issues, betrayal of the country, and physics as well, where you will live a very nice experience in case you have a background in history regarding the issue of the American and Russian allies. An enjoyable experience, I hope you enjoy.

Review_Title: Openheiner" is not a movie that leaves you indifferent
Review: It's a profound masterpiece that touched my emotions deeply. Directed by the visionary Christopher Nolan and accompanied by the mesmerizing music of Hans Zimmer, this film is a work of art that transcends conventional storytelling.

Review_Title: A Deep Dive into Complexity and Morality
Review: In "Oppenheimer", Christopher Nolan brings to life a very deep and complex character. Unlike Nolan's usual style, this film has a lot of dialogues. It deals with many big issues like guilt, logical thinking, patriotism, and the effects of creating a nuclear bomb. The film also highlights the dark side of peace, hypocrisy, and double standards in morality.

Review_Title: I saw this four times and it was worth it every single time
Review: As the title says I saw this movie 4 times so you could easily extrapolate that I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. All of the actors give incredible performances, but especially Cilian Murphy and Emily Blunt. The music is a personal favourite of mine and captures all of the scenes amazingly. The character dialogue is all amazing and shines insight into their state of mind and inner thoughts. I thoroughly recommend this movie to anyone who hasn't seen it yet and especially recommended seeing it in theatres (in IMAX if possible) as it's even better on the big screen. This is one of the best movies of all time and definitely the best of this year.
I'm a Nolan fan. I can't say this review is without its Bias.

Great movie, but with a great fault; not a minor, but a major historical failure to show the central role that president Roosevelt played in the first years of the relevant period. Einstein and others convinced president Roosevelt that Germany was in the process of developing an atomic bomb and it was Roosevelt who decided to launch the Manhatten Project. It was also Roosevelt who sent a letter to Oppenheimer thanking him for leading the successful work in New Mexico. A film about Oppenheimer and the atomic bomb without a role for FDR is like making a film about The Battle of Britain without Winston Churchill.

Review_Title: Oscars in atleast 5 categories is awaited... Atmost all 💥
Review: As expected A Nolan Masterpiece... Cillian Murphy and RDJ deserve an Oscar for this... People with a science background can relate better. Movie of the decade already...

Another movie by Nolan,with exceptional actors and impressive CGI (aka huge budget) but nothing special as far as the scenario and cinematography are concerned. Cliché-depicted the life of a scientist, the female role etc. I believe that with such great performances and interesting historical events, the movie should have been way more thrilling. Another thing is, that when you create a movie about the life of a physicist, it is essential that you comprehend at least the basic knowledge required and not just throw random stuff in the script. Historically speaking, the movie was more complete and the flashbacks, although used too many times, served well.

Review_Title: A piece of trash, salted with great actors
Review: The only reason why I am giving 2 stars intead of 1 is the great acting by Murphy and the impressive cast; also the subject chosen is a beutiful and complex mix in principle: the 20th-century impressive scientific revolutions, ethics and psychology, 2nd WW history, politics during subsequent cold war and macchartism; in principle a terrific and stimulating mix. This could be the only other possible explaination for positive reviews.

Review_Title: Brilliant craftsmanship by the crew, cast and Nolan himself
Review: Excellent direction and acting . You never get to see Cilian Murphy, you only see J Robert Oppenheimer. The rest of the cast was fantastic as well, special mention to Robert Downey Jr. Matt Damon, Florence Pugh, Emily Blunt all give an excellent performance. Ludwid Gorranson's score sends chill throughout the body. My only issue was with the sound mixing. In certain parts the score gets a bit too loud that it's a bit difficult to listen to the dialogue between the actors, but it won't be an issue if subtitles are shown. Overall outstanding movie and expect at least 3-4 Academy award nominations. 9.6/10.
This is incredibly good nolan made a masterpiece but if u didn't know science at all u maybe won't get the movie.

Review_Title: Just an another masterpiece of Nolan
Review: I'm really glad to see the impact that this movie had on me, a wonderful drama movie. Everything in this movie is simply perfect, like every Nolan's movie we can find the time notion representated by clock sounds throughout the movie. Cillian was just the best choice for this, he plays Robert Oppenheimer like a deus and he knows how to reach people's heart thanks to his facials expressions, we know instantly feel the differents emotions of his character. We come to realize the remorse that Robert may have had after the launching of the A-bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in a very psychological short scene. Psychology is an integral part of this film since it is centered on a character in thirst for creation who does not realize the harm he could create by doing so. In short this film is quite representative of the works of oppenheimer and i strongly invite you to go see it.

This is one of the greatest films i've watched in a while. Murphy was perfect for his role and another fantastic job by Christopher Nolan. I remember watching the trailer and anticipating this movie more than anything. This movie lived up to my expectations and then some. The music was really good and kept the movie interesting and it felt like i was truly inside of Oppenheimer's mind. The ending scene was incredible and and the visuals of this movie blew me away. It is a bit loud sometimes but that's to come as expected when creating a movie about bombs. If you enjoy movies that are at a slower pace and require a lot of thought and attention then this movie is definitely for you.

Review_Title: A Masterpiece of Anticipation and Horror
Review: To begin with, this movie truly exceeded all expectations, captivating the audience with its mesmerizing musical score and the awe-inspiring performance delivered by Cillian Murphy in the role of Oppenheimer. Spanning over a duration of three hours, this cinematic masterpiece managed to effortlessly immerse viewers, making time fly by unnoticed as the engrossing narrative kept us yearning for more. The anticipation leading up to the trinity test was undeniably one of the most thrilling and suspenseful moments I've ever experienced in a cinema, leaving a lasting impression of "feeling the nuke", the story's conclusion struck a perfect balance of terror and brilliance, solidifying its place as one of the most chilling yet satisfying endings I've ever witnessed.

Review_Title: Many stories in one, but not the whole story
Review: Meandering between cinematographic bombast (a trademark Christopher Nolan spectacle) and theatre-like subtlety (Cillian Murphy's multi-layered facial expressions alone are worth it) Oppenheimer is a very engaging watch.

Review_Title: What could have been....ended up being underwhelming.
Review: Going into the cinema I had really high expectations for this movie. The movie lacked the "amazing special effects" in where it was loudly marketed, (watched it on IMAX) and because of this, I felt cheated of an amazing visual experience. Another issue I have with this movie was the weird tangling of events, it felt like the movie was trying to show so much, thus making it boring and uninteresting. The actors did great, but that's about it "great". I also despised a lot of the cinematography, too many close ups and "average" angles. The storyline was okay, acting was okay, cinematography okay.

Fantastic movie. This is the best movie I have watched in a LONG time! We have always know how great Nolan is as a filmmaker but this makes him for me the best filmmaker ever. This is one of his best work yet, and you could argue that it is the best movie ever. The acting and story telling was perfect. Nolan and Murphy did a good job in portraying Dr. Oppenheimer as a character and personality. All the other actors did a fantastic job as well as their role I could see that all of the actors knew what they were doing. We could really see that It had some of the best cinematography I have ever seen and it was well put together. The movie is 3 hours long but you can barely even fell the length of the movie.

Review_Title: Fine, but I was expecting more.
Review: Overall, the film is fine. A particularly positive aspect, as with all Nolan films, are the special effects. The soundtrack is also well done. For the most part, the film is treated as a biopic, although it deviates from that in a few places. For example, while there is a focus on Oppenheimer's development and becoming a professor of physics, especially in the beginning, it becomes more and more impersonal as the film progresses. So in the end it is not a biopic of Oppenheimer, but rather a biopic of the atomic bomb itself. Apart from the few historical inaccuracies (Albert Einstein did not play as big a role for Oppenheimer in real life as it is shown), the film is accurate. However, the long dialogues, which some people criticize as "boring", are more of a plus for me, especially compared to past films by Christopher Nolan, which placed more emphasis on visuals. As already mentioned, the film unfortunately becomes more and more impersonal and in the end only relies on long scenes in court, in which the events are once again replayed by already known characters from their point of view. I expected much more. I think the film could have been much better if Nolan had focused more on Oppenheimer's psychological problems after the atomic bombs were dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. At least, I would have found that more interesting.

Review_Title: Flexing the power of the US and zero footage of casualties
Review: "Let's drop a movie called Oppenheimer about the birth of the superpower of the USA and the magnitude of the weapons we are able to create. But please, no coverage of the repercussions. We don't want the world to see the hundreds of thousands of casualties that took place in Hiroshima, and make ourselves look bad. It's not about the lives lost. Let's just tell our story and purely focus the film on flexing the power of the USA and remind the world why they shouldn't mess with us. That we are able to wipe the whole planet in one click!"

What a splendid movie the whole 3 hours i watched it never felt like going out of the theatre the atmosphere created by the movie was so majestic..Loved cillians acting n RDJs, and ofcourse Christopher nolan the brilliant director behind all this .. The way the movie portrayed Oppenheimers character is just wonderful the making of atomic bomb the consequences he imagined after wards and the fear of having bloods in his hands the corrupt system of being jealous of another's work and forcing to work into it more false accusations on Oppenheimer by lewis strauus..you won't regret watching this movie.

Review_Title: A 20th century warning for our time
Review: You can draw modern-day parallels with Artificial Intelligence and (the inaction of) Climate Change that threatens humanity. More specifically, nations that still see it opportune to rely on fossil fuels and coal as they grow their economy as time to prevent our planet being uninhabitable is running out. Oppenheimer is brilliant with its fantastic visuals, immersive score, and pulsating dialogue.

Review_Title: Most Critical Film Of All Time
Review: I've heard that a big deterrent to watch this movie is it's 3 hour run time, however, I believe that those 3 hours make up one of the most important films in cinema history. Oppenheimer is a hard-to-swallow biopic on one of mankind's most important men to ever live, and every second of this film is nothing short of accurate history (from big factual sources like the book "American Prometheus" which in itself is the biggest inspiration for this film) combined with Christopher Nolan's remarkable story telling. This is a movie you do NOT want to miss. Also, don't forget to watch it on its intended format (70mm or IMAX)

Review_Title: I still can't believe that I watched this in 2023!
Review: Nolan did a good job in that movie the movie is so great at every thing good acting amazing cinematography. Nolan did not use cgi that is so great to be heard now days. But there is one problem I had in this movie that you cannot watch this in your phone or your laptop if you want to get the full experience you must watch this in cinema.if you love nolan you must watch this movie If you hate Nolan you must watch this movie if you love cgi you must watch this movie if you hate cgi you must watch this movie. Nolan did his best at this movie he is really deserve some clapping I think this movie is Nolan's best movie.
MISSION: BARBENHEIMER PART 2 OF 3!
If you are a person who enjoys a slow burn, biopic, character study, this one is gonna be in your top 10.

First of all, I am a big fan of Nolan's works. I like most of his movies and The Prestige remains one of my favorite. I wish I liked Oppenheimer too but the movie came as a big disappointment to me. Probably because I expected to see an epic drama about the intricacies and difficulties of building an atomic bomb (something like The Imitation Game or biopic like There Will Be Blood about personality of Oppenheimer) but instead I saw "Michael Keaton" walking around and smoking pipe performed by Cillian Murphy. I like Murphy's other roles, but I don't think this one was his best performance. The moral dilemma Oppenheimer had been going through was not convincing at all in Murphy's play. I didn't see that something was really eating Oppenheimer - Murphy even after he realised the scale of his destructive creation. No obsession with atomic bomb or quantum physics was shown. So disappointing. I wish the role was played by Eddie Redmayne or Benedict Cumberbatch. The movie is unreasonably too long. Too many unnecessary scenes. More than half of the film is devoted to the interrogation with predilection whether Oppenheimer's clearance will be renewed or not. Is it a joke? Was it the most important thing in his life? Really? No chemistry between Murphy and E. Blunt's characters, so it was pretty surprising that they got married. However, I gave the film 6 stars because I absolutely loved Robert Downey's performance. He was stunning from start to finish. Casey Affleck should have had longer screen time. I also think that Florence Pugh's character was underdeveloped. She is so talented and beautiful and could have brought better sense and scenes to the film.

My one word review - Brilliant. My Rating - 9/10. It is surely Nolan's finest and most powerful movie till date and will likely be the big winner at next year's Oscars at least for Best Film, Best Actor, Best Director and Best Supporting Actor but it is not a movie for everyone.

Review_Title: Masterful storytelling, yet yearns for more impact
Review: Perhaps the first Nolan film that could have potentially benefited from computer-generated effects. Nolan is a master at narrating a visual story through traditional means, but this time the wonder of splitting the atom remained somewhat remote. Traditional explosions and spark showers, created with pyrotechnics, even seemed naive in depicting the incredible power of nuclear fission.

Review_Title: Great actors kept this relevant to see
Review: Unfortunate snore fest. Just a sausage fest of dialogue. Same ol story of how men make useless wars and play the victim card after the fact. Definitely Nolan's slowest film. Idk how to make this lengthy besides stating that barbie lived up to the hype and this film did not. Once the atomic bomb set off my bowels we're ready to go. Did not stay for the last 15 minutes and I have zero interest. Nolan is great and of course I'll see future works but this was a history channel flop. So I'm sure it'll get lots of Oscar's. Gave me something to talk about (or b*tch about). I'm so glad I didn't drag my girl to this. Men go see barbie with your girl. It's less of a waste of time.

Incredible! One of the best ever, by far. This movie is must see at least 2 times. Anyone who gives this less than a 10 does not deserve to review movies. Undeniably a Nolan movie. The color, score, acting, and writing is perfect. Line delivery is perfect and you can tell how much Nolan cares about this story. The way it was set up and then ended was perfect. I really can't explain how transfixed I was during this movie. Cilian is the best I have ever seen him in any role. This story was a difficult subject that required sensitivity and he delivered at an exceptional level. He did not make Oppenheimer evil, he showed he was a man who had struggles and ended up being one of the most important people in history.

Jesus Christ, I thoroughly loved this movie from the very beginning to the last second. This movie had everything - incredible cinematography, all-around Oscar-worthy acting, amazing plot and storytelling and a heart wrenching score. This is what I call a perfect movie. I loved the way that the story was told.

I got out asking myself if the movie was not too long. But thinking it twice, the narrative frame is so good that the 2h45 seemed not so long and the global story was not annoying or boring...of course Nolan could have cut 30 minutes to make it more mainstream but the film editing is great. A contemplative experience as usual with Nolan but Cylian Murphy is so good and Robert Downey is a credible Lewis Strauss. I would not view it again on TV but I would pay for 70mm version in theater. The pre requisite of non using special effects can be disturbing as we are waiting for that bomb to explode for 2 hours but the outcome can be disappointing for some people. All in all, a great balance between Nolan genius and a lovely biopic.

Review_Title: the Destroyer of Worlds, dissosiation & sound design of Oppenheimer
Review: Oh boy where do I even begin.

This movie is incredible, its emotional, epic and interesting, I left the theater feeling like id been punched in the gut, I genuinely cried after watching this, truly one of the best movies of the generation.

Review_Title: Super interesting movie, but also interesting pacing...
Review: I personally think the movie was amazing. It had incredibly beautiful visuals and I thought the different point of views were very well executed (the change between black and white and colour really helped understand through which point of view we saw the scene). It's a high quality movie and Christopher Nolan did not disappoint. I'm not entirely sure about historical and scientific accuracy but of what knowledge I have (Swiss student, year 11), I think I can say it was pretty accurate. All I can say is that it did lead to a very interesting discussion about communism on the drive back home. Overall I enjoyed the movie very much and it's probably one of my top movies.

Just came back from the cinema. I'm feeling very disappointed about this movie. Best director and great actors&actresses, but the movie is way worse than other Nolan's works. I didn't have even one psychological fluctuation during this 3-hour period and almost fell in asleep for a few times. Please excuse my personal opinion. No disrespect to anyone. Just came back from the cinema. I'm feeling very disappointed about this movie. Best director and great actors&actresses, but the movie is way worse than other Nolan's works. I didn't have even one psychological fluctuation during this 3-hour period and almost fell in asleep for a few times. Please excuse my personal opinion. No disrespect to anyone.

Review_Title: One of the most important movie in the history of cinema...
Review: Oppeneheimer is a very bond, brilliant and important movie. This film is very important from a technical point of view because it introduces a completely new format in cinema (KODAK b&w). The way this story is told is unique, but also very interesting. Actually, the story of Oppenheimer had to be told exactly like that. With a fantastic cast, this film takes us on an unforgettable historical experience that we all need to be familiar with. The mention of world famous scientists is presented very carefully and somewhat moderately (Einstein, Heisenberg, Bhor and of course Oppenheimer), which is the essence of this story.

Review_Title: Visually and cinematography a great movie, but..
Review: Both visuals and cinematics where great, also the acting is spot on. You can see Nolan really showed his skills. To be short: a great imax movie without CGI. But it's very long (3 hours) and a lot of time is consumed to intensify scenes, rather than explaining how hard it was to let an plutonium bomb work at critical mass and the accidents with it was not shown. Also the detonation of the device where a little bit underwhelming consider the trailer, besides it's hard to reduplicate without cgi. Some documentaries online are more accurate but as a movie it's great. Also the "Dutch" he spoke is not understandable as a Dutch person myself, it sounded more like German.

Review_Title: I could have given this movie an 8 out of 10, but it had problems ...
Review: The first two hours were disjointed and annoying at times ... rapid and awkward scene changes, unrelated cuts to different story threads that had no sense of connection or relevance at times. There were story elements in the first half that could have easily been left out, there was no need to make this movie 3 hours long. It should have been about quality, not quantity. However with all that said, the last hour of this movie rescued what could have been a disaster. It was brilliant, dramatic and intense, Nolan at his best in my opinion. It left me feeling that it had been a worthwhile movie-going experience despite the lack of coherence in the first two hours.

Review_Title: One of the best movies you can watch in your entire life , you have to be grateful you watched it in the big screen
Review: I really can find the right words to describe how beautiful this movie is , for me it's the best movie I've ever seen and the soundtracks are extremely beautiful and it feels like you are living in another universe. What a bloody brilliant film and amazing actors. I never knew the story but I wanted to laugh, cry and shout at the screen. Such a powerful important story that's everyone needs to see and believe me you won't be able to watch any movie after this movie for a while. Nolan is hands down a freaking genius. I literally enjoyed every second, detail, character and soundtrack. This movie hits different.

Review_Title: Powerful Oscar worthy performance by Cillian Murphy
Review: Have seen this movie three times and find more nuances each time into Oppenheimer's mental challenges from his fear of what he was developing. This film hopefully will earn Cillian his first Academy Award nod and a 3rd nomination for Robert Downey Jr as Lewis Strauss. Jason Clarke was amazing as the hard hitting Roger Robb during the kangaroo "court" that was instigated by Strauss in 1954 to revoke Oppenheimer's security clearance. It was karma for Strauss to be denied the Secretary of Commerce nomination by Jr Senator JFK in 1959.

Review_Title: Nothing could've prepared me for this.
Review: This is the culmination of everything Christopher Nolan has directed. It's perfect. Everything, from the beginning to the ending. Going into this movie I expected a depressing film but it was way more depressed then I had thought. This is one of the greatest movies ever made. The score is phenomenal, the sound design is exhilarating, the set design is incredible, the performances are BEYOND AMAZING. This movie will 100% dominate in the awards season. I can guarantee that Cillian Murphy will take home best actor with Robert Downey Jr taking home the best supporting actor. This is a master class in cinema and needs to be seen on the biggest screen imaginable.

This movie is nothing short of a cinematic masterpiece that deserves every bit of praise it receives. From the moment the film begins, you are immediately drawn into a mesmerizing world, skillfully crafted by the brilliant mind of Christopher Nolan.

Review_Title: By far one of the greatest biopics ever.
Review: This movie is a masterpiece; a cliché, but it is what it is. It is a very successful take on the life of Oppenheimer, who had an otherwise dramatic life given his complex nature and self contradictory actions. As with Nolan's other films, Oppenheimer assumes that the viewer has a certain level of history awareness and basic science, which is something I really admire.

Review_Title: Now i am become death, the destroyer of worlds.
Review: The film is very heavy, but a masterpiece. Personally, the experience I had with the film, I do not think it will be repeated, because it is so great, the sound, the great photography, the impressive embodiment of the actors, and the scene of the bombing that is difficult to forget. A masterpiece from Nolan's masterpieces, one of the best biographical films in history because it was presented in a distinctive way by Nolan with his special touches. Personally, I will watch the movie two or three times in the cinema. And my personal rating for the movie is 10/10. I recommend watching the movie in the cinema, specifically in the IMAX, to live the best possible cinematic experience.

Review_Title: Great cast and story telling, but the audio
Review: The story of Oppenheimer is told in Nolan's way - with a great set of actors, non-linear screenplay, and overly done background music. Of course, the tunes taken out of the context would sound great. But they are less enjoyable in a movie laden with conversations.
Is when Robt Downey Jr has been totally and unconditionally licked and then must face the barrage of reporters and photographers outside the door.
Oppenheimer

Review_Title: Lame story, but some exceptional scenes.
Review: The movie was very long. The build up for the bomb was enjoyable, but not significant. Felt like the movie started when the test bomb was exploded. The final sequence after the explosion had some really good scenes. The talk with the president that shows the ruthlessness and corruption of the government and president. The internal conflict Robert had between saying what the people wanted to hear and the feeling that he caused the death of millions. The whole interrogation thing was pretty lame and and the result didn't affect me. None of the characters were very interesting. Strauss was a character that seemed cliché a guy that hates someone and wants to bring him down and has a breakdown saying that the guy is evil and wants the fame and everything. Dr Oppenheimer was also a very average character and probably was the best as well in the whole movie. Not too much focus on the morality of making the bomb as much as it was on the interrogation room.

The movie jumps from the past to present trying to be clever and come off like inception. Instead, it's just unnecessarily disorganized. I guess it's to makeup for the lack of material, they had written. Very loud and incoherent at points. There's art to sounds and tones and it was used ineffectively. There's really no development of the characters. In one instance, Kitty Oppenheimer, Emily blunt, is seen with booze and ignoring the house hold, and just unkept. Which applause to Emily blunt for her acting, she did a great job given the lack of material she was handed for the role. Then in the end, we are supposed to be applauding her in the final scene when she doesn't shake the other scientist's hand? Same goes for every other character.
Need to think every second make sure you are in Focus mode when Watch this Movie !

Review_Title: "Oppenheimer" - An Atomic Blend of Intensity and Genius
Review: "Oppenheimer," the latest venture by auteur Christopher Nolan, is a cinematic tour de force that masterfully fuses historical gravitas with human drama. It delves into the paradoxical world of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the theoretical physicist known as the 'father of the atomic bomb,' giving us a potent exploration of one man's ambition, guilt, and the cataclysmic power of science.

Such a well-written script. It's undoubtedly hard to weave all these heavy plots talking about nuclear physics and politics with delicate characters building upon them. Several rather complicated narratives, as a commercial movie it also needs to be understood by the public audience. Nolan did a fantastic job although it does feel a bit too dramatic sometimes - well, forgive it given that it is a commercial movie after all.

I mean, why the hell are you even on this app to check the ratings of this movie? If you're a movie freak, you shouldn't even doubt Christopher Nolan's work here. About which he said is the whole struggle of his life. And, and look at the GODDAMN cast ffs, what else do u want?? If u have watched any of CN's movies u should know how great this movie is going to be!!!! I'm flabbergasted at guy's' audacity like f u for god's sake. And please note that this is going to be a movie that changes ur perspective and standard for the movies u watch after it. With all of that said, pardon my language. And oh I haven't watched the movie yet but i know its gonna be awesome. Thanks for tuning in. Bye.

Not a fan of the timing, i think the film was a bit long some scenes seemed unnecessary, the music and overall sound design was great though saved some scenes that were a bit long for certain, the framing of shots is a bit repetitive at times but the overall filming is as good as expected, the storytelling was great although a bit less clear near the end but it might just be an impression due to the length. Overall i think the movie was as good as expected, but might not be great if not viewed in a cinema, as it really needs good audio to help stay focused. Good not great, could be better, but still strongly recommend to see it.

The movie is naturally legendary
The sound and visual effects are something you don't find in any movie
Incredible thing
It is about the mythical representation of all the actors.

Review_Title: I should have liked it, but I didn't
Review: It is hard to explain why I was disappointed, but the best way I can describe this movie is by saying it is like a bad version of Dunkirk. A shame really, considering my interest in Oppenheimer and the Manhattan Project. Take everything Dunkirk did wrong, or at least what I didn't like about it, and pack it into one movie. This movie chose to put emphasis on showcasing the filmmaker's skills instead of putting focus on telling the story of Oppenheimer's life. It seems the love interests and sexual scenes just try to breathe life into a somewhat lifeless story. I believe this is the film where we see the beginning of the end for Christopher Nolan. Maybe he's just lost his touch? Maybe he's been doing it so long, he's making the films more for himself than for his audience.

Review_Title: Great acting all around. Multiple timelines tough.
Review:
I was fully engaged throughout the 3 hours, in fact I wished for more. I do agree with the reviewer who wrote something about the need to follow closely, to turn your brain on. Following the story with its back and forth through at least three timelines could be confusing. I spent some time after it ended going over the sequence with my spouse and I can't wait to
watch it again at home with better captions than the ones I had from the theater's machine.

The movie was a bit hard to follow the dates(yes black and white scenes helped to follow the different) and I watched all the Nolan's cinema but in this movie there was no impact. I didnt experience that impact I found in the interstellar or in the prestige. Still a great cinematography and great acting's but its not enough for better points in my opinion. The scenes I can call I feel like I was watching Nolan's cinema the ones was after the starting the build the test field and the progress of building the atomic bomb. There I found that tension and impact. Then we saw the regret on Oppenheimer and he tried to change atomic future,there I found the impact I want.
Despite many great performances (with few exceptions) and an interesting story, it is all too long, too complex and frequently boring.

In an age where cinema is dying thanks to multiple releases of consumable products that taste/feel the same this was the movie I personally needed and the entire movie Industry needed as well. All actors did a phenomenal job, Cillian Murphy was simply fantastic, Robert Downy Jr. Was so versatile and the entire supporting cast delivered their best and it was impactful. The long 3 hour runtime didn't feel long at all in fact it had me hooked from the start till the end, there was no scene that was boring or dragged out. Christopher Nolan proving once again that he is one of the best in this age, this may be his best work yet.
A truly remarkable film that, as the poster boasts, will change the world forever.

I guess this is Christopher Nolan's first film in this genre and Nolan,as done justice with it. It is an absolute masterpiece. All scenes, the bomb scene,the trial scene, the tests done,etc have been perfectly and the way film climaxes is marvelous.

Review_Title: A political, moral, and physics based movie
Review: This move was a show stopper! Starting off with a complicated begging on Robert J. Oppenheimer with him being judged by a council. The movie continues with his research and it is all out in extraordinary view. Oppenheimer makes an outstanding young physicist and you can see his growth as he goes from Cambridge to Germany. This sequence was put together so well as he met new characters and spent a minute or two introducing them to the audience so they may be of importance later in the story. He begins teaching and later the bomb is found to be a possibility. This is where the complication begins as you go from his future to the future with Louis Strauss and they talk about things not seen yet. As Groves come to him with an idea of the directing of the bomb his past begins to unveil with communism in every corner. It is in this phase when the movie gets extremely complicated. He begins collecting scientist and Los Almos is soon made. The complication begins to unveil just as in every Christopher Nolan movie. Oppenheimer's clearance is questioned and you see Strauss at his own council meeting. He begins making the bomb and it is here where Christopher Nolan builds tension to make the movie so much better. The tension between the scientist as he builds the bomb is outstanding and makes the movie so much more realistic. You can understand how important this is and how vital it is to get everything correct.the movie takes a very political turn here with Japan about to be attacked and the tension grows when they find the bomb could destroy the world. Finally, they are put to the test and the bomb is exploded. Here is when the movie starts unraveling just as all Christopher Nolan movies. You find Strauss is the master mine between the clearance problems and you understand the council meetings with both Robert and Strauss. The moment you understand the whole movie makes sense. In the end it is heartfelt with his past and get a moral dilemma combined with politics, and physics. I love how it is all complicated and emotional yet it all makes sense in the end.
