Review_Title: Watch it at the Cinema to appreciate this masterpiece.
Review: If you do not know the story about Robert Oppenheimer you can't just jump into it and think you will enjoy this movie as there is a good chance you may not get it.

"Now I Am Become Death, the Destroyer of Worlds". This quote literally runs the movie theme throughout. Everyone knows what happened during WWII and how the atomic bomb led to the death and destruction of thousands of lives. But not many know how it began and what were the political toxicity that led through during and after the final event.

Review_Title: Audience were Sleeping in our Theatre (Norwich, UK)
Review: It's a Dialogue heavy Movie, Centered on court room trials with almost no Action, just a single Nuke Scene, which was good enough. Nolan's forte is Action Sci-fi Genre, but here he became more Artistic, trying to Achieve an Oscar. Visuals were great, every actor performed in excellence, Sound score was fabulous and direction as always was superb.
The majority of performances are great but there are few exceptional performances by Robert Downy JR and Emily blunt.

Review_Title: Failure to launch - Don't believe the hype
Review: It's the first time in years I wanted to walk out of a movie. The fast transitions between scenes tied together with constant background music makes it almost unwatchable. The first 90 minutes felt like going through some IG reel where everything had to be hyped up to keep people interested. Not each and every line the character says has to be epic. Not each and every scene needs epic music building up to create tension. The movie feels flat from this point of view. It keeps running on high octane. Where are the moments of calm that help build up the tension? It's just tension in almost every scene. It feels so unnatural and out of place. The second part of the movie feels a bit better. Robert Downey Jr. Does an amazing job, so does Murphy. It's the pace of the movie that's the problem. I would have had no problem watching this as a mini series like Chernobyl. You would be able to present all of the important information without trying to capture everything in 3 hours and rushing things. It could have been something great. But it's not. 7.2/10.

I was expecting more coverage of the physics and leadership of Dr O. Instead Nolan seems singularly focused on setting the record straight on Oppenheimer. A great cast but the constant switch back and forth to scenes from the past plus conversations drowned by background music, and a focus on the conspiracies surrounding Oppenheimer, got a bit tiring. I expected a different movie. One that used imax to its maximum. I could've just watched this at home, with subtitles to aid my comprehension of otherwise hard-to-hear dialog.

Personally, i think Christopher Nolan is the best director of all time. You have a different experience in each of his movies. The cast is great and this movie was one of my first times seeing Cillian Murphy and he was spectacular to say the least. It felt like every expression had a meaning. His performance will be talked a lot over the years. RDJ stole the show every scene he was in and i wish he got more screen time. Although the movie was dialogue driven every dialogue and every scene was like an action scene courtesy of Nolan. And the music REALLY helped this film given most of the movie was based on dialogues. I'm gonna watch the movie for the second time tomorrow because i couldn't get all the information and couldn't completely understand the film although it was pretty straightforward. There were a lot of stuff to unpack in the movie. I liked it very much and i highly suggest you watch this movie.

* I am surprised by what people are saying. Is IMAX shooting something new? There are many movies shot on IMAX, most of Nolan's movies and also most of Tarantino's movies. I think there was stupidity on the part of people who watch a lot of movies and do not know what IMAX is because it is not something new, and it is also stupid of you to put your hopes on this technology. This is the first point. The second point is that the movie is about Oppenheimer. The movie does not talk about the nuclear explosion or the world war and the battles. No, the story is a biography in Nolan's style. The movie was excellent in terms of dialogue, beautiful story, and also characters. My only complaint is the exaggerated marketing of the movie. The movie will not be liked by short-film owners, action lovers, and also stupid people who rated Barbie 10 out of 10.

Cillian Murphy has now had his greatest performance of his career if he does not win best actor at the Oscar's something is very wrong in my opinion. And this movie is going to be hard to beet for me as the movie of the year. The story was very good I did not even feel that 3 hour run time at all. No spoilers but the parallel from world War 3 politics to today's political climate is astounding the sound mix of the movie was great the direction of the movie was Oscar worthy Robert Downey Jr. Was fantastic his best performance of his career as well the score of the movie was great this is very intense in places over all I loved it.
A little different from previous work of Christopher Nolan. Every single actor is perfect in their places. Murphy and Downey are nailed their character's.

The film makes you feel the atmosphere of the cinema, it entertains you not only visually, but also audibly from the great soundtracks present in it, and + the film tells you one of the greatest stories in history that changed the world, and also the performance of a mighty acting from all the crew, especially Cillian Murphy, the hero of the film. The role was created for him because he Quarrels and feelings are not great acting, but even his looks. Also, director Christopher Nolan was one of the best directors in history. He did not tell you the story of the world, Oppen Heimer, with a correct time line, but rather manipulated time so that the viewer does not feel bored while witnessing this masterpiece. This movie is a great movie, and it deserves to get many awards this year, and it deserves to be watched more than once or twice.

Review_Title: Certainly something that made me think a bit.
Review: I would give the movie an 8.5 if I could, but I'm rounding it up to a 9.

Review_Title: One of the best movies I've ever seen.
Review: This is the best movie I've seen in a very long time. On my all-time movie list it's a close 2nd with Interstellar at number 1.

I like Chris Nolan movies, biopics, and the subject of this movie but score was over the top and gave me a headache. Think people would have been falling asleep if not for the exaggerated score that makes you feel like you're having an anxiety attack for 3 hours. Topic is interesting but more befitting a documentary and would have been way more relevant if someone made this movie in the 80s when cold war and nuclear holocaust were still a concern of people. Felt like they didn't explain Robert Downey Jrs' character enough for him to be the antagonist they used him as. Not a bad movie, just not the masterpiece people are calling it. Kind of movie you may never rewatch.

One of the greatest movie I have witnessed. The movies score, cinematography, acting were all brilliant, especially the trinity test, the silence was almost deafening creating a great experience for the viewer. Will most certainly recommend watching the movie in imax as it gives the most immersive experience. Only downside of the movie is the audio quality, as for particular scenes almost nothing was understandable especially science with Lewis Strauss and the scene where Oppenheimer learns tatlock has committed sucide. The movie is highly dialogue based so a heads upon that as it may be irritable for some. The ending makes u feel a way as if you have helped him commit this crime . Overall one of the greatest movies directed by Christopher Nolan and it deserves the Oscar's for numerous acts.

I am a big fan of Christopher Nolan and my favorite films are Batman trilogy, Interstellar, and Inception in that order. I went in to see this movie with huge expectations. However, I came out disappointed. The movie started off well and I was looking forward to the second and third acts. First of all, I expected a lot more insights into various challenges or hurdles these scientists have faced while trying to come up with the atom bomb and how they overcame those. None of that was shown. Given that this movie is being made in 2023, there is huge scope for showing the trinity test in a much more impactful and fear-inducing way. What we instead see is a silent explosion that is not even close to the scale I was expecting on an IMAX screen. Yes, it is close to reality as all the scientists were witnessing this from 20 miles away, so they wouldn't hear the sound first but I didn't go in there to see a documentary. And the whole third act tested my patience. It is continuous rambling and talk from various characters without any emotional connect or impact. Waiting for the next movie of Nolan and hope he returns to the larger than life stories again.
This movie is really not worth your time. Poor story, great actors with nothing to do. Definitely one of the worst Christopher Nolan movies.

"Oppenheimer" is a cinematic masterpiece that captivates audiences with its impressive direction, profound storyline, and outstanding performances. Depicting the fascinating life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, one of the most significant physicists of the 20th century, the film is both informative and emotionally moving. The filmmakers skillfully portray the complexity of his character and the moral dilemmas he faced. The visual effects and set design transport viewers to another era, creating an authentic atmosphere. "Oppenheimer" is an absolute masterpiece and a must-watch for film and history enthusiasts alike.

Review_Title: One of the greatest movies of all time!
Review: This might not come as a shock when reading the headline, but it truly is one of the greatest movies I've seen since Forest Gump or Pulp fiction.

Review_Title: Great story about an average man called to greatness
Review: I attended Friday afternoon matinee on opening day. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the crowd. I took notice this movie was mostly sold out for all showings. It encouraged me to see people seeking out intelligent "entertainment. "

Review_Title: Another Nolan Masterpiece, featured by standouts Murphy and RDJ
Review: This movie was incredible. Extremely gripping right from the jump. You're immediately thrown into the life of J Robert Oppenheimer and his complex life and mind. The movie doesn't hold back when it comes to pace. All scenes and dialogue feel like they are shot out of a cannon, but it just further accentuates how jam-packed this movie is with information and flare. The 3 hour run-time was no issue even for somebody such as myself who tends to get bored when moves push longer than 2.5 hours. The movie almost feels like it's more around the 2 to 2 1/2 hour run-time due to how entrenched you become in the story and the overall characters. The movie can be very jarring with how technical some of the dialogue and nuanced discussions between scientists can be. Nolan doesn't try and dumb down the movie for the audience and really respects the intelligence of the viewer. A second viewing almost feels necessary to discern every character and minutiae the movie has to offer, but I wont be waiting long to indulge in that second viewing. Please go see this movie, even if you already have an idea of how some of the actual historical events took place. It's well worth your time and well.

Review_Title: Replacing inception as my favorite film
Review: Definitely being my favorite 3 hours this year, this film brings you an unexpected visual feast. You cannot miss a second, enormous details are easily missed away. This film didn't only show the creation of the nuclear bomb, it literally shows the life and tragedy of Robert Oppenheimer, how he encounters risking DESTROYING THE WORLD enable to save it.

I have never written a review on this site, nor had I planned to until I sat down and watched Oppenheimer. I was floored by its effortless genius and masterful writing. The movie takes the viewer on a turbulent, frankly disturbing ride, that leaves you jostled, depressed, and stunned. A cinematic experience that goes unmatched. A cinematic experience that I hope is not overlooked by the often ignorant Oscars. The film easily cements itself as Christopher Nolan's Magnum Opus. The directors usual tricks that often make his films at times fall flat, work wonders here. From the entirely practical effects to dialogue overload that in his other films feel hollow only fuel the fire that is Oppenheimer. Techniques that make me overjoyed that Nolan was the director to make this movie and not someone else. If you have not seen it, I urge you. Yes, it is long, and yes, it is not an action filled blockbuster, but it is something better. A movie that tells a story that changes the way the viewer perceives the world we live in. Because isn't that what art is supposed to do.

Review_Title: Another case of Emperor's new robes?
Review: Would the same movie by another director/producer receive just as much praise?

Review_Title: Christopher Nolan never lets you down
Review: Chris Nolan never stops surprising me with his movies, this is a masterpiece and his first movie ever made based on a true story, with an amazing cast, production, photography and acting, everyone here did an awesome acting.

Review_Title: it was like vanilla ice cream: not too bad and never too good
Review: It was like vanilla ice cream: not too bad and never too good. A very interesting topic, one of the biggest historical event but there was never a great moment in the movie. A very boring take on a larger than life topic. This could have been a movie that could inspire millions.

Review_Title: The wrong genre for Nolan's cinematic storytelling
Review: The movie was too long and there were too many characters introduced. Also, the story was not told in a linear fashion, so you didn't always know what was happening. The last third and parts of the first third of the film were not really necessary. I had expected more.

Review_Title: the movie is not for everyone
Review: We all been excited to see it for months. And thank god it wasn't disappointing. The cinematography, the actors, the visual effects, the sound effects, the timeline and the directing were all amazing!!! I heard alot of people saying "it wasn't what they thought" i mean.... what did you expect to see ha?... it's not a film about the atomic bomb... "it was a film about the man who created the atomic bomb" there is a big difference between those two things... i know that there was ALOT of dialogue... and the timeline was very complicated... but guys... (it's christopher nolan's film). And that's all what i have to say.
Oppenheimer (2023)

The movie had Christopher Nolan and was a banger. Especially it's rated r and 3 hours long. It also has such a great beginning and ending. I liked the part when they dodge the missile in the end and how the movie was orchestrated and it turned out absolutely amazing. The trailer was hyping it uncontrollably and had more than a 100 great scenes. I love it's realitism and when he said we're in a fight against the nazis I was so uncontrollable that I decided I would watch the movie millions of times just so I could hear that part. In particular the beginning was so good I was crying 😢 😭 😫. So this is my review on the banger oppenheimer.

"Oppenheimer," directed and written by Christopher Nolan, is a captivating cinematic masterpiece that takes the audience back to a period overshadowed by World War II. The film revolves around the life and career of J. Robert Oppenheimer, often referred to as the father of nuclear physics, with a particular focus on the Manhattan Project conducted at Los Alamos. Nolan's signature intricate narrative style and visual spectacles immerse viewers in thought-provoking reflections while delving into deep contemplation.

The best film ever written. The acting was just out of the world . The writers were just amazing. I came out of the cinema just speechless. I cant put words to this movie. That's how good it was. The effects it amazing. Best Christopher Nolan movie ever. This movie deserves so may oscars. Cillian Murphy was absolutely brilliant. He deserves Oscar . And it had some great cast in it. Go watch it now . It's so unbelievable good . I never sat still though out a movie . But this film made me sat down and still for 3hrs. I have never see a film more speechless then ever before. This an a masterpiece from the beginning to the end.

Review_Title: Im glad chris nolan is putting out a biopic for the masses to see
Review: A very emotional and intense movie. The lead up to the bomb was really captivating & i really loved the decisions they made surrounding the bomb detonation. The movie is stacked with star studded cast with great performances all around, particularly cillian & RDJ. Whilst I found the first hour to be a little slow, it really did pick up from there on. I can understand why some people may find this boring as its dialogue heavy and very little action but i thoroughly enjoyed it and knew what to expect going in. I think its worth knowing that the movie is about the story of his life as many may be misguided on what the movie is about.

If you like biography movies, you gonna enjoy it even though it's a bit long & suddenly gets complicated for no reason other than it's a Nolan movie so it has to be..
One thing I'm sure about is that Oppenheimer will win the Oscar for any sound related Awards..
The visual side of the movie is great and you can tell it's a Nolan movie, so if that's something you like you gonna enjoy it..
For the casting I think Cillian Murphy did a fantastic job he wasn't over the top as some other actors in a biography movies, although she didn't have much screen time Florence Pugh as usual proves to world that she is be the best actress right now..

I had been anticipating the release of this movie for months and it did not disappoint. I watched this via IMAX as it was intended. Nolan did a fantastic job as usual, and what we got was a visually stunning, gripping, amazing adaptation of Oppenheimers life. The cinematography, score, and acting was absolutely breathtaking. The effort put in to make this film as realistic as possible really added to the experience. 3 hours felt more like 1 hour 30 mins. Cillian was superb and I highly recommend you watch this movie.
It's really great and important story.

With so many high ratings, I figured this would be a really good movie, but I was disappointed. Many of the scenes are long and drawn out way beyond what they should be, and much of the movie is quite boring overall. The movie did have parts that were interesting and other scenes with a lot of tension, but they were a minority. This is a 3 hour movie, and I honestly think they could have trimmed this down to half that and made it 90 minutes and none of the story would be missed.

The movie was in constant thrill. It didn't let us take our eyes for a second as the minor details were making the ending plot more interesting. The cinematic shots were very perfect and the background music attached to it made them more lively. The accuracy of this historic event was also impressive and the acting of huge stars were on point. Even though the movie just only describes an historic event but the way the director portrayed it made it so much more fun and interesting. Overall the way the movie was directed gave me goosebumps and the background music just added more depth to my goosebumps.

Review_Title: Asians are CRAZY about Christopher Nolan's work
Review: I went to watch 2AM SHOW IN IMAX , PAKISTAN AND IT WAS HOUSEFUL/COMPLETE SOLD OUT.
Christopher Nolan's latest film, Oppenheimer, is an absolute triumph of storytelling and visual artistry. The IMAX experience elevated the already mesmerizing narrative to a whole new level! 🌌

A monumental achievement. A powerful story told on the grandest scale possible. Christopher Nolan's new film is based on the 2005 book "American Prometheus". The story follows the life of theoretical physicist J. Robert Oppenheimer (Cillian Murphy, finally starring in a major Hollywood feature film) and his development of the atomic bomb. From the opening sequence, Nolan lights the fuse for an explosive narrative that unfolds with incredible intensity.

This movie is not for everyone but for those who like to see strong theme, wonderfull direction and those who are aware of characters and there importance in modern day science. There are multi sequel historical events and personalities which are responsible for military capability of The USA. This movie also tells about the society behaviour as your achievements can have both positive and negative impacts. I highly recommend movie this to people who are deep thinkers who seek for sense of event while watching any movie, also the people who appreciate wonders of science experiment. Must watch it.
Have no words.its just incredible.the ending just scary and beautiful at the same time. I have nothing to to say it's just incredible much incredible.

Review_Title: It could have been 70 minutes shorter...
Review: ...or a TV show in 5 parts.

Review_Title: The greatest movie of all time
Review: First time writing a paragraph about a movie. Christopher Nolan created the master of the masterpieces he had created ever. The movie was something I have never seen. The cinematography was too perfect and the score and the music+Themes+songs+sound grading was unexplainably good.

The captures are great. Scenes are shoot perfectly. But the plot could be much better. If you expect a movie about a physicist in the process of developing a bomb thats not it. Its a film about politics and the reputation problems generated by running a secret project under the World War II.

While we may all be acquainted with the storyline of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the film attempts an audacious feat by splicing and reordering multiple periods of his life, attempting to craft a fragmented mosaic that, alas, falls short of coherence. The ill-conceived endeavour leaves audiences grappling to piece together the historical segments in a meaningful way, leading to a frustrating lack of understanding of their significance to the overarching narrative.

Perfectly fine with me and I hope that it will be a good one for me some time they will be a written one of them has different purpose and shows different view of the map and the workplace and the workplace to the games and this addiction slowly interrupts the personality of this human being and the workplace and the workplace to the games and this addiction slowly interrupts the personality of this human being and the workplace and the workplace to the games and this addiction slowly interrupts the personality of this human being and the workplace and the workplace to the games and this addiction.

This movie is just the right amount of everything. Great pacing, great turning point for the story and complete ending to the movie. Though I do feel the explosion in the movie could have felt more alive. Also there were only 3 explosions in the entire movie, which was a massive let down. Aside from that minor issue, the movie portrayed the whole story of Oppenheimer. Cinematography was on point and the acting from every cast member was through the roof. Favorite part was when they ended the movie with revealing the secret conversation between Oppenheimer and Einstein. I feel it made a strong conclusion because Oppenheimer expressed his true feeling about the atomic bomb.

Review_Title: Cubism Lends itself to Ingenious Historical Accuracy
Review: Oppenheimer takes on a very difficult job, to accurately illustrate a complex man who must reconcile his love for theoretical physics and scientific discovery with his fear of being the American Prometheus, capable of giving the country he loves the power to destroy itself.

Review_Title: A Resonant Cinematic Portrait: Oppenheimer (2023) Movie Review
Review: "Oppenheimer" (2023) is a visually captivating and thought-provoking cinematic exploration of the life and legacy of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the brilliant physicist whose pivotal role in the Manhattan Project forever changed the course of human history. Directed by Christopher Nolan the movie offers a fresh perspective on the complex character of Oppenheimer and the moral quandaries faced by those involved in the creation of the atomic bomb.

Review_Title: Personally loved it, but I understand the criticism
Review: First of all, I must say that I personally loved the movie. It was very well made and historically accurate. But I also have to point out that I'm a history nerd and I have read everything about the history of physics and the development of nuclear weapons and nuclear energy because these things fascinate me. If you're not like me, I bet this movie might feel boring.

Review_Title: A Film of the Century for a History-Defining Man.
Review: Nolan focuses on particular stage in the life of Oppenheimer, were he led the team of scientist to creating, what would be later, regarded, the Destroyer of all worlds.

Review_Title: Forgive Me For I Destroyed The World
Review: Nolan's Oppenheimer is a marvelous cinematic experience with stunning visuals, wonderful audio, good pacing and amazing acting performances. However, the film falls short in its underlying theme and story.

Always believe a great movie will leave the viewer a pounding heart after watching. The message or core value of the movie is conveyed through the story, music, scene, character themselves; gradual, hidden but so powerful which last almost forever.
Oppenheimer Review (that absolutely nobody asked for):
I'm a Nolan fan but not a fanboy to the extent I'll gloss over what I consider less than Interstellar work (see what I did there)

Review_Title: Murphy is amazing.. Nolan does it again.. 🔥 Only issue the sound design...
Review:
Cilian has to get an Oscar for this one...
Long time due recognition... Man is just brilliant...
What can we say about Nolan, exceptional..
Only taking 1 star away because of the sound / audio was tough to follow in certain phses during the film.

Review_Title: Iconic quote in the sex scene!??
Review: It was good movie. But It wasn't like one of the masterpiece. It wasn't very good cinematically, but it was good for a biopic. And it is my first Nolan ' s movie. I watched for Openheimer.i knew him before the movie announcement. I watched documentary about him .And not gonna lie I didn't know Nolan's name before the movie announcement. Anyways movie portrayed political things good but philosophically something was missing. Like most iconic quote in movies was used in the sex scene. Yes they used after the bomb but the philosophical value of that quote is simplified with that sex scene. Also They didn't use the words he used before saying this famous quote. "We knew the world will not be the same Few people laughed,few people cried,most people were silent..." I was expecting those words in the movie. Honestly I was disappointed. But overall good movie.

Review_Title: Tedious at times but it needed to be said this way.
Review: Tedious at times but it needed to be said this way or risk leaving out what transpired when they started the project and what transpired after WWII was over. Strauss was a villain, and Oppenheimer a genius for the science and the application of the science. He wove his skills he honed in his life for being the nerds nerd. He was their hero and another powerful man's ambitions was something that he hadn't prepared for or didn't see.

Review_Title: Triumph and conspiracy, an outstanding retelling of one of the greatest and most complicated figures of the the 20th century
Review: I am biased towards historical period pieces as history often tells the most human stories and movies exaggerate these stories for dramatic effect. Nolan understands how to to paint a memoir of Oppenheimer without rose tinged glasses. You won't find the conventional action in this but the words spoken carry a much more compelling conflict than any car chase or battle. This is more about my love for the genre but Nolan made a great historical time piece, and to be Honest, got a lot of help from the uniqueness, complexity, and significance of having one of the most interesting men, Oppenheimer, live during one of the most interesting time periods, the 1930-40s. However these traits are a double edge sword as a lesser team would have fumbled all the details onto the screen, making the audience unable to pick up the pieces of such a complex puzzle. One more thing to remember, THIS MOVIE IS ABOUT OPPENHEIMER, NOT THE ATOMIC BOMB so don't think the bomb is the focus of the movie, it's only one chapter of Oppenheimers life. That being said go out and watch Oppenheimer to support other historical movies as history tells the most compelling stories. Because in fiction characters are good and bad but in history, everyone believes themselves to be good.

This movie is truly magnificent. All of Nolan's decisions are somewhat changing the rules of cinema and going around them. The acting is brilliant from all sides. Murphy is one of the best actors and will be truly appreciated after this role. Also, I truly love the fact that there is no CGI in this movie. It makes every explosion or metaphor for Oppenheimer's thoughts even more strong than if they were computer generated. Also the montage of the film is truly marvelous and innovative. The film is constructed in such way that it catches the audience's attention and it doesn't let go. For sure, this is one for the future generations!

Review_Title: Without VFX or wild stunts, Nolan captures audiences
Review: Chris Nolan, never attended film-school, captured audiences with a well-crafted story that's exquisitely delivered through good acting and brilliant cinematography. I like how he intermingled B&W of one story (subplot) with color portrayal of the main-story. Against the backdrop of history and a wide-screen perspective of momentous-events and the natural-beauty of New Mexico, Nolan followed the personal journey of this complex yet important man, Oppenheimer, through his rise and fall. We see all of his human failings to reflect the good and bad in ourselves.

Maybe not best Nolan movie (or best movie ever) but it gives extraordinary cinema experience: sound design, soundtrack, music - I have never heard anything like Oppenheimer. For example, Ludwig Goransson's score for Tenet - is my favourite ever. For this movie - need to listen again, but it worth second chance.

Review_Title: It's a good film but not great
Review: At the beginning, I think that most people thought that this movie is about the nuclear bomb and there will be many explosions, and I am one of the people who thought that there would be explosions, because of the marketing and the hype in this film were saying this, but it is very logical that there will be no explosions other than the experimental explosion unless Oppenheimer Participated in the war but he didn't, I may not like biographical films much unless I am interested in the person, and in Robert Oppenheimer's life I am more interested in the nuclear bomb. Perhaps if the movie was about the nuclear bomb and focusing on it, it would have been better, i missed the first 10 minutes of the film but the beginning was normal for me like any other biography, I like the conflict with his life , with jean and his friend and kitty, and the interior conflict that caused after they dropped the bomb in Hiroshima, This shows you the act that comes with regret later on, The climax in this film was so powerful and touched me and deserved to watch it on 70mm IMAX screen but only this scene d: ,The speech scene after they dropped the bomb, After that there was an inner struggle scene that Nolan showed us visually in a very cool way, i see that 3 hours is a lot for this film , it could be better than that in my opinion, the cinematography and the soundtrack ill not say anything about it i mean it's so good ofc, the editing style i didnt like it so much and i feel like it's messy, And I think Nolan is obsessed with time and decided to use editing to play between past, present and future, it's not like the editor is bad or something no but i felt this method didn't work with me, When I missed the 10 minutes, I felt that I had missed something because i didnt understand what happened when they went to the B+W , so I started thinking about what I missed, and then at the time I was thinking about, the future tense appeared and I said holy shit wtf is this, and I missed the time while thinking about what i missed but i got it quickly because I know Nolan he loves to play with time , but i think people don't know him they will take a lot longer to realize what is happening.
Yes, we all expected this to be visually stunning, with a cast laden with the best in the business giving stellar performances all round. And of course, it delivers in spades.

I tried too much to like this one, but I couldn't at all and I don't even see the point, why they kept talking about shooting the whole movie by Imax cameras ? .. It's not an action film and 'it's not visually impressive at all, and all this talk about the Imax camera and the perfect seats to experience the movie seams so funny now after watching it.

Review_Title: Too loud too long too much
Review: We have talking, more talking, again talking, then a bomb and then again talking talking talking.

Review_Title: Great work. Amazing movie. But I found something which should not be in the movie
Review: I feel now Openheimer is more popular than Albert Einstein after this movie and everyone knows. Great movie best screenplay another masterpiece from Christopher Nolan. Apparently scientific part in the movie was very small. They could have added more how they built the bomb. What is heavy waters. I found that in the scene where Openheimer sitting in his house with his wife on a dining table there is an Ethernet port or analog telephone port in the back wall. I observed this 2 times in the movie. I am sure that there was no ethernet and phone ports. I am writing it here because I could not find anywhere to report. Let me know if you feel the same.

8.5/10. He uses sound very well, making the bomb actually quieter than the scenes before and especially after it. It also showed the strange life of Oppenheimer which I didn't know much about at all. The visuals were amazing also. Was torn between giving this an 8/10 and 9/10.

There's never been a movie like this before. Hopefully there will be more like it in the future. Thank you to Nolan and the entire production team and cast. This film delivers in every area - it's a piece of art produced by masters of their craft.

"Oppenheimer" has left an lasting impression on me, a feat only a handful of movies have ever accomplished. Through Nolan's exceptional storytelling and artistic abilities, this film presented history and life from fresh perspectives, which captured my attention from the opening scene to the final credits. I just sat there while the credits rolled in the end, in silence feeling a sense of the horror Oppenheimer must have felt at his accomplishment. I foresee this film having a significant influence on audiences all over the world. Prior to watching this movie, I had little knowledge of Oppenheimer. However, it has given me a fascination and hunger to learn more about him and the stories told in the movie. Oppenheimer and his associates set into motion a series of irreversible events that have significantly shaped our world. His choices and their consequences remind us of the profound impact an individual's life can have on history.

I recently had the pleasure of watching Oppenheimer in theaters and I must say, it was an absolute masterpiece. The soundtracks were brilliant and really added to the overall experience of the film. The cinematography was top-notch and visually stunning, making every scene a feast for the eyes. The script was well-done, keeping me engaged from start to finish. The standout performances by Jason Clarke, Gary Oldman, Rami Malek, and Robert Downey Jr. Were exceptional and truly brought their characters to life. I also have to give special credit to Cillian Murphy for his remarkable performance. This was my first film that I've watched in theaters and it was truly a captivating and well-executed movie that I highly recommend to anyone looking for a great cinematic experience. I give Oppenheimer my highest recommendation and hats off to Matt Damon, Josh Hartnett, Emily Blunt, and Florence Pugh for their amazing performances.

If you don't like history movies, just don't watch history movies. I'm seeing most the negative reviews here being bored by the "history lesson". But this movie is about history, so what did you expect? The "boring" part I seriously cannot understand. This was one of the most anxiety inducing, suspenseful, engaging, compelling, and interesting films I've ever seen. I think the fact that it's three hours will rule out a lot of viewers because some people just simply don't have a long enough attention span.

Review_Title: Going to the cinema to see this movie, naah
Review: When you see that this movie was made by Christopher Nolan and the whole impressive cast you think that you will see best movie of this year .. but what I saw was unexpected and overrated movie unfortunately, 3 hours is too long to this story.

Review_Title: A unique and unforgettable cinematic experience.
Review: 9.5/10. Let me establish some context before I present my review. I went to watch the movie without any expectations, without prior knowledge about Oppenheimer and without even watching the trailer. My love for Christopher Nolan's work and being a huge fan of majority of the film's cast incited me to watch the movie on the first day itself. If I were to give a review in one sentence, it would be "Either you will truly love this movie or greatly appreciate it but nobody will hate it". Everything about this movie is top-notch. The casting, cinematography, direction, background score (which will take your breath away) and pretty much everything else is phenomenal with great attention to detail, something which has become a standard for Nolan's work. Just half hour into the movie and I said to myself that I am witnessing something special. There were more than two times in the movie, when I was genuinely left with my mouth wide open and eyes mesmerising at the screen. If you are interested or have spare time at your arsenal, learning something about the life about the main character and World war 2 in general would be helpful, although not compulsory by any means. It will just help you better understand the nuances of the movie and better grasp it without getting overwhelmed with the introduction of different characters. At the end, I would finish the review by saying that this is truly a cinematic experience, which needs to be enjoyed in a movie theatre in order to properly appreciate the great effort that went behind this now critically acclaimed project.

Review_Title: The explosion trial scene makes it a memorable watch.
Review: "Oppenheimer." like previous Nolan's films, the screenplay was ingeniously crafted in a non-linear format, challenging the audience to piece together the narrative puzzle seat.

I'm gutted. Genuinely gutted!! I couldn't wait for this to come out in a year of dross cinema!!! I KNEW I shouldn't have trusted the fanboy reviews. "Oooo, Nolan is a master!!" "Best film ever made!!" Absolute BS!!!!! This is utter garbage!!! 3 hrs of talking and nothing happening!!!!! Usual Nolan music score drowning out dialogue. 2 minutes to show an atomic explosion which was just a fireball in slo-mo. I have never been so bored in my life. The acting was ok and I'm sure it will win a million Oscar's. I KNEW I should have gone to see Barbie instead of this utter waste of time and talent!!!!

Review: I may consider myself lucky to be alive to watch Christopher Nolan Works which get better by years.

Review_Title: The Best Movie In This Year
Review: As always, Christopher Nolan never disappoint me, all his movie was amazing. It's the first time I've watched a Biography movie, and I really liked it, and I'm going to watch it again.

This is the another amazing movie from nolan's movie and he complete his collection with making these movies!!!!!!!! This is historic movie from nolan and we enjoy from his real charactristic and i really need to see a real WWII from him, his way need to be near reality.

Review_Title: Powerful Message That Can't Be Ignore
Review: Our government is scary... The main theme behind Nolan's newest film based upon the creation of the atomic bomb. Wonderful acting, powerful score and really good storytelling are just some of the many great things this movie had to offer. A very educational film as well as riveting, but the one major word I have for this film is, tragic. A group of men and women who changed the world in the deserts of New Mexico, who worked a miracle that would shape the future of planet earth, only to have their creation used for war and death ... this film was more of a warning than for entertainment purposes.

Review_Title: Must watch if you are Christopher Nolan' movie Fan
Review: Kantara, KGF PART 1-2 , PUSPA, Created for mass ....but no one can match Christopher Nolan' Directorial Epic 'Oppenheimer' ......Some say it's boring and too lengthy.... But if you sit back and think it as a Biopic and the struggles which Oppenheimer had in his life you will realise the film made full justice to his character and his story.....apart from controversial statement of bringing Bhagwat Gita phrase ....the film has done no wrong .....

For the first time to see another side of science
Movie will have a mix of feeling between sadness and happiness regardless of the politics inside it.

Review_Title: Very very good, with some shortcomings
Review: I want to love this movie as much as I do the other Nolan films, but I can't quite get there. First off, the acting is incredible, it does feel like a period piece, and the cast is A++. True to its name, this is really a film about Oppenheimer's life, with all the good and bad included. It does a very good job of showing the existential issues related to the bomb, and it is a heavy film in the way you would expect.

I enjoyed this film completely. I think it was fantastic. I can see why CGI wasn't used for the bomb, because the actual explosion wasn't the main focus in the film. Then again it was.... The acting was top notch and the director did a terrific job. I knew very little about Oppenheimer before this movie. Just an all around impressive film. Yes it's 3 hrs, but honestly what adult can't sit and watch a film this good for few a few hrs. It's Not like they aren't sitting around somewhere else on there butt. I found myself the next day looking up things about Oppenheimer on my phone and watching documentaries about his life. I honestly might go see it again.

This was a good (not great, but good) film spoilt by the pervasive music, which made the first 30 minutes sound like a long trailer. It also made the dialogue exceptionally difficult to hear. I would actually watch it again at home just so I can actually hear what's going on. Maybe it's the nature of the iMax experience, which is incredibly bass-y.

Review_Title: A Tedious Snoozefest: ''Oppenheimer'' Misses the Mark
Review: Where do I even begin with ''Oppenheimer''? This film was an absolute disaster from start to finish. I can't believe I wasted precious hours of my life on such a pretentious and uninspiring piece of cinema.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer made me feel what I've never felt in a film
Review: In my opinion, the film Oppenheimer is one of the best films in the history of the film industry. I've never felt an explosion in a film as much as I did in Oppenheimer. In my cinema I could literally feel the pressure wave. In addition, the plot of the film was written and filmed absolutely perfectly. You were emotionally taken a lot and the events were presented in great detail and accurately. For this reason, I cannot understand many of the criteria, for example. Either you don't have patience because the film is so long or many don't understand it because they don't have the necessary intelligence to be able to understand the film, because otherwise you would give the film at least a 9.0. As for the acting, I can only say that it was an absolute champion performance by everyone. I also take my hat off to the absolutely legendary execution and direction of Nolan and the film's producers. Thank you for letting me sit in such a masterpiece.

Review_Title: If you didn't love the first time, you will the second
Review: Oppenheimer directed and written by Christopher Nolan is truly one of the best films of the past decade. My first watch I found myself loving every aspect of a Christopher Nolan movie. The image as always is clean and gorgeous, you can feel the IMAX. The storyline is nonlinear and challenges both your attention and comprehension, a very rewarding way for a director to think high of its audience. Finally the score, where before the GOAT Hans Zimmer has more than once amazed us with his magic, Ludwig Göransson returns from previously working on Tennet and gives an absolute masterpiece. Ive been listening to the score since my first watch, and listening to it again on my second made me love it much more. And that is what happens with the rest of the movie. Although I loved every technical aspect on my fisrt watch, I did found myself agreeing with my friends that the movie could've been made shorter and even a little lighter. Although I argued that its length and constant bombardment of information was no reason whatsoever for a miss in the movie, I didn't argued enough on its behalf for elevating it and become much more than a historical movie. At the end, my first watch was an amazong movie with room for improvement, maybe for an easier watch. How I wish I never said that. It is only on my second watch when truly every detail is rich and powerful and meaningful. Where first I found empty space or simply overdoing of a scene, now I found a whole new spectrum of the movie. If you felt similar on your first watch, or you thought you would've love it more, do yourself a favor and give it a second watch. Christopher Nolan crafted this movie with every expertise he's gathered throughout his entire carrier. You can see his experience on Dunkirk, Inception, The Prestige, Insomnia, and pretty much his entire filmography put together on his yet most ambitious film. It feels he's been preparing for this movie his whole life. The acting is phenomenal, specially by Murphy and Downey, I can see them both wining the oscar easily so far this year. The thing most people will have a problem with and it was my little nitpick on my first watch will be the script. Being too long and too rich with information may fall like a very overwhelming experience and I can truly understand that. I above all argue that this is not a movie for anyone, you must commit to it, truly, but if you do it rewards with a very immersive and terrifying experience. And that END. I don't care if you like movies or not, if this was for you or not, but if you didn't marveled a the end with the amazing score concluding the destruction of the world, I don't trust you. In overall, I truly think Christopher Nolan made his masterpiece, I think he out did himself on this one and stepped out from his comfort zone (if you could say that) making this historical and yet inmersive study of character experience. A film for the ages, only time will tell if it truly is Nolan's best, now I could argue that is his second or third, but that may be the hype, or may not.

One of the best cinematic experiences of all time. Everything from acting to directing to the cinematography is really really good. It challenges you as a person and it leaves you feeling an emptiness inside yourself. Robert Downey Jr was outstanding and his monologue at the end is too good. Cillian Murphy was excellent as always and Emily Blunt as well. The trinity test sequence is absolutely phenomenal while obeying the laws of physics of the speed of sound and light. When you hear Oppenheimer's iconic quote "Now I am become death, the destroyer of worlds" it will give you goosebumps and you will enjoy that moment. Overall a great cinematic watch. I definitely reccomend watching it in theatres.

A theater rattling experience! That's the first thing to come to mind. Very few movies create such a cinematic experience as Oppenheimer, however, this can be expected as Christopher Nolan tends to deliver grand movies!

I was highly anticipating this movie since the trailer dropped earlier this year since I was a big fan of Nolan's Dunkirk. Going in, I was scared that this movie wasn't going to live up to my expectation but by the end I could say that it has surpassed it. The visuals were truly spectacular, the score was fantastic, cinematography even more so. Cillian Murphy's acting was very good as J. Robert Oppenheimer. I felt that he encapsulates the character of Oppenheimer very authentically and makes him a very complicated figure that we could all sympathise with despite being the father of one of the most destructive weapons that humanity has ever created. All of that couldn't have been done without Murphy's acting. The side characters were also pretty well played by their respective actors with my favourites being Lewis Strauss played by Robert Downey Jr. And Albert Einstein by Tom Conti. All of this combined making the movie one of the most engaging that I have seen for quite some time in theatres. 10/10.

This could easily be Nolans best work yet or ever. The only nit pick I have is the audio mixing with music and dialogue that Nolan has struggled with in his past couple movies, is still a slight problem here. Other than that, the casting (Cillian and RDJ are oscar bound), epic music, dialogue, cinematography, storytelling is all a masterpiece. THIS IS NOT A MOVIE ABOUT THE ATOMIC BOMB. ITS ABOUT OPPENHEIMER. Nolan tells the story of oppenheimers insane life pre, post and during the war to perfection and Cillian Murphy makes you feel everything he went through along the way. At no point did I feel like the movie was dragging because it has a breakneck pace that could be tiring but it keeps you glued to the screen. If you don't give yourself the chance to see this movie in theaters (IMAX preferably), you are robbing yourself of an opportunity to see one of the most important movies in recent memory.
As an admirer of Nolan, I came into this movie with big expectations. While it had its merits, I couldn't help but feel disappointed.

Oppenheimer is a movie that you 100% have to pay attention to as it will jump around to many different places, however, if you can keep track and put everything together.......well this movie is gonna leave you speechless.

This show could've been great. It was great, don't get me wrong. It tells a story, truly amazing. Leave out the sex, leave out the f bombs and you have a decent show. It was not needed. It added nothing to the movie. People left because of the sex. The cinematography was beyond amazing. The acting amazing. I love Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon. I did want to see more of the actual bombing and I always want captions when I'm at the theatre. The sound effects were so loud. There were a few things I didn't follow that I had to look up later that I wished that had explained more fully. All in all it was a great movie.

I'll begin by saying Oppenheimer is technically very impressive (cinematography, acting, sound, etc.). Absolutely top notch Nolan on display as always. Where the movie distinctly falls short, however, is the sheer uncompromising amount of *stuff* the movie wants to tell you.

This. Will. Win. Everything. Under. The. Sun. Whether all the credit goes to Cillian Murphy's brillance or to Nolan for tapping Cillian, we may never know. But both combine for something that will go unmatched for a long time. An honest biopic about Robert Oppenheimer that doesn't provide any answers because there are no easy answers. Instead, it lends to the audience a masterwork of a story worth pondering over & over. This goes above Nolan's past best works in Dunkirk and Inception, not only due to the refined wizardry of Nolan's genius but also to the nature of what the film sets out to explore -- that momentous juncture in human history when we couldn't mathmatically rule out that we, as humanity, could destroy ourselves in the very attempt to save ourselves--with all of our human complexicites webbed throughout.

Awesome, NOLAN .. THANKS FOR THIS. WE REMEMBER THIS. Your cinematic brilliance . 1st half at some parts while charcters discussing little boring feeling i felt but except that genius of a cinema. Watched first time your film in theatre it's great . Thanks .. CILLIAN MURPHY , EMILY BLUNT, ROBERT DOWNEY JR. , RAMI MALEK ACTING AWESOME. Review: One of the best films in a long time I can't praise it enough it describes history beautifully. Honestly going to the cinema was an unbelievable experience even when you realize that no computer effects were used in the film so it's really incredible. The cast is so well cast and the resemblance to real actors is just amazing. Cillian Murphy should deserve an award for this film because he played the role so well , I hope fiom will be properly appreciated . The explosion scene was one of the best I've ever seen the silence and the look I can't get enough of it , More films like this !

Quite simply one of the best films I've ever seen im just lost for words at how good this movie is the casting the directing there's no one thing in particular but just sometimes a movie comes along and everything is just so perfect that leaves you lost for words and I have a bone to pick with Mr Nolan he's the only guy who has me crying at some point in his movies I think that says it all really and just make sure you see it in the IMAX this will win everything come awards time no contest everybody else better go home 😆 I never thought another movie would get me like Shaw Shank Redemption but there you go it has.

Review_Title: Perhaps the Greatest of Christopher Nolan's Films
Review: Christopher Nolan delivered on essentially every front with Oppenheimer. This film was able to encapsulate the complexity and moral web of J. Robert Oppenheimer's life. Right away, with the opening scene, this film instills in you the seriosity with which it should be taken. Actors Cillian Murphy and Robert Downey Jr. Delivered particularly stellar performances, though across the board, this film's acting was incredible. The soundtrack of Oppenheimer deserves equal praise, and though the plot can be slow at points, it makes sense why. This is not a film to be rushed. Amongst his other films, this movie stands above all of them, except for, perhaps, Interstellar.
My bike ride home from the cinema was filled with intense shakes as I tried to process what I had just witnessed.

Review_Title: Review from a die hard Nolan & history fan..
Review: I love Nolan's movies. I love iMax, we have one iMax theatre in my country and I have to go see his movies there. I also happen love history.
If you are aware of basic events of life of Oppenheimer and are not expecting a super spicy movie with loads of drama but beautiful cinematography, This movie is for you.

Is this the generation of fimemakers we have to depend on in terms of critical perspective on our government? In the end it is the same old male valorizing story Hollywood has been producing since its inception.

I had great expectations when I went to the movie. When I left the movie, all my expectations were met. We can say that it is nolan's best movie.

It's so well balanced, it's definitely not a movie for everyone. Don't expect any drama or action sequences. It's a story about a guy a scientist who didn't fall into something and has superpowers. His just a scientist who created something.it's for war nerds or history nerds like me who watch history channel for hours or still get fascinated by WW documentary and stories. There's are so many lives involved, so many people who never got a chance to tell there story. Many people would have lived without knowing about this guy. It's just a very beautiful movie.

Review_Title: More focused on bureaucracy than fundamentals of physics
Review: I was very hyped about this movie but I'm somewhat disappointed. I found this movie more focused on the bureaucracy. It could have been more focused on the scientific part like the inventions of physics during this project. Review_Title: Everyone's talking about the good, so I'm gonna talk about the bad
Review: What I have against this movie :

"Oppenheimer" is a biographical thriller film written and directed by Christopher Nolan ("The Dark Knight trilogy", "Inception",
"Interstellar", "Dunkirk"), based on the biography "American Prometheus" by Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin. Starring Cillian Murphy in the lead role, in addition to Matt Damon, Robert Downey Jr, Emily Blunt, and Florence Pugh, it subverts the usual biopic formula to create a brilliantly layered examination of a man throughout all of his incredible accomplishments and fundamental flaws.

"Oppenheimer" is a biographical thriller film written and directed by Christopher Nolan ("The Dark Knight trilogy", "Inception",
"Interstellar", "Dunkirk"), based on the biography "American Prometheus" by Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin. Starring Cillian Murphy in the lead role, in addition to Matt Damon, Robert Downey Jr, Emily Blunt, and Florence Pugh, it subverts the usual biopic formula to create a brilliantly layered examination of a man throughout all of his incredible accomplishments and fundamental flaws.

This was one of the most transcendent, intellectually harrowing and emotionally horrifying experiences I've ever had. Not at the movies, EVER. I believe this is by far Nolan's most emotional piece (yes, I'd put this above interstellar) and as someone who needs no introduction in terms of cerebral movies, it was absolutely incredible for that to be paired with a sense of visceral character explorations. And make no mistake, this movie will haunt you. And terrify you. I'm the biggest horror nut around, having seen Jaws before I turned 8, and from then, the shining, Blair witch, Halloween, terrifier, NONE of them scared me like this. This movie scared me so much I started crying and shaking in my seat.

It might be one of the most accomplished Nolan movies. The movie is centred on the carachtere of Oppenheimer and the challanges he have faced when making the atomic bomb in a biographical manner . The movie also expose events from oppenheimer life begore and after the project.
(This review is based on oppenheimer vs barbie perspective)

Review_Title: An amazing and refreshing movie, that is a bit too long.
Review: I know this is a late review, but since Oppenheimer is still in the theaters, I decided to write about it.

Review_Title: A good movie; a bit below the hype and expectations
Review: The movie is little slow / long, lacks the quality of screenplay / dialogue which is hallmark of Christopher Nolan and Cillian Murphy movies 🎥. The the absence of powerful language and emotions doesn't provide a fair opportunity to properly exhibit the acting talent of Murphy. If, one goes, with quality and content of Peaky Blinders, he will be disappointed. Over all a good and worth watching movie to understand this important character/event in history. Resemblances can be found between Dr. Oppenheimer and Dr. A. Q. Khan of Pakistan. They restored his honour partially in 1963 and finally in 2022 when his security clearance withdrawal in 1954 was revoked.

In the world of Insatiable and ADHD'ic people. This movie is in vain. The wrong time you could say. People who are vastly into science or show interest in science will find this movie very attractive. I've seen people fluctuating about their opinions on this film like anything. Nolan is truly a genius and he knows what he's doing. The split between the black and white and other sequences is elegantly done as Nolan shows metaphorically claims chain reactions. Beautiful to watch. I don't think there is any cinematic genius than Nolan. 3 hours is action-packed for people who want to watch. For the name-sake views it's just low grade. I've seen people sleep in the first half and all of a sudden it got interesting in the second half. Nowadays people can't understand setups. You can't make a 3-hour film full of explosion scenes. The US did not take the blame for the civilian deaths in Hiroshima. It was a war crime. The fact that they tested the bomb on Indian lands and the radioactive contamination is also a problem. And Oppenheimer is particularly well described in the famous novel STARBUL.

Review_Title: Military propaganda at it's finest. It lacks heart, insight & dimensions.
Review: Wasn't a fan, American military propaganda at it's finest. The struggle between ego and morality wasn't developed enough & the human impact of nuclear warfare was told in in the most egotisical way.

"Oppenheimer" is a cinematic masterpiece that reaffirms Christopher Nolan's position as a visionary director. With meticulous attention to historical detail, he takes us on an enthralling journey into the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the brilliant physicist and key figure behind the development of the atomic bomb. The cast's performances are nothing short of exceptional, with each actor breathing life into their respective characters, making them relatable and engaging.
Nolan has a reputation for mind-bending, twisty-turny movies that leave your brain in knots, right? Well, despite it's magnificence, "Oppenheimer" doesn't exactly fit that bill.

Oppenheimer is a cinematic masterpiece that exemplifies Christopher Nolan's unparalleled directorial genius. The movie's gripping narrative, coupled with awe-inspiring sound engineering and music, makes it an unforgettable cinematic experience.

Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer,' deserves all the praise that it gets. It's a Nolan film and you get more than what you had paid for. The movie despite its 3 hour runtime doesn't fail to keep me engaged, however if you are the typical average audience then I can see how you would manage to be bored throughout the movie. The movie was super realistic and makes me appreciate Cillian Murphy as an actor. I have to say - the cast is wonderful and Nolan really knows how to put them to work. Throughout the film there were times I would get tremendously sweaty, so nervous that I would firmly grasp the side of my seat. The movie is a masterpiece and the best bibliographical movie I've ever seen.

Oppenheimer is worth the hype especially if you watch it in IMAX. It's the best biopic to date, Nolan really shows his excellent interpretation through his direction and all supporting actors truly deliver. In true Nolan fashion his thought are dispersed in a way where in the end it leaves you satisfied as it is cohesive and thought provoking. His interpretation of the character is amazing. The way he combines physics, philosophy and politics is mesmerising.

I will say I was waiting a long time for this to finally hit theaters and I was not dissappointed. Let's start with the slight negatives I have about this movie. The story seemed to drag a little bit, on top of it being 3 hours long. It is really slow paced, slower than I would of liked. The good thing I would say is that the story itself is very intriguing and grasping. That is what made it better.

I don't feel fully equipped to review Oppenheimer. I don't know if I was fully equipped to see it. Is seeing even the right term? I was snapped up by it, tossed about by it, brought to tears by it, left shaken by it.
