Oppenheimer is a 2023 historical epic film directed by Christopher Nolan and written by Nolan and the late David Kajganich. The film stars Cillian Murphy as J. Robert Oppenheimer, the scientist who led the Manhattan Project to develop the atomic bomb during World War II. The film also stars Emily Blunt, Matt Damon, Robert Downey Jr., Florence Pugh, Benny Safdie, Rami Malek, and Kenneth Branagh.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer: Creator of Atomic bomb and destroyer of the World
Review: I expected more bomb making and testing than politics, but director wanted to show personal portrait of Oppenheimer.

The character assassination of Julius Robert Oppenheimer is a much described and debated subject, and it's basically also what this film is about, I think, and little about nuclear bomb making. Nevertheless, though it's nearly three hours long, director Christopher Nolan still tries to fill the plot with more than is possible, and the results is that it stylistically appears like an endless trailer, where the editing and the jumping in time looks more like a long music video than an epic film. At times it becomes distressing to watch, and it's a great relief when this cannonade of pictures takes breaks in a few longer and slower sequences. If the intention has been to illustrate the main character's inner life during the process, it's perhaps reasonable, but this great topic would probably fit better as a mini series. However, Cillian Murphy makes the very best out of it as Oppenheimer, and despite the aggressive editing he manages to build a credible character. Sadly it doesn't work too well for several other characters, who also are more or less miscasted.

"Oppenheimer" is an exceptional cinematic experience that exceeded all my expectations. The plot is captivating, filled with suspense and unexpected twists that keep the audience engaged. The characters are well-developed, and the performances are phenomenal, drawing viewers into their emotional journey. The direction, cinematography, and musical score all contribute to a visually stunning and emotionally resonant film. While a few minor pacing issues exist, they hardly detract from the overall brilliance of "Oppenheimer." It's a must-watch for any film enthusiast, earning my enthusiastic rating of 9/10. Bravo to the cast and crew for creating such a profound and memorable movie.

Review_Title: Too good to be called a "masterpiece"
Review: Can't say much. You get immersed in the world and atmosphere Christopher Nolan builds, and with the ending this film leaves a deep impact on you. Words fall short for Nolan's brilliance, "masterpiece" would be an understatement. To me it's Nolan's best film, even better than Interstellar. It isn't just about the atom bomb. It's a deep dive within its creator's character and life. It is Nolan's most emotional and impactful film. He has covered so many aspects and genres of life in one biopic. All the actors have done absolutely top level acting, especially Cillian Murphy and Robert Downey Jr who shine in their roles. This is probably the best biopic we have seen in a long time!

THIS MOVIE IS AWESOME, AFTER I WATCHED THIS MOVIE I HONESTLY FELT LIKE IT ONLY LASTED A HOUR OR A FEW MINUTES. THE CINEMATOGRAPHY AND SOUND MADE THIS MOVIE FEEL LIKE A ART PIECE, NOT PICASSO, NOT DA VINCI, NOT MICHELANGELO BUT ALL OF THEM COMBINED. THIS MOVIE MADE ME WANT TO BECOME A PHYSICIST AND COMPLETELY REVAMP ALL OF THE PHYSICS. THIS MOVIE IS HONESTLY BETTER THAN THE NR 1 MOVIE ABOUT THE PRISONER. AFTER WATCHING THIS MOVIE I JUST NEED TO SAY IT IS THE BEST MOVIE I HAVE SEEN IN MY LIFE, IT DEALS WITH MORALS, DEATH, WAR AND GUILT. I HONESTLY FEELT ANGRY AND SAD FOR OPPENHEIMER SEEING AS HES RESPOSIBLE FOR THE DEATHS OF AT LEAST 220,000 PEOPLE, BUT I ALSO FEEL ANGRY THAT HE BUILDT A WEAPON OF MASS DESTROUCTION.

Movie is great and all thanks to Christopher Nolan but the plot is very confusing and the pacing isn't in chronological order. The characters are also very confusing because of how plentiful they are. I had to do some research after watching the movie so that I could fully understand it, but I still can't connect the characters and I am missing a big part of the storyline.

Review_Title: Sohaib é o melhor crítico de cinema da história
Review: It is unfair to write a review and evaluation of Oppenheimer's film, it is like someone coming to you and trying to explain the greatness of what Ronaldo did in 2019 The comeback, the topic is too great to be described with mere words, you must see it in order to feel its greatness.

"Oppenheimer" is an awe-inspiring cinematic triumph that surpasses all expectations. Crafted with dedication, the decision to shoot entirely with IMAX cameras sets a new standard for visual excellence. Clocking in at a remarkable three hours, it boldly claims the title of the longest IMAX film ever, and rightfully so.

Cutting to the chase, I did not know how this would turn out. The media was hyping it up. After watching it, I was speechless. The music is a masterpiece, cinematography is amazing, acting is so strong.

The movie was fine honestly not my favorite. While the elements such as costumes, sets, and cinematography are amazing and done very well I think the movie is half baked. At many points I wish they would show less of something and show wayyyy more of something else. Definitely wish we saw more of the bombing. If you are someone who is into "films" or interested in this part of history definitely recommend watching but for just a causal viewer I personally wouldn't recommend. Also the never ended celebrity cameos sorta took me out of the illusion. Josh Peck being in the movie is so unserious. The sex scenes are not that intense but definitely a skip for young viewers.

Review_Title: History changing movie , about history changing event
Review:
It discusses important questions that float in our heads , or those who wonder about how did the world get to this point
It explains how it happened how humanity is it's own first enemy , if it's curiosity, rise to power or whatever it's , if we don't consider what's coming we will unleash destruction , devastation
the acting on of each an every actor is almost the best in each of their careers
they are committed and emerged and will take you inside Oppenheimer's head and the chaotic story about science vs politics vs just being decent human beings
the soundtrack and sound effects are immersive ,you are not just travel there , you experience what's in the character's head and the pressure and how they see things
and the final quote , it's there to stay and defines the stage we are at as human race.

Acting was tremendous and the true story behind it is a pot of gold. But I felt it was way too long. Could have been 1.5hr easily. It's like the Editor had all these great scenes and at the end decided to keep them all in. Also there was a lot of minute detail about the political history, yet not enough for a history buff like me satisfied. The music was WAY overdramatic for my tastes, heightening the drama in anticipation of some huge climax.. only to be let down with some meaningless line. People were asleep in the theater all around us, including my wife, and I admit struggling to stay awake myself.

Review_Title: The movie is a Bomb, Sadly
Review: This movie has a great staff of actors who all did a great job, especially Emily Blunt who really shows her chops in her limited role in the film. The sets of the period where very accurately represented it made you feel like you were in the 1940's, the cinematography was excellent. All of this should make for a great film.

In my opinion, it's Nolan's greatest film thus far, and my personal favorite movie in general. It's a very impactful visceral experience that makes you feel strong emotions of awe, concern and wonder. You think and feel about humanity throughout the film and it's difficult to stop thinking about these feelings after you leave the theater. The actors and story remind you what it means to be human, with people's everyday emotions and feelings like calm, hope, love, glamour, lust, sadness, empathy, jealousy, chaos and hatred. Yet you also feel the immense fragility of humanity due to our potential for barbarism, conspiracy and self-destruction at the level of the atomic bomb, while also feeling awe for our ingenuity, intelligence and glamour in our scientific and artistic pursuits in life. These contradictory feelings of the nature of human life are interwoven with each other and it makes you ponder how complex, beautiful, serious, grandiose, important and precious our lives are. The film is made all the more potent once you realize all of this, developing and using atomic bomb, and for the most part, happened, and this is who we are, and you are viewing, to some extent, reality, when you watch the bomb explode and observe the human circumstances arround it. Cillian Murphy does a great job as Dr. Oppenheimer, as do the others. I highly recommend seeing it in Imax to get a bigger screen and a louder Soundsystem to fully enjoy what I believe is a once in a lifetime achievement in cinematography, acting, soundtrack and sound editing.

I'm going to have to watch it again. There was so much going on in this film, it was hard to keep track of everything, but that's alright with me. It certainly was not boring. I was mildly irritated by the psychological scenes that depicted imaginary chair sex, and an imaginary charred body, because technically Nolan broke character, which is against the rules in good acting. I forgive you this time, Nolan. You're forgiven because I understand what you were trying to tell your audience. Many thousands of people suffered terribly and died from this nuclear bombing. The weight of the guilt must have been a crushing burden for all people involved. This must have caused some psychiatric problems for all involved. We really feel that in our bodies throughout the film. I learned so much valuable information from this film, it was worth the effort to sit for three hours in a theater seat. I really liked the film because it gave us a view into the past. We got to see the ordinary daily life of people who had a very powerful influence over the second world war. They had ordinary daily struggles just like us: alcoholism, lust, cowardice, a desire for power and prestige, and fear of failure. Oppenheimer was so thin, I wonder if he knew what a powerful effect he had on other people. We see early in the film him struggling to make his way in life, wondering if he is going to succeed, advocating for unions and fighting with his peers over it. We really feel the sense of urgency as they all struggled to make the bomb before the enemies of America got it done first. As with all new ideas and new technology, there's always a lot of struggling just to understand what is going on, and what is going to happen. Nolan makes this very obvious. As we watch, we can feel in our bodies the same tension that Oppenheimer felt as they all worked on this project. I liked three hours of film because it gave me more time to think about the whole era. We have the right to defend ourselves. It's a great struggle to balance this idea verses the idea that the end never justifies the means. Forcing Japan to surrender caused more problems than it solved. We know this from medical records from the war. The dead bodies spread disease to everyone. We already know that Albert Einstein never imagined his work in math and nuclear theory would lead to a bomb. He warned the United Nations not to build bombs with his ideas on nuclear theory. I can't help thinking to myself that these nuclear scientists were all working way too hard. The proof of this is the way their work in math was used to hurt people. I'm working from some assumptions. I'm assuming these folks did not know for sure that they would succeed at building the bomb. I'm assuming they were all new to nuclear technology. I'm assuming they were innocent, because my country's constitution assumes people are innocent. I like that idea. I think it's worth defending.
Like most Nolan movies, the writing and cinematography are wonderful. It's a powerful story, that deserves to be told by someone who translate it to the big screen.

Review_Title: Nolan has returned with a beautiful story.
Review: Wow, just wow. Christopher Nolan came back to film with one of the greatest examples of storytelling ever. Even though Oppenheimer is a biopic, Nolan still manages to deliver a beautifully crafted story about a complex and morally gray genius. Though I believe this was a little too dense and could have been shortened up or made into two different movies, it still manages to keep your attention throughout your viewing. Nolans style is at its absolute peak and creatively intelligent. Along with beautiful writing, comes an expertly assembled cast. Cillian Murphy absolutely brought everything he had to this role and it shows. Robert Downey Jr. Finally gets to show his immense talent and range. Emily Blunt and Florence Pugh give convincing emotional performances and really embody their characters. Every actor is absolutely spectacular, and it enhances the movie so much. Cinematography has always been a key part of Nolans films, but this movie's visuals are utterly stunning. The camera work and practical effects leave you with a sense of dread and fear of what Oppenheimer created, but that's also thanks to the intense audio mixing. All in all, Nolan has made the film of the year. He has shown that a movie doesn't tell just a situation, but an actual story. Oscar worthy is an understatement.

Review_Title: Amazing Cinema, But More Than That
Review: Nolan has done it again as he tells a tight and amazing story matched with great visuals, cinematography, and score while leaving you deeply connecting with the theme of the film. I left the theatre today not to claps or conversation but it was silent, and the reason I was silent is because diving into that story and the mind of Oppenheimer it really shows how complex of a time it was and leaves you in a grey area, up to your interpretation. I've always view nuclear bombs as the destroyer of worlds as Oppenheimer puts it, yet it has led to the longest relative peace time that we have seen.

Review_Title: Fantastic, compelling and leaves a lasting impression.
Editing and music was the issue
Review: I am a pretty big Chris Nolan fan, but in my opinion he tried to "Memento" this film too much when it didn't need that approach. The editing was confusing and didn't really add a lot of value. The music was also very dramatic and it was not mixed well. Often times the music over saturated the dialogue. Too Chris didn't use Hans Zimmer! The acting and storyline was very good. Every actor did a superb job, but unfortunately their work was overshadowed by the confusing editing on my opinion. I gave this movie a 6, mostly for the acting. It's not a movie a will watch over and over again like Inception or Dark Knight.
Another deep dive into Nolan's cinematic mind which at this point must be regarded as one of the best of all time.

Review_Title: One of the best movies ever made
Review: This movie hits all the spots, whether the cinematic effect or the plot, it's just very engaging and a thrill for everyone to watch. It's a very unique film because this is not the type of movie Christopher Nolan would make, making it even more curious to watch.
Totally underwhelmed with Oppenheimer.
Glorifying life and acts of a person responsible for millions of innocent deaths including babies and children is abomination.

Review_Title: Film of the Year! Until (Dune Part 2 Comes out.)
Review: The movie is mind blowing! The cinematography the Way they filmed the movie. The soundtrack is amazing. One of Christopher Nolan's best films ever! It's up there with the Dark Knight and the rest of his Batman trilogy. It makes us the (Viewers!) feel a certain type of way. It makes us feel like Oppenheimer could be a evil person or he was a hero. Or just person trying to help. The world needs to watch this movie. I definitely think this movie deserves all the praise is hands-down one of the best films ever created. I totally recommend this movie go watch Oppenheimer right now! It is a must watch.

Review_Title: The best film I have ever seen
Review: I am a film enjoyed and I have seen many films and honesty I can say without a doubt in my mind Oppenheimer is the best motion picture I have ever seen from its breath taking cinematography to its incredible story telling its quite literally perfection.

In possibly his greatest work yet, Christopher Nolan makes his audience feel the crushing weight of Prometheus' rock. This film is a marvelous achievement in the genre of biopics. With gorgeous cinematography, beautifully fleshed out characters and impeccable performances from every single actor involved, Oppenheimer is a love letter to the art of filmmaking and storytelling.

Oppenheimer is an absolute triumph in the world of cinema, leaving a lasting impression with its powerful storytelling and exceptional performances. Cillian Murphy's portrayal of J. Robert Oppenheimer is nothing short of mesmerizing. He flawlessly captures the physicist's brilliance, inner conflicts, and transformation throughout the film. Robert Downey Jr., in a supporting role, delivers a compelling performance, showcasing his versatility as an actor.

Review_Title: Beware of Christopher Nolan, he might give you a heat attack!
Review: Just came from the theatre and felt compelled to write a review for the first time in my life.

It's 3 hours long yet it felt like time flew, couldn't take my eyes off and didn't even leave my seat. The cinematography, the acting and dialogues. Top notch! I think it finished before, they should've mentioned his death and how he spent his life after all the controversy and the trial and how he was as a kid. The explosion seen left the theatre mesmerized.

Review_Title: Now, this film is directed by old Nolan. 😲
Review: Well, as you know, nolan's mind can not think linear, there might be 5 to 6 timelines in the movies hither and tither. Nolan's research is exceptional. He clearly portrayed the intensity of Oppenheimer, the man behind the bomb. Yeah, the first 25 minutes were exceptional. The interrogation scene being long is another thing. I do not think interrogation happens that way. Florence pough, what the hell !!!, she does not even deserve 15 minutes !!!? There was not a long , heavy endings as his movies used to be. But, yeah he is Nolan. He did his way, Oppenheimer's is not in the project, literally, only his body is.

Review_Title: Nolan should be proud of creating a masterpiece
Review: And it is not Oppenheimer... it is Interstellar. I feel like he (Nolan) already created his masterpiece. Dont get me wrong - Oppenheimer is a spectalular journey and it will take you places. It is well paced, well written journey... an adventure for the young folk. You get some stunning visuals which are so simple, some personal drama which is boring (sorry) and not enough action which is great for about 2 minutes.

I suppose these reviews are tweaked, otherwise I can't explain these unrealistic reviews. After two hours later the majority of cinema audience started to view their phones. I'm too disappointed to see this kind of movie from a director like Nolan.

I was so hyped to see this movie especially after the first positive reviews on IMDB. My son and I even used the opportunity on our short trip to Hong Kon to watch it as we live in Shanghai and I am bot sure when it will be released in China.

The script is a real triumph, balancing moments of intense emotion with sensational scenes. The characters were brought to life masterfully by the talented actors, who demonstrated an impressive depth in their performances.

This movie was absolutely breathtaking. I don't typically like history movies all that much but the perfect level of action, excitement. This movie had me literally at the edge of my seat. Murphy played this roll so beyond well and I am not surprised, he is the only reason I watched this and man did he deliver. If he doesn't win an award for this movie I'll start a riot. Robert was incredible, I was not expecting for such a twist and such a debate. The only downside was Florence's nude scenes, honestly they were unnecessary, I could have watched this movie perfectly fine without seeing someone's chest or bare ass.

Review_Title: Well i mean its a great movie but...
Review: Its definitely a 9/10 movie but as someone who doesn't have that long of an attention span there are many scenes they could have done without, jus bland scenes that where kind of just fillers and boring.

History, science, philosophy, society, psychology... all wrapped into a wonderful piece of art. A call back to original cinema, sound effects (dialogues included) fill your mind and soul as they should. A shout out to human kind and their flaws, the chess game of life as a society. A reminder (and an important one especially now) that science should never be political yet it always undeniably will be, all defined by the picture perfect duality (color vs black and white) that touches us in our subconscious. Hardly ever seen a movie this perfect in each of its aspects and without the need of hollywoodian blockbuster action (that I'm quite frankly tired of). It's breathtaking and painful as it presents human condition and reality as is it.

I'm not the fan type. I know that many people like the film because it projects their inner fear, while we get to know the man and the one who wanted to disable him. I also know that a knife can kill people and slice bread, it just depends on the user. I also know that the younger generation, who are only living in the current heightened political situation, are full of emotion and passion.

Review_Title: This movie exceeded all my expectations.
Review: I went from someone who had no plans of watching this movie, to having watched it 5 times over the weeks following its release, something I have never done for any movie in the past, not a single. Oppenheimer was exceptionally well made, and every single watch made me discover something new. The casting, the soundtrack, the plethora of talent in this movie is exceptional to say the least, and I believe that audiences will be thinking about this movie for years to come. I cannot wait to watch Oppenheimer again, a part of me wishes it didn't ever leave theatres. Cillian especially embodied his role so well! Another one in the bag for Nolan!

Review_Title: Huge story, but production fails sometimes
Review: Loved the movie, loved the actors efforts. After three hours I could again feel the fear from the Cold War. Impressive. Camera work in general is very professional.

As one of the younger audience members (21 years old) I grew up in the world of fast and action overloaded movies. This isn't that type of movie. Cillian Murphy's brilliant embodiment of Oppenheimer allows us to get to know Oppenheimer as a versatile, rational but still passionate character. During the whole movie his intellect and sharp mind stays undisputed. While Oppenheimer, as said above, stays really rational in nearly all personal conversations, the way he talks about chemical procedures doesn't leave the shadow of a doubt that this man was at the top of his field and you fall in love with the character more and more during the movie. Even though his emotions are often more implicated than shown you get a deep understanding of Oppenheimers moral compass. With Downey Jr. As a Strauss you got the perfect antagonist. Getting to know him as a brillant mind and a strong supporter/ admirer in the early stages of the movie makes him an even better antagonist in the later stages of the movies.

In ways that only Christopher Nolan can do, Oppenheimer is a layered, critical thinking film with A-list surprises, brilliant cinematography, and a hell of a sound mixing team. There's history, there's science, there's humanity- it's all there for the viewer to interpret as deeply (or superficially) as they like. I love Christopher Nolan because I feel I can trust his work; sure there's some suspension of belief (it is Hollywood after all), but you know you'll walk away from the movie lingering on subtle scenes, powerful dialogue, challenging morals, etc. There's always always something to think about and relish, and Oppenheimer does not disappoint!

Review_Title: Just a 6 for a near perfect film.
Review:
Ok let me start by the obvious ratings which were thoroughly written and explained by the previous reviewers. I will be brief:
Oscar for best Direction : Christopher Nolan
Oscar for best performance by an actor in a leading role: Cilian Murphy
Oscar for best Screenplay : Christophe Nolan
Oscars for best supporting actor : Matt Damon and/or Rober Doweny Jr
Oscar for best editing : Jenifer Lame
Oscar for best music : Ludwig Goransson
Oscar for the most unnecessary casting to an unworthy Oscar holder: Rami Malek
Etc etc etc...
So why the 6 then: Because the film is unnecessary. Its about something that already happened, and we are all aware of (take for example the atomic bomb first testing scene in Los Alamos). It's a biography of a person that we cannot relate to because his character (as depicted in the film) is two-dimensional. The film's subject matter is boring. Its very well written but its unnecessarily too long. And finally because it didn't manage to provide) any sort of feelings (well ok apart from some arousal in the unnecessary sex scenes). I believe that Nolan's next film should be about Psychedelia and it's influence to humanity in a Philosophical, Sociological and Spiritual level (as Kubrick did in 2001: A Space Odyssey). I'm sure that with a film like that, he will be able to use show his full spectrum as a Director and as an artist.

Review_Title: Most excruciating three hours on cinema
Review: Excruciatingly long, slow and *gasp* dare I say it, boring. It's boring. The only good thing was the stacked cast of actors, it get to a point while I almost doze off, Casey affleck's voice woke me up and then yeah there he is, a surprise appearance by casey affleck yayyy. That's how bored I am.
Im an avrage movie watcher and i rate every movie a good one, but this actually changed my point of view about good movies.

Wow, what a film. Next year's Best actor and best supporting actor Oscars simply must go to Cillian Murphy and RDJ. My only slight criticism is that the amazing score sometimes drowned out the dialogue. You need to concentrate though, as there are a large number of characters to keep track of. I was surprised at how much emphasis there was on the post war witch hunts and hearings, where Oppenheimer was basically being denigrated every which way but loose, and I shouldn't have been as I've read American Prometheus, and the film is extremely true to the book, and that was quite a heavy read. Loved every minute of this remarkable film.

Words can't explain how beautifully crafted this film is. Christopher Nolan just continues to produce mastermind film making. Perfect music score. There was not one moment within the film that I was not truly intrigued. The non linear timeline of the story further builds suspense, which is much needed in a 3 hour film. The acting was absolutely phenomenal and reveals the tension in each scene. The attention to detail with the historical details and physics terminology is further impressive such as the sound from the trinity test occurring a bit after the bomb was detonated. Truly astonished by Nolan's cinematic choices with each film he creates.

I went to the cinema without hope, i saw the trailer 1 week before and i felt a weird feeling because i was waiting another movie. Decided to see the movie because is directed by Cristopher Nolan and i love his movies never dissapointed me (Except Dunkerke).

Review_Title: How Can You Spoil a True Story lol
Review: The reality is that the story captured was not to show people getting blown up or some sort of reenactment of the devastation to Hiroshima and Nagasaki. If that's what you were searching for, first seek professional help. Second, this movie is not for you.

Saw opening night in 70mm, and now just again with closed captions. I am finishing for a third and final (Trinity) showing again in the 70mm in two weeks. This movie is breathtaking, mind boggling and outright spectacular. Instant favorite up there with interstellar. Nolan is unbeatable..... The cinematography as well as the score was second to none , the supporting cast is like none i've ever seen. You could hire thousand directors and none would be able to replicate what Nolan did here. Common themes of time and relevance scattered , has you on your toes the entire time. If you do not watch this movie, you are simply missing out on one of the best films of all time.

Beyond mediocre... I would have give it a 2* or 1, but I stopped at 4, for the history that it recreated, which was interesting to watch. Otherwise, as Shakespeare said: too much.... Some visual "effects" - I had a feeling that I watch Winamp or Windows Music creating random form, the music was many times so parallel with the film, going on its own track - I had a feeling that the composer watch only one or two sequences and then exaggerated... I bet it's hard to try to grow in Zimmer's shadows...
Too boring - the movie was too boring. It tried to excuse Oppenheimer of his contribution for eternity at destroying lives, but pointing that it's the politician who is the real killer... I left with the feeling if Barbie wasn't a better choice. I like Nolan's movies - I watched them all, some a few times. I don't believe this is the movie of the year!

It would seem that a movie like this is build on a great research. In the first part of the movie Oppenheimer is in the Netherlands at the University of Leiden where he gives a lecture in Dutch. He learned it in 6 weeks. However the language that he really speaks is German. And I should know because I am Dutch. Somehowe in most American movies they think we speak German in the Netherlands. The movie itself is interresting but sometimes a bit chaotic with the timelines. If I ever will see this movie a second time? I think I will pass. 7 out of 10 rating is the most I van give. Which is To my standards a food score.

Was concerned for the length of the film but was so gripped the whole time it flew past. A better understanding of history with brilliant acting all the way through. The best film I've seen in a long time. Cillian Murphy needs to win awards for this and I will be shocked if he doesn't. A story that was explained told so it's understandable and very interesting. Finally something brilliant to be shown at the cinemas. The trailers and promotion for this film do not do it justice and I cannot believe the amount of famous faces that kept popping up. 10/10 recommend this to anyone considering going to view it.

Oliver Stone is calling this a "Classic"? He's right. When I fell for the rope-a-dope of this oversold, overbaked ham, I became $22 poorer and endured 3 hours of wiki-level storytelling, silly "drama-inducing" time jumps, a ridiculously unrealistic Gen. Leslie Groves, made up stories (the poisoned apple, the Einstein conversation), and a pain inducing, punctuated-moment volume level employed as a snore prevention mechanism. My theater's audience was like a zombie convention. No one moved. No one laughed. When I walked outside to the freedom of the early evening sun I did laugh as I exclaimed "They got me! Classic." To be fair though, the popcorn was top notch. It's sad that Hollywood is so desperate to duplicate the "only in theaters" modus to success demonstrated by last year's Top Gun Maverick that they'll use every trick in the book to get us in there. When they have to sell it as the heaviest roll of film ever made "it's a 600lb IMAX reel!!!", you know the movie has some real problems. Halfway through, I begrudgingly admitted to my wife that we should have seen "Barbie", and rented this. I wish we had. Now I'm shock-deaf in my left ear, have a popcorn tummy ache, an empty wallet, and I didn't even earn any brownie points. Seriously, if I had been kidnapped by aliens and "lost" 3 hours, I would still have more to talk about.

Review_Title: Sharpen Your Brain and Learn the Art ot being Patient to understand The Actual Art.
Review: Oppenheimer is not like any other Movies of Nolan.. It doesn't have a mind boggling script or outrageous Scientific Theories (well subjective) that is because it's a Biopic. It is not going to show what already hasn't happened . For me the best thing a biopic or historical piece could do is to potray it good enough so that most of the people watching it gets the idea of it. With Oppenheimer it was outstanding even the thin linners which most us (who watched) ignored were also very powerful and has their own impact in a way. The detailing were flawless (On point).

Prolly one of the best movie of all time. This movie is very interesting and very thrilling. Since this movie had no action and was mostly just a documentary and was 3 hours long, But, the 3 hours went by very fast and had me at the edge of my seat the whole time. This movie is like no other movie I had ever seen it is very unique and mind blowing. The cinematography is beautiful and the aesthetic of the movie is also beautiful. Anyone who is interested in the history of war and bombs would love this movie but I think anyone would enjoy this movie. Oppenheimer is one of the best movies I have seen this decade.

Review_Title: Mindblowingly amazing. Best movie I have ever seen. Period.
Review: Everything in this film was amazing. I watched this film in 70mm IMAX and loved every single second of it. My opinion may be biased because I love Christopher Nolan's work as well as the work of many of the actors in this film. It is very historically accurate, people complain about sound in Nolan films but I don't have a single complaint about the sound for this one. The way this film is structured may confuse many people, there are a lot of cuts in the beginning and end but it is not made too difficult to understand. I watched this with a friend that had nearly no knowledge of Oppenheimer other than his greatest achievement of course and he understood basically everything in this film. The entire cast did a brilliant job, especially Cillian Murphy. It's also great to see Robert Downey Jr. Actually push himself and reaffirm his talent. I cannot recommend this film enough to anyone. Everything is done perfectly.

Review_Title: Compelling Narrative Paired with Stunning Visual & Audio Mastery
Review: The story, centered on the eponymous protagonist, Oppenheimer, showcases the complexities of human nature brilliantly. The nuances of Oppenheimer's changing attitude before and after the creation of the bomb are worth savoring. They might not conform to typical dramatic patterns, but are truer to reality in my opinion.

Nolan leaves no doubt that he can take on truly the most daunting depiction of a man of history and he delivered brilliantly. Not only on par with this other films, but this could go down as one of the great. Ludwig Goransson's score is a 10/10 and the pacing of the film was fantastic. I especially enjoyed the first Act where Oppenheimer was studying. Nolan did an incredible job of giving the audience insight into it psyche and nature.

Review_Title: Immersive, haunting, grounded, and beautifully shot
Review: Christopher Nolan's latest addition to his already impressive repertoire, is a tale about a famous figure that is haunted by what the future might hold after having made crucial decisions that changed the world forever, and the movie isn't about events that took place at certain times, but it is about the man that was responsible for them; Julius Robert Oppenheimer, the father of the atomic bomb.

Review_Title: A Stark Reminder on Nuclear Energy
Review: First off, a masterclass performance by Cillian Murphy. He emphatically captured the personality behind the first atomic bomb and "The Father of The Atomic Bomb". The film delivered on all fronts from Christopher Nolan and gave a great historical overview on Oppenheimer and how he came about the Manhattan Project. The film could have focused more on the war and less about the communist associations of his earlier life. But the film still was incredibly well written, directed and choreographed.

Review_Title: A case study of when something is so hyped up that it is impossible to disappoint
Review: Frankly I was incredibly disappointed. Nolan at his best captures his audience with incredible cinematography, sound and, most importantly, narrative. Oppenheimer has incredible cinematography and sound, but lacks sorely in narrative. The actors did what they could, which I might say was a fantastic job, but Nolan simply couldn't keep focus on a few but compelling narratives, but instead shot off in all kinds of directions with multiple plots. It caused an incredibly exhausting and, dare I say, boring experience. Let's make something clear; a movie has to first and foremost be entertaining and then it can layer the entertainment with visuals and sounds. Oppenheimer did it the other way around, except the entertaining part never actually arrived.

The film is extremly good. Although the movie is 3 hours long you won't get bored. The story is told in a great way and the actors are perfectly choosen. Of course the performance of the actors were also incredibile. The countryside was also well choosen. The camera movement and the switches between black and white and colour makes the movie way more exciting and realistic. Also the clean and thoughtful cuts let the film be very philosophic. Honestly at the end you are mindblown and it all makes sense. Because the film is so philosophic you have to think about it after the film ended. All in all a great movie.

Review_Title: Even though its a 3 hour movie , it worth it !
Review: Its a very cool moovie , with incredible moments and effects,it was a nice experience seeing it in the cinema. At first i thought it would be a boring movie , because of the lenght of it but i was wrong , the first minutes caught me right on , i was very interested and even though i dont like movies without action i was very fascinated . We can clearly see that where was so much effort and work in this movie .I know Cillian Murphy because of his mark in Peaky Blinders as Thomas Shelby and in this movie he really suits this character and im down to see even more of this. I really recommand the movie to everybody.

From the very beginning to the absolute last moment of this masterpiece, you will be completely captivated in all facets of the word. Oppenheimer shows that Christopher Nolan is a mastermind of cinematography and he fails to disappoint yet again.

Recently watched Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer in 70 MM IMAX and was absolutely stunned by the visuals I love every part of this movie. I thought that the whole movie really in bodied Oppenheimer I like the use of no visual effects in this movie it really gives the movie the authentic film experience I think everyone should watch this film. I walked into this movie with no knowledge of Oppenheimer even though I have heard of him I think Oppenheimer didn't get the respect he deserved until this this film. This movie might be in my top 3 I haven't seen such a good movie since interstellar (also one of Nolan's films) I think the three hours flies bye and is enough time to see the life of Robert J. Oppenheimer.

The most important part of this film, in my opinion, is the parallel between Oppenheimer and the myth of Prometheus and his sins, the missing part of this mythical story is the liberation of Prometheus by a titan who, seeing his innocence in his attempt to deliver fire and revelation to mankind, unlocks his chains.
Amazing movie, I never expected it to go to the political aide of things back then. The movie was as accurate as possible. Crew put a lot of effort in putting this movie together.

I won't waste.. It's an epic movie.. From all Chris movies.. 3 hours went so deep inside.. I would love to see and watch it again. Time with nolen is definitely there in this epic movie.. Its for history.. Flash back.. Black and color moments bringing an extra advantage to the movie.. I prefer watching it in imax.. Soundtrack was amazing and wonderful.. Go watch it now and believe me its worth it movie like oppenheimer.. With all my respect for those who gave 7 or 8 out of 10.. I will give it 9 at least.. In Gulf dubai Kuwait and doha and oman ksa is sold out very fast.. Even mission impossible was not like that.

Oppenheimer was a huge disappointment for me. There was music throughout the film with absolutely no breathing space at all in between. Utterly disappointed as I went to the cinema with high expectations. The music overshadowed everything in my opinion....even the actors performances...as it was trying to force emotions in every scene through its dramatic undertone. What a shame. I struggled to focus on what was being said as the music was so loud in places and it was all I could hear. I just wished it to stop. Apart from that the film is well shot and has some great performances....even by Matt Damon.

Review_Title: swagsation (cillian murphy is the finest man alive but i'm sensitive)
Review: Honestly amazing cast. If cillian murphy doesn't get best actor i'm gonna riot. Also the visual effects are so good (especially during the opening sequence and the cambridge dreams). Also einstein is such a cutie patootie i love him so much i want to shrink him and put him in my pocket tbh he was so adorable. Also they brushed over the fact that oppy tried to kill his teacher a bit too much for my liking but ig its not my movie... anyway i just want to thank the hairstylists for giving cillian murphy curly hair as a gangly 20 year old i really appreciate it beyond words tysm chrissy. Anyway jean deserved better tbh she was such a girlboss slay queen and they turned her into a sex object which i did not appreciate #justice4jean anyway the casting was sooo so good like it felt like that bit in animal farm where the animals look from the pigs to the men and back again and they can't tell the difference yeah it was like that. Anyway speaking of casting can nolan pls stop casting cillian murphy in really traumatised roles. Leave that poor man alone his thousand yard stare is getting a bit too realistic for my liking tbh #savecillian2023 OMG have u guys seen that video at the premiere where matt damon accidentally bumped into cillian murphy and cilly turned and gave the camera the most pained expression i have ever seen its so funny. ALSO. The costuming in the movie was sooo good i recently found out that oppy's (cool way of saying oppenheimer) costumes were inspired by david bowie which explains why he looked so absolutely snatched in that one scene in los alamos anyway i read a really sad article where emily blunt said that poor little cillian murphy only ate one almond a day (heartbroken emoji) #yolandahadidcore anyway that one scene on the train where his shoulders looked really small and his head looked really big. Yeah. Anyway. Im sure everyone is waiting for me to talk about the sex scenes. Well i am. "now i am become death destroyer of worlds" why did she make him read that while she was. U know. Also the hearing scene was so awkward because they were talking about jean and then the camera panned around that one guy and i KNEW oppy was gonna be naked when the camera panned back around and he was and also cillian murphy has so many freckles ANYWAY not the point but it was so awkward because florence pugh was just staring at emily blunt with the most (REDACTED)-out expression it was so awkward. Anyway. Speaking of emily blunt she absolutely DEVOURED that roger guy. "16, 17, no, 18 years" GIRLLL ATE HIM UP AND LEFT NO CRUMBS. Also the way they were talking about communism like it was worse than/equivalent to facism like stalinism is different to communism girlypop! #readyourtheory #dialecticalmaterialism #uncleanoosh ANYWAY i cant remember the ending of the movie very well because i had spent the last third of the movie absolutely sobbing my eyes out because i was so upset. That brings me to why i deducted two stars is because if you're a bit sensitive like me the movie is actually a bit of a hard watch tbh also it's not the kind of movie i'd watch again... sorry nolan... it's an absolute masterpiece but it really is so emotionally draining. Also don't watch it in a super crowded cinema because i had such a bad headache for days afterwards because i was trying to had not to cry loudly. 0/10 do not recommend anyway. I probably already mentioned this but cillian murphy is such a good actor like his screen presence is so magnetic you just can't help but look at him ALSO the fact that he is sooo so good looking im sorry i know that that's not the point of the movie but gahhdamn that man is fine. Anyway rami malek was a bit of a jumpscare and i thought it was really funny that david hill defended oppy despite oppy always flipping over his clipboard lmao #justicefordavidhill anyway OH MY GOD I ALMOST FORGOT TO TALK ABOUT STRAUSS. Robert downey jr was so good in this movie and tbh i hear some oscar buzz anyway strauss (pronounced "stross" be careful out there everyone, i got clowned on for pronouncing it like strauss sad face) is such a silly little guy and also really annoying. ALSO im just now realising that i genuinely have no idea what oppy's hearing was about. Like genuinely no idea. I also missed like a good 10 minutes of dialogue post hiroshima because i was so shell shocked. Don't really ask me what happened after hiroshima because i was seeing the screen through blurry eyes as i was. Slightly emotionally affected by it. Which is a slight understatement. ALSO RODERICK WAS IN IT? He was throwing up outside after oppy's speech and i related to that so hard tbh there was one point where i was so upset i felt like i was going to faint. Probably the most disassociating experience is walking out of oppenheimer feeling nothing short of shell-shocked and walking into an ocean of pink. Jesus i felt like i needed a cigarette. Anyway it was an absolutely amazing movie but wayyy too emotionally draining to warrant another watch so i had to deduct two stars sorry :(( if they released a cut that was just up to the (but not including) the trinity test i would watch that again and again but the last third of the movie is just so harrowing. Maybe i should watch it again in the comfort of my own home just for some sort of catharsis because i feel a lot of pent up emotion about it because you know it isn't exactly deemed socially acceptable to sob and wail in a cinema is it. Maybe it is idk. Anyway i was the only girl in my cinema which made the sex scenes a bit uncomfortable because of the overwhelming masculine energy emanating from my screening but i digress. Also make sure to, if you're a girl/feminine aligned person, wear a super brightly coloured outfit to confuse all the men and make them think you're in the wrong movie it's funny asf. Also im not gonna lie the humour was giving marvel movie which i found really cringy but thats ok ig its not my movie. The script was sooo much better than other nolan films but a good bit of the dialogue was swallowed by the music also why were they mumbling half the time like SPEAK UP MY FRIEND. I needed subtitles i swear anyway i was not a big fan of the way they skimmed over the effects that the trinity test had on the local indigenous groups but what else can u expect from a white director. Anyway i hope you guys enjoyed reading this review because it's obviously the best one. Anyway cillian murphy if u r reading this i love u sm and u did an amazing job ok everyone else pls go and see oppenheimer and give flo and em and cilly lots and lots of money ok bye bye love u xx.

Review_Title: Great Nolan movie, not for everyone!
Review: It's a great Christopher Nolan movie and definitely one of if not my favorite movie. However it's not a movie made for everyone. You need to have a good attention span and you have to be interested in it. Even I have to still comprehend it and overthink about it. I saw alot of people who say it is a boring movie and I think the reason is they didn't understand many parts. I think another reason is many people never watched a biography movie and only expect movies where there is a happy ending. Overall if you think you can watch a 3 hour masterpiece that is literally a biography, then watch it.

Of course this movie is a top 10. Potentially even a top 5. However, I'm likely not to come back to it too many times, as it still boils down to the fact its a 3 hr movie, with at least 30-45 minutes of post trinity, and at most 30 minutes of actual trinity.
Dramatic construction in this movie was so good, I enjoyed it.

Review_Title: Too long, but interesting. (Was there really some Dutch?!)
Review: I liked the movie, the cast and characters and it was interesting. I don't know enough about the historic events to say if it's a correct reflection. Oppenheimer coping with guilt was wonderfully brought across. Contrast in loud sound and silence was impressive. Worth it to see it on cinema.

Review_Title: I sat still during this amazing film
Review: Oppenheimer is one of if not the greatest films I've ever seen, every scene and every moment of this film had me captivated, I couldn't take my eyes off of it, I have never been so concentrated on a movie that I didn't fidget with my hands or check my phone, this movie kept me awake the entire 3 hours length, and that's saying something as I have ADHD and can't focus on movies sometimes. During Oppenheimer I laughed I cried and most of all I felt could feel, genuinely a perfect in my opinion. If you have the time to watch it I 100% recommend watching it, it's probably the best film out right now.

Review_Title: Can't Imagine Anything Else Winning Best Picture!
Review: I had the advantage of reading "American Prometheus"'several years ago, otherwise some of the history and internal squabbles over "Atomic versus Hydrogen" bomb would have been lost on me. You don't have to read the book first but it will help. But I'm either case, GO SEE THIS MOVIE. We are all living in Oppenheimer's world, for better or worse. He deserves all the accolades he's ever received, and he was a very flawed human being. But give me someone who wrestled with his demons any day over the person who never reflected on their earlier actions with despair and guilt. Oppenheimer the man is for the ages, as is this movie.

Review_Title: Long, boring and full of itself
Review: Oppenheimer is a story of a flawed protagonist that undergos no redemption arch. He is portrayed as 'above' regular human morality and at no stage shows any remorse for his many horrid acts that span decades of his life.

Review_Title: It's not a movie it's a experience
Review: Words can't describe this movie I've never seen a movie so good.
"Oppenheimer" is not your typical blockbuster!

This has to be greatest movie of this decade. Stunning background music, acting and cinemetography makes this movie hook this audience even for three hours. Also the movie just don't only revolve around the making of atomic bomb but also contains the court drama after math where Robert J. Oppenheimer will be accused of being connected with communist party. This movie also showcase the political view and some glimpse of Oppenheimer's college life. But the most importantly this movie display the regret of Oppenheimer aftermath. Cillian Murphy had nailed in his character with his emotions and also the support cast has done their job brilliantly.

A great biopic with a stacked movie cast! What more can you ask. A lot of clues and relevant links to many things throughout the movie so keep your eyes peeled. Cinematography and some of the mise en scenes were so nice to see. The use of non-diegetic sounds also made this movie, (the chair was literally rocking due to the sound effects, you could feel the sound if that makes sense). What kept this movie from being perfect was the fact that the actual explosion episodes were just a tad underwhelming but that's understandable because the movie isn't just about big explosions. The film actually gives us the insight to what Mr Oppenheimer is holding himself responsible for being the father of the atomic bomb. He's created something that can put an end to the world at once and he has to live with that sense of guilt, it will forever stay. His name will be renowned even after he passes.

This movie, no matter how one looks at it, from the first second of it is magnificent. One possibly cannot take the movie in its complete sense after one watch. It craves multiple watches. The movie jumps right into it, and does not let you off for even a second until the very last moment. It's dialogue is maturely written by Mr. Nolan and shows huge respect to its audience. And the visual aspect of it with all of its glory there to see on the 70mm screen, is a treat that leaves to be craved even after a 3hr runtime. The movie with its pace shows the reality of how the US chased after the making of atomic bomb. The audio of this movie, not just dialogue but soundtrack, movie sounds, everything was masterfully managed by. Ludwig Gorannson, it perfectly supplements the visual storytelling while adding weight to each scene in its own right. And the acting is perfect. Mr. Murphy is exceptional, larger than life in this movie. RDJ is exceptional. Matt Damon is exceptional. Emily Blunt is exceptional. This movie has all the Oscar-nominating performances. The story is grounded to reality of the history, but is at the same time so tense in its execution, it really makes everyone sit on the edge of your seat for the good of latter part of the movie. The direction of the maestro Mr. Nolan is at his top here. Oppenheimer is the Magnum Opus of Nolan. From the first scene, the whole movie is through the eyes of Oppenheimer. The reality and its weight behind being the Father of the Atomic Bomb. This movie is about Oppenheimer, more than that part of the history of making the first Atomic Bomb.

Probably the only director of our times whose name is enough to pull the crowd to theaters. His best quality is that he thinks that the audience is smart enough to understand and doesn't spoon feed everything.

This movie had me on the edge of my seat the whole time, easily the easiest 3 hours of film watching ever. The great juxtaposition of the brilliance and downfall of man and the destruction science/men can bring. The music was amazing, the acting exceptional and the end very thought provoking.
The good: excellent performances by Murphy, Damon and especially Downey. A couple of powerful scenes, especially of the first test of the atom bomb - literally mind blowing .

Review: Oppenheimer

Everything about this movie is amazing and totally worth the three hours every minute was captivating I enjoyed watching it
Probably one of Christopher Nolan's best movies

First I saw barbie but barbie was delayed so me and my friend misst the start and we both regrets that because this movie was so good and I would probably watch it even if it was 5 hours long and I would like to have it in a longer version because I didn't want it to end because it is such en amazing movie and I think everyone should watch it I would 100% watch it over barbie and I would recommend this movie to anyone and there is so good jump scares whit the bomb that even tho I knew I jumped I would watch this over the moste movies and I would probably say it the best movie of this I have watch.

Review_Title: This is movie is a masterpiece
Review: The movie is 10/10. The actors did a great job,especially Cillian Murphy as Robert J Oppenheimer.

Review_Title: Great film one step below interstellar
Review: I loved the acting, the shots, and the sound. The beginning of the movie is incredible with foreshadowing and explaining the history. The build up to the test detonation is like no other. Violins, intensity and just amazing shots once the bomb drops. The movie has a great mix of both the personal and work life of Oppenheimer. Where it takes a dive is after the test bomb. I feel like Nolan could've captured more of Hiroshima and Nagasaki and the effect it had on the people in Japan. He shows nothing and sort of skips over it. Ending was slightly dragged out but the last scene is breathtaking. Overall one of Nolan's best but a tier below interstellar/ dark night.

Good movie but can be watched at home. Nothing special honestly, you would think with how much they advertised and the nonstop marketing campaign, that this movie would be a bang! Not literally! Mission Impossible was way better. What kind atomic bomb movie doesn't have a BIGGG boom somewhere in between! Only Oppenheimers character made sense. The rest were pretty much mediocre including our beloved Iron Man! They downgraded women so badly in this movie haha I can't wait for the feminists to draw up a big propaganda. But anyways this is how women were treated back in those days. Save up and watch at home. No need to waste your money at the movies!

When me and my friends decided to go watch oppenhimer, I was a little sceptical to if I wanted to watch it, but after we saw the movie i was dupprised to how good it was. And now i have a new favorite movie.
