Review_Title: I never wanted to leave a running movie before
Review: It was hard to follow and got all the dots together. Movie is mostly dialogues with hard to find the context plus different timelines switched all the time while trying to follow what's going on.

Nolan has a reputation for creating thought-provoking and visually stunning films, and "Oppenheimer" promises to be no exception. With a talented cast, a compelling story, and Nolan's signature cinematic style, this film is sure to be a cinematic event that will be talked about for years to come.

Review_Title: Exceptional film by Nolan. Had me close to tears throughout
Review: Just finished an Imax 70mm showing. What an incredible film. The first 20 minutes with. Göransson's soundtrack along with the effects depicting Oppenheimer visualizing particles and waves almost brought me to tears. From then on its a fast paced ride taking you through Oppenheimers early study of quantum physics and his involvement in the Manhattan Project. All the while you are placed in an anxious state as you watch his life be scrutinized due to the highly classified nature of the project shifting through time periods. The editing is masterfully done to stitch the ideas and dialogue together. It culminates with a chilling end and a leaves you wondering if the chain reaction he created can ever be stopped. Will be seeing it as many times as I can in theaters.
Christopher nolan is one of my role models in filmmaking.

Review_Title: REWATCHED IT JUST AFTER WATCHING IT
Review: Have come here to write what i had just witnessed, this is not just a movie, its like a profound experience where one gets lost and becomes one with whats happening in the movie. This movie is beyond exceptional, i havent written any reviews before, but this time i had to put my feelings to words. The storyline, acting, cinematography, dialogues, everything was perfect. It literally put me inside Oppenheimer's head, his thoughts, his feelings, He became me. All the characters even is they had no dialogue, just smiles or gazes, leaves a lasting impression on you. I really cant find words to describe this movie, just wanna relive it again. WOW. It seemed like there was no acting in the movie, it was real, like i was seeing the real Oppenheimer with real Einstein, all the scientists felt like they were really themselves, all the other characters, Oppenheimer's wife(Emily Blunt), colleagues, Lewis Strauss(RDJ), everyone was exceptional. Still cant get over it.

Review_Title: Great biography about the father of the atomic bomb
Review: Going into this movie I already know it is going to be different and slow pace than Nolan's other movies. Which isn't bad. The score, cinematography, script and atmosphere is top notch. It make you feel like you really are back in time. Cillian Murphy and Robert Downey Jr acting are some of the best I have seen. Cillian really catch Oppenheimer perfectly. His struggle with creating the atomic bomb and the questioning of his loyalty to the US at the end will keep you on the edge. The atomic bomb test scene is one of the best I have seen in cinema. The score bringing up the tension and nervousness of the people there. To the sound and vision of the atomic bomb exploding. With no cgi. This is a once in a life time movie experience. I would recommend watching it.

Review_Title: So intensely captivating that it leaves a lasting impression
Review: Overall: Unlike Nolan's usually fictitious style, this movie contains profound depth and character. It is extremely impactful as it not only covers one of the most important moments in history, but it also is perhaps one of the best films to have ever been created.

Review_Title: A masterpiece, the magnum opus of Nolan's career
Review: There is absolutely no doubt that Oppenheimer will go down as one of the greatest biopics in history. It's to slow, it's boring, it's to long. NO WAY. It's an absolute masterpiece that encompasses the life span of one of the most influential people in history. This movie is brilliantly paced and divided to provide an introspective look into his early life and later troubles in an easy to digest way. The absolute best thing about the movie is the sound design. Usually Nolan's movies are to loud but with Oppenheimer it's welcome. You feel the explosions hit you in the chest and it's AMAZING. GO SEE IT FOR YOURSELF IN THEATRES AND SEE.
I love all Nolan movies , but Jesus this was boring #boring

After watching this, I regretted not continuing science studies. The inner conflict any scientist may face is explained well. The loyalty towards one's country, the amount of time and effort to create a reputation, the amount of time that it takes to destroy, years of worth scientific research and seeing the after effect it will bring, how it affect one's mentality, how hard one can have hatred feeling to another, all these depicted well. The salvation Oppenheimer was looking for may be the same for many. Really great cinematography, amazing background music, good character selection, really great location. It showed a whole new world of Physics. Would love to recommend it to anyone who is interested in Physics and WWII.

The Oppenheimer movie is an emotional rollercoaster, it awakes your senses being a visual and audio masterpiece, it's truly a statement of cinematic art and an art piece that raises the bar for future productions for it's perfection in the smallest details from makeup to sound to image to script ECT...
The cast was pure genius Florence Pugh was more than perfect in role execution , she is a torch carrier for the next generation of actors the energy and mixture of actors was in it self art like colors in a painting coming together to express or reflect a complex texture of emotions .
To truly understand and enjoy the film you need to read the book first. There are any number of subtle nods to the book and Oppenheimer's life that are missed unless you know.

Review_Title: This Movie Deserves The Biggest Sound And The Biggest Screen
Review: This is undoubtedly one of the best films I have ever seen, and it deserves to be experienced in the highest quality possible, ideally on the big screen.

Review_Title: One of the greatest piece of cinema
Review: Overall it's Nolan. Intence,deep long conversations,and great cinematography, your brain have to be 100% active all the time, You know what I'm talking about if you've seen his previous works/films. Well it was not as confusing as tenet. Cillian Murphy carried the whole film, also the sound effects are incredible. This movie lives on your expectations, everything was worth it. The cast is perfect and specially cillian Murphy rocks man totally gives the feel, this was just an another masterpiece dropped by Christopher Nolan, I suggest that watch it on biggest screen possible, blindy go for IMAX, dont dare to miss a single second of the movie.overall the movie was pure cinema.

This is one you should see at the theater if you can. Of all the biopics I've watched, this is one of the best in that it manages to tell someone's story well without sacrificing any of its theatrical appeal. The movie is three hours long, but I was never bored. Christopher Nolan does a great job engaging the audience throughout by building suspense and telling the story in a nonlinear fashion, jumping back and forth on the timeline of Oppenheimer's career but linking every piece together masterfully. The movie also does a great job of painting Oppenheimer in a morally ambiguous light, giving credit to him where it was due but not overly heroizing him. Cillian Murphy was the perfect casting choice for him as well.

Review_Title: My Thoughts on Oppenheimer Directed by Christopher Nolan
Review: Oppenheimer is a very good movie, starring Cillian Murphy as Robert J. Oppenheimer, the father of the atomic bomb. The film is rated R for nudity and sexual themes, so many women are walking out of the theater for what they perceive to be patriarchal oppression. Though that part didn't personally bother me, Christopher Nolan could've deleted those scenes to get a PG-13 rating so the film could've grossed more money. Anyway, Oppenheimer's runtime is 3 hours 15 minutes.
The most important and potent line is used so early and during an unnecessary scene. Nolan has surly lost the plot.

Christopher Nolan wows again with this stunning work of film, most definitely one of the best historical biopics of all time. Cilian Murphy is absolutely amazing along with the rest of this talented cast. It is a bit of a slow burn buty the result is worth it! You will not be okay after watching this. I would say its okay for the ages of 16 and up. There is a faor bit of nudity between Cilian Murphy's character and Florance Pugh's character, but its nothing too over the top. While it is a bit early these are my oscar predictions:
Best Actor: Cilian Murphy
Best Picture: Oppenheimer
Best Production Design: Oppenheimer.

Before watching this Scientific Drama, people should have enough idea about this project and take a close look at Oppenheimer's Biopic. I watched it at Prasad's Multiplex 70mm screen. As per my view, the first 30min of this film isn't necessary to watch, I mean it doesn't make any difference. At start the movie was slow but at beginning of project things started to be interesting. All the Characters in this movie were looking real, as if the audience are experiencing real incident. Sreen writing, Direction and Background were absolutely amazing. I warmly Thank Mr. Nolan and his Team for making such Film.

As good as expected. Maybe some people think that it took too long, but i get it, the point is not about the nuclear bomb that finally he created. But, it's about the character, pressure, situation, internal conflict, and lot of messages he sent in the 2nd of this movie, that most people not predict it.

I've been a HUGE fan of Christopher Nolan's films for years and "The Dark Knight" up till now I believed to be his best film, but this was his ultimate masterpiece. Beautifully shot as his films usually are , the score always a Nolan staple piece in his films brings everything to together to leave you enthralled.

Review_Title: A great film filled with complexity and history
Review: A very fast paced film that jumped forwards and backwards a lot. Additionally, it had some weird decisions regarding music and camera movement that (I'm not an expert on the art of film making but I enjoy it and study it). Can be hard to follow if you don't have enough knowledge regarding American and War history. A small amount of scenes could've in my opinion, done without the loud music as it made it difficult to understand dialogue and feel connected in the story. However, the film had amazing performances by the cast, brilliant use of sound and lighting to influence the audience's emotions as well as incredible visuals that invite you into the story. Creating a historical film can be challenging as the actions of characters and events are extremely limited to what is and was accurate, but Christopher Nolan delivers a powerful film that covers a significant event in history, which needs to be acknowledged more as it has impacted society a lot more than people think.

Tbh this movie should've brought no 1 and much and much more than barbie movie but time is now rolling with feminist movie well I don't know this Oppenheimer movie is the best there ever was or will be and should be no 1 forever i really loved it and Christopher Nolan is gem of a director.

The film was announced in September 2021 after Universal Pictures won a bidding war for Nolan's screenplay, following Nolan's conflict with longtime distributor Warner Bros. Murphy was the first cast member to sign on the following month, with the rest of the cast joining between November 2021 and April 2022. Pre-production was under way by January 2022, and filming took place from February to May. Oppenheimer was filmed in a combination of IMAX 65 mm and 65 mm large-format film, including, for the first time in history, sections in IMAX black-and-white film photography. Like his previous works, Nolan used extensive practical effects and minimal computer-generated imagery. Oppenheimer is Nolan's first film to receive an R-rating in the United States since Insomnia in 2002.

There's no sugar coating or talking about a different narrative here. We all know what really happened and this movie tries to glorify and make a message out of something that is a disgrace to humanity. I went in and really wanted to give it a fair go but the whole idea of the movie is ridiculous and I just couldn't get past it. Millions of people died for no reason despite surrending. There is no sugar coating it. The cast did a good job. Story was well paced. Directing was well done as expected. You have to focus and pay attention to really get lost in the movie and while it does those things moderately well.. but I still found this movie just a totally disrespectful for the human experience.

Review_Title: Happy to reached my 20's to understand nolan
Review: I was young when I first saw one of Christopher Nolan's films " Inception" I couldn't understand anything but yet I felt the emotions and the rush he delivers.

Read the book first if you can, but regardless this does an amazing job at breaking down a very complex man. Amazing acting. Amazing direction. I think every part was played by a known actor. How they pulled that off is impressive, but it just made the movie come alive. The way the movie began by showing how Oppy was figuring out physics was so cool. It's like you were in his brain.

Review_Title: How can you live with blood-stained hands?
Review: Last Sunday, I immersed myself in the darkness of the cinema to experience "Oppenheimer." While on an immense screen, the detonation of a nuclear bomb unfolded, outside, my country (Argentina) convulsed due to the crossroads of choosing its future leader.

The film is a masterpiece because it tells a story that moves humanity, puts it in the context of the Cold War and has a wonderful actor as a hero who always wanted to be one, but in the end this role and meaning is for himself rejects. Christopher Nolan deserves an Oscar for the dialogue alone. Perhaps Cillian Murphy could open his eyes a little less, but his character drawing still remains overwhelming, impressive and believable. Rarely has the genius, torn by his doubts, been placed in history in such a way that it became clear how a neuter age was created: the atomic age in which we live today. And the different time levels of his students, time, his calling, his success and his process. At the time of communist persecution are assembled through the use of different film materials. The film music is touching.
Done with Oppenheimer movie 😇

Got to be honest here, but the movie is quite... boring. 3 hours of talking might be exhausting for some people but for me how Murphy manage to lead this movie while potrays his best emotion is just brilliant.

Today i watched Oppenheimer in Imax and in all honesty, it's the best movie i have ever seen. Before going today i isolated myself from every Oppenheimer content just because i wanted to be blown away by Nolan and his amazing cast and im so thankful that i managed to dodge spoilers and etc because after leaving the cinema i felt different and moved by the story. I cant exactly explain what this feeling is but i was not the same person that entered the movie theatre. Oppenheimer is a piece of art that you dont only see or observe, you experience it with your entire body and you spend the entire 3 hours on the edge of your seat with your heart pumping harder and harder as the movie progresses. I never felt anything like this before, not even in real life, i remained glued to my seat for the entire movie and i even forgot about eating my popcorn due to this extreme immersion that the director orchestrated. I wish i could erase Oppenheimer from my memory just so i can go and experience it again, in order to feel all of these emotions and feelings thats this masterpiece has to offer. I also gotta talk about the score of this movie and Ludwig Goransson delivers the most perfect soundtrack possible. This score is chilling, epic, beautiful and touching, making it one of the core aspects for immersion and it also builds up anxiety and terror inside the audience, enhancing the greatness of the story itself. The whole sound department did an extraordinary job in this film, it was all just perfect and fitting for the story. Cillian Murphy performs his best role to date as J Robert Oppenheimer and i really dont think anyone would do such an extraordinary job like Cillian did. Cristopher Nolan chose a brilliant cast and they delivered beyond expectations, every single one of them. In my opinion, Nolan and Cillian Murphy deserve the best movie and best actor oscars, respectively, without any contest and even Robert Downey Junior is a contestor for best supporting actor. As i said before, this experience changes you and your worldview is a different one compared to the one you had 3 hours ago and im just so glad that i got the opportunity to watch Nolans, and possibly cinema's best work of all time. Yeah i do recommend the filme its neat.

There's not a single moment without background score, except for the bomb explosion. It always bothers me when a film requires background music for everything, even quiet conversations, that nothing is good enough to survive without musical support. Also bleach bypassing IMAX seems a real waste - why use a lab process that increases grain and reduces contract ratio on the highest resolution film medium available? It all feels pretty one note, style over substance. Dry. Given Nolan's limitless resources it should be much more rounded. I didn't care about anyone, or even really get to know anyone, including Oppenheimer. Overall really disappointing and all the glowing reviews to me feel like everyone has drunk the Kool Aid. The emperor has no clothes. Not sure how much I'm influenced by having read the biography it's based on. Dr George Miller used to say that a film should feel like a great piece of music with highs, lows, quiet, crescendos, pacing. This feels like one very long chorus, and not a great one at that.
Its about the f Bomb and the maker so .. that is that , i thank all the staff and specially cillian murphy for the effort on making the movie ,Peace.

Superb acting by all of the cast. My first thought was "how can I get thru 3 hrs of bomb discovery"? Amazingly easily it seems. Nice to recognize the names attached to atomic theory. The first hour was slow as we were introduced to the characters. The last hour was absolutely edge of your seat. Cillian Murphy is Oscar fodder as is Robert Downey Jr. For those who haven't seen the show, or haven't read the book, it is useful to read some of the background. Knowing the real life individuals who were present in Los Alamos will add to enjoyment of the show. I read up on the story after the movie just to clarify the characters.

Review_Title: Nolan keeps it straight and simple with a succinct message to the entire world
Review: Christopher Nolan has, indeed, tried to walk a different path with this movie - but this is based on a true story after all with a clear message to all in the present circumstance/s the world is venturing in. People always had that greed for fake popularity since time immemorial or you say being a charlatan. And things haven't changed much till date, have they? This is a movie that may not thrill you but will drive you emotionally.

Review_Title: we are probably looking at the Oscar-winning movie
Review: Oppenheimer. A historical feature film that tells us the course of events in one of the most crucial moments of World War II and shows in a raw and controversial way, how far one is capable of going to achieve victory.

It's long, but it speeds along and takes concentration which is so refreshing. Nolan takes audience on a unique and brilliant cinematic journey. Cast is excellent, with cameos from so many great actors was a whose who of acting master class! The story is one that should be better known and after this it Will definitely be well known.
I may consider myself lucky to be alive to watch Christopher Nolan Works which get better by years.

Christopher Nolan did it again. One of the best movies I have ever seen, which I was quite skeptical if I would've liked after all of his masterpieces. But this one was different. My eyes were drawn to the screen every second and mesmerized at every scene. The cinematography did not disappoint, the contrary actually. So glad that Cillian had the opportunity to do the main role, which he did it flawless. Have always loved the way he acted. You could see just through his face what his emotions were. My favorite scene, for sure was the bomb scene. The countdown brought all the audience together and the music was perfect that just accentuated the tension. Loved the way it didn't just exploded that was the obvious thing to happen. It showed the emotion of every character and demonstrated how everything would change after it. And you could say it was literally a bomb because after it everything was explained like an atomic bomb. Can't imagine a better ending. The way it showed the two judgements ( and their similarities) and ended with the einstein conversation. Brilliant! Honestly i wanna watch at least three more times to grasp and fathom every detail. I think even the whole world wouldn't be enough screen to watch because of how beautiful it was. So Christopher Nolan did it again a flawless work witch will be forever in history . He is a genius.

Review_Title: If you liked this movie you are a certified NPC.
Review: Hey bro, let me tell you something. Even if the topic is historical, science related, political... you don't have to force yourself to like it. I know that you feel like forced to enjoy the movie so that you think you're smart. This is so overhyped that the lady next to me started applauding once the movie ended, despite i saw that she was sleeping like she never did in her life. I couldn't find a moment when Cilyan Murphy had a natural expression on his face.. a total mess. I'm writing this because i felt like an npc, that has to find a reason to like this movie... and guess what? I didnt' find it :c.

Review_Title: A mind using movie but amazing
Review: Christopher Nolan's much-anticipated film, "Oppenheimer," is a visually stunning and thought-provoking cinematic experience that delves into the tumultuous life of the brilliant physicist J. Robert Oppenheimer. As expected from a Nolan film, it delivers on its promise of grandeur and spectacle, offering audiences a captivating exploration of history, science, and the human condition.

Review_Title: Offensive Portrayal of the Bhagavad Gita
Review: Nolan's direction in is truly remarkable. In a non-linear chronological order, he weaves together the two timelines, offering viewers Oppenheimer's subjective experience in vivid color and others consequential perspective in black and white. This duality brilliantly portrays Oppenheimer's personal struggles in color(scenes from the first person) and the far-reaching impact of his actions in black and white (scenes from others points of view)....

Review_Title: A Perfect Blending of History & Humanity
Review: Oppenheimer was, without a doubt, one of the best movies I've ever seen. I saw it (along with Barbie) on the Thursday of its release, and it took me a couple of days to really understand the extent to which the film affected me.

Went last weekend to the theaters to watch this movie of Christopher Nolan. And as espected; it did not disappoint. The dialogue, actors, editing, sets... it's all on point. Sure there will be some people who will have something to say about the accuracy of the historical events, but I think Nolan did an amazing job to show the most important things in just three hours. The only thing that bottered me for real; I could not hear a single word of the Dutch phrases Cillian spoke; even though I'm a dutchman. It was more like german. But who cares, it's just a little detail.

Review_Title: This is a master piece don't miss it.
Review: Wow what a movie, the way oppenheimer's story has been told is commendable, OP's becoming an atomic bomb and later his inner state has been portrayed in a very good way and Cillian Murphy's acting is excellent. Christopher Nolan's direction is wonderful, the way he has presented the story, two or three layers run together in the movie and all meet together in the end. Some scenes of the film will shock you, especially the bomb trial scene, in which there is silence on the screen, but the expression of the actor and the audience itself can feel the explosion. Everyone must watch this movie once, such a film would never have been made.

Review_Title: Just a brilliant movie - not for Barbie fans
Review: Absolutely stunning. A great critique of post war America. The fact that this film ever got made is unbelievable. A film critical of the USA political system at that time with a nod of the head to JFK.

Review_Title: A Story not of Physics, but of Human Nature
Review: Oppenheimer is a stunning movie. Visually, it is a masterpiece, and Nolan's commitment to recreating complex visual phenomena without the use of CGI does nothing to hobble his efforts; indeed, it enhances the emotional impact. The choice to cut back and forth between timelines, which some have derided as overwrought, helped develop plot and characterization in a way that kept me on the edge of my seat -- despite already having read American Prometheus and watching what was predominantly three hours of conversation between men in suits. The true genius of this film is to introduce suspense and tension while the audience nevertheless remains constantly aware of the inevitable resolution. Nolan's attention to detail is strict, to the point of testimony in Oppenheimer's hearing being lifted verbatim from transcripts of the real event. Cinematic contrivances are few and far between, and serve only to tie together themes that would otherwise require the sort of exposition that is not amenable to film, even of this length. As a current student of mathematical physics, I only take issue with the minor role that certain physicists -- John von Neumann, Richard Feynman, and others -- played in the script as compared to American Prometheus, and with the limited examination of circumstances shaping Oppenheimer's early life. It pays to know the boy who became the man, and there's much in Oppenheimer's childhood revealed through Bird and Sherwin's mammoth biography that helps to humanize his inner strife, which certainly preceded the bomb but was intensified by it. Ultimately, Nolan's presentation of human conflict against the backdrop of potential annihilation is ambiguous, much like the ethical debate still waged over Hiroshima and Nagasaki, and much like the legacy and life of J. Robert Oppenheimer himself. This is to the film's credit. We, the audience, although seeing the world largely through Oppenheimer's eyes, can catch a glimpse of men like Teller and why they acted how they did. Oppenheimer is well worth its runtime. It is a slow-burn Roman candle that pays due homage to a troubled brilliancy of physics and the collective body of Nolan's ouvre.

Review_Title: Good marketing caused the only IMAX 70mm theater in EU to be sold out for many weeks
Review: Brief summary: it wasn't worth it. Much better experience in IMAX 2D was e.g. Oblivion (including a soundtrack by M83). A much better WWII related story was e.g. The movie Enigma. A much better biopic story with flashbacks was e.g. Professor Marston & the Wonder Women

Can even a history film be told non-linearly? Yes it can. Only a legend Christopher Nolan could do this. There may be other directors can do, it takes a certain courage to tell a story like this. Science and politics are shown in this film and that too with perfect elegance. Must watch in theaters.
Oppenheimer has everything to be the film of the year. One of the few films recorded in Imax, surreal, certainly adds to the experience.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer is the best film i watched this year
Review: Christopher Nolan is back! Oppenheimer is the best film i watched this year. I can say this film is a masterpiece film, I will explain why. The first, of course, I was amazed by the acting of Cillian Murphy who played Robert Oppenheimer, who was very charismatic and authoritative. Secondly I really like the story which is very weighty and supported by strong characterization. There is one character that caught my attention, namely Albert Einstein, played by Tom Conti. The star cast that was presented were able to bring the characters they played very well, such as Robert Downey Junior who played Lewis Strauss, Emily Blunt who played Kitty, and Florence Pugh who played Jean Tatlock. This film has a duration of 181 mins, but because the visuals are so slick that it will make you feel comfortable while watching, in some scenes you can really feel the movement of the camera which makes you feel more and more carried into the film. I enjoyed watching this film, my heart was pounding with a visual interlude of explosions and of course it made me tense in one of the most eagerly awaited scenes. Maybe this is enough for my review, you don't need many reasons why you should watch this movie, you have to watch this movie because it's a Christopher Nolan movie, you know what it will be like 🔥.

As I watched Christopher Nolan's "Oppenheimer", I had a couple of questions: Was he a Communist? The film left me with the impression that he was an "intellectual" communist but maybe not a political one - a member of the Community Party. The second question it raised for me: Was he an opportunist? On this point, the answer was a little clearer - probably so.
I loved everything about it.
The difficulty of managing the power of knowledge in a world in which the freedom of science to exchange ideas was more and more hobbled by political concerns.

What Christopher Nolan and the filmmakers want to convey to audiences and leaders around the world through Oppenheimer's story is to 'remind' us all to 'not forget the past' about the horrors of war and the dangers of the atomic bomb. That led to the atomic bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945 that killed more than 200,000 people.

Review_Title: Felt like a TV series recap of Highlights
Review: Why did it feel like a huge tv series recap of thrown together highlights to give you the back story of the next season lol! Felt like a super long trailer! After 20 mins I was thinking hope it's starts soon, after 1 hour "when is this film going to start?" After a few hours in I was bored and looking at the time.
It was the way that Nolan presented the story of a historic man was mind blowing. Nothing short of brilliance and the practical effects. Must watch for every one.

I recently had the privilege of engaging with Oppenheimer, and I am truly delighted to share my exceptional experience. From the moment I began my journey with them, I was met with a level of professionalism, expertise, and dedication that truly sets them apart.

Review_Title: A fantastic movie to win an Oscar for Cillian Murphy
Review: Oppenheimer was amazingly good 10/10 o Christopher Nolan made such a really damn good movie all the scenes were damn good!
I had no knowledge of the who's who in the making of The Bomb, so I think I had an unbiased opinion.
Oppenheimer (2023): A Cinematic Triumph with Ludwig Göransson's Masterful Score

Review_Title: Christopher Nolan - a talented person who gives this world his vision through cinema.
Review: A biography of a person at first glance may seem like a trifle to a person from the outside. After all, it is unnecessary to invent anything. There is ready-made material, events, facts. There is a main character of this biography, his life, habits and manners. It's all been, it's all gone. At first glance - the finished material. Take it and write a book, a movie script, or draw a picture. No matter what, but give this task to each of us. Everyone sees her differently. Agree? But Christopher Nolan, showed and told us all this story is incredible, damn excellent! Starting from the plot, script, selection of actors, ending with graphics!

Review_Title: Nolan will never allowed any of his movies to make audiences disappointed
Review: Nolan has a lot perfect work. He chase for the best quality of the movies. Whatever it is a sci-fi or a documentary. I have watched this movie twice in the same day. Especially when I knew that Nolan use iMax to photo this film. The first time I watched it as a 2D quality. And I think 2D may not show the respect to this work. So I chose to watch again, but iMax quality. In this film, Nolan did not use much dialogues between characters, background music may be enough. I think the most wonderful point of this film is the balance between music, dialogue and the scenes. The story is easy, it's about the bomb, why the US create the bomb. And the experiences of Oppenheimer. His love story, the conflict of himself that whether it's right to create the bomb. Nolan is good at making films, a born director. The screen change between colorful and black. He is good at lead audiences get into the main story. If u don't watch this film yet, u may do not understand what I am talking about. But if u watch later and whenever u feel the feeling to control the world through bomb, u wil know what I am saying.

Review_Title: More TV movie/docudrama than IMAX epic
Review: I find Nolan films falling into the 'trying too hard to be clever' category. He tries to be cinematic but I cannot think of a scene in all his films that is really cinematic except the gliding Spitfire at end of Dunkirk.

Perfect Nolan's treat Worth watching it. Cillian Murphy's screen presence and Downey's performance nailed it. Kept the audience on their seat for the whole duration. Even if it looks like a documentary film it really deals with a lot starting off from Oppenheimer till the bomb. Nolan did his magic again with the cast and in techincal terms. Don't miss this epic art.

Finally I saw the movie Oppenheimer. Wow. Nolan is a goddamn genius. The editing remind me of Bertolucci movies. From a historical perspective, the movie is good. There are inaccuracies in the representation of the biography, but on the whole it is decent.

The tense, examination towards the end of the movie is one of the greatest plot points of a movie I have ever seen. One minor complaint, that stops it from being a 10/10, is the explosive audio towards the opening of the film, in a particular scene with RDJ the music was so loud that it made the dialogue of the scene unclear. Emily Blunt was an absolutely incredible portrayal of Kitty Oppenheimer, especially during the examination when Dr Oppenheimer is questioned with regards to his relationship with Jean the known communist, The movie moves at an absolutely beautiful pace, and did not feel like a 3 hour movie at all. A true masterpiece. In my opinion, this is a contender for the greatest film we will ever see. Nolan deserves praise.

The director of Oppenheimer more than satisfactorily gave me an aural and visual experience of the detonation of the atomic device. All the actors displayed nuanced, visual and verbal, characteristics in their respective roles. I have "love/hate" feelings depicting leading-role actors from previous movies in another movie whereupon they are not in the lead.

This movie is a master piece through and through. Not one part of it was bad. This movie single handedly is the best one that's come out in years since covid slammed the movie industry into the dirt. There's been disappointment after disappointment in the years since its ended. This movie is not that though. The entire story is told in full detail without leaving out any of it in a perfectly easy way to follow. The sound track was also amazing in this. This entire movie will single handedly be the best some of these actors and the director ever took part in. It's also my strong opinion that anyone that says it was bad is a dumb as idiot that probably has no interest in history.

This is an attempt to condense what occurred in a reverent teenage mind, over the course of 180 minutes sat in a cinema theatre (with no seat left empty) witnessing Oppenheimer. I doubt it shall do any justice to the emotions elicited in my own viewing, and I encourage those who read, to see for oneself independent of my own perspectives.
Thanks to the all actors and directors!

Review_Title: A Visual Masterclass But A Not so GoodStory
Review: I personally did not like the non-linear structure of the film. The way that Nolan tried to spin Strauss's betrayal as suspense was lackluster and off-putting . Firstly, the structure really just made the trial lack build-up. Practically, the last ten minutes or so is where things unfold haphazardly. Almost trying to piece together a cop-out climactic surprise villain ending. Then 'thematic' suspense is just off-putting for what it was trying to do, create a complex view of Oppenheimer. By the end, he was just doing Spielberg's school of Heroes vs Villain. Strauss, very bad man. Oppenheimer, complex but mostly good. Its too simplified for comfort. The use of time could have been more effective in showing the change that the film aims to show with Oppenheimer's view of the bomb to be honest.

This movie in my opinion is one of the best movie I have ever seen. Even at 3 hours long every scene is important to understanding who Oppenheimer is and keeps you engaged. If you know nothing about the 40s and 50s i would recommend doing a little research about the cold war, ww2 and world politics during that era just so it's easier to follow in the beginning (not necessary to enjoy the film). This is the only movie that I have seen, with zero action and still has you on the edge of your seat. The acting was absolutely incredible not just from the main characters but from every little person in the story. Cinematography is stunning as you would come to expect from a Nolan film. Overall if you love storytelling and a great film that isn't just run and gun action or superheroes then this movie will not only keep you engaged but will have you thinking and talking on the car ride home.

Review_Title: This Movie is enough to show ASIANS are crazy about NOLAN and His work
Review: I went to watch 2AM SHOW IN IMAX , PAKISTAN AND IT WAS HOUSEFUL/COMPLETE SOLD OUT.

Every second of this masterpiece is a thrilling experience. It is intense and dramatic in the best way possible. Here you must actually concentrate on every scene, on every action and word to fully grasp the storyline and the complexities of it. The way the story is told is fast paced but intertwined with slow moments that keep it interesting. The cinemaphotography is brilliant, a thousand words in one scene, utilizing bright colors that contrast with the black and white moments.
The filmography the color the actors the set. It's all just perfect to describe what happend in history.
Nolans most emotional since Interstellar.

The movie was very exceptional . Christopher Nolan's vision was fulfilled in this movie . The cinematography , the cgi everything was top notch . The actors in this movie , incuding Cillian Murphy ,Emily Blunt , Robert Downey Jr, everyone gave their best efforts . Ad a science student , the actual physics terms in this movie seemed a bit basic but perfect nonetheless .Cillian Murphy , espescially , was perfect for the role of Oppenheimer . Him depicting Oppenheimer's agony as he gave a peech to the people and during the trials was exceptional . Overall the movie was very well made , with every single small detail in mind . I have tried to keep this review as spoiler free as possible , but i think i have written only the basic things .

Oppenheimer is a delight as good cinema. From the performances of Murphy and Downey Jr., Damon and Malik, to the staging, they give the film a pace that doesn't slow down in its 3 hours, at times conveying the feeling of being overwhelmed by their characters. Nolan proves to be very solid in the biographical genre, showing in great detail one of the most iconic and thorny moments of the entire 20th century. Definitely an important historical document; a film to show in schools and reflect on how the start of this arms race marks a before and after in geopolitics and how our actions, however altruistic, sometimes have unsuspected consequences.

Unpopular opinion here. I had to question if I was watching the same film everyone else was raving about as it was nowhere near a good as the hype. The 3hr film could have been 30 mins long and still conveyed the same information. Oppenheimer develops the atom bomb, tests it halfway through the film and the rest is set in a stuffy office room where a disgruntled colleague tries throwing him under the bus for being a communist. That's it. Throw in a lot of loud dramatic sound effects to attempt to make the visual aspect more interesting and there's your film. It was essentially 3 hours of blathering drivel and the first time I've considered leaving the cinema from boredom.

Everything in this movie is amazing. The acting is near perfection with Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr., Matt Damon and countless others. Cillian Murphy's performance in particular is sure to be Oscar winning with how he portrays Robert Oppenheimer so well. The writing of this film will keep you wanting more and more out of this film. Even if you are a Marvel fan were you want to see constant action you will still be on your seat at each moment. The music only adds to this only much more with the music being on par with Interstellar. You will be watching this movie and be completely sub directed of the film by each quaking moment. I can't think of a dull moment in this film. This is easily one of Cristopher Nolan's best movies with it easily reaching his top three and debatably reaching top two. You can feel the atomic bomb detonation and with every sound you can feel and almost feel like you're there. The cinematography also has to be mentioned where you cannot deny at how good it is. You will be leaving the theater jaws dropped at the ending. And I must mention that you will not feel the runtime at all. The first two hours go by so fast you will want to do it over and over again and the last hour you just wish it to be longer and forever.

"Oppenheimer" is a cinematic masterpiece that delves into the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the brilliant physicist behind the creation of the atomic bomb. With meticulous attention to historical accuracy, the film paints a compelling portrait of Oppenheimer's complex persona, highlighting his scientific genius, ethical dilemmas, and the profound impact of his work on humanity. The cinematography beautifully captures the era's essence, while stellar performances, particularly by the lead, breathe life into the character. The narrative navigates through Oppenheimer's internal struggles, the Manhattan Project's moral ambiguity, and the global repercussions of unleashing atomic power. Though a bit dense at times, the film's thought-provoking exploration of science, power, and morality lingers long after the credits roll. A must-watch for history buffs, science enthusiasts, and anyone intrigued by the interplay of intellect and consequence.

Christopher Nolan, known for his groundbreaking films, has once again outdone himself with "Oppenheimer." This cinematic masterpiece transcends both time and genre, offering audiences an immersive and thought-provoking experience that only Nolan's directorial prowess could achieve.

Oppenheimer is a 3hrs long movie but there was not a single second where i felt bored. The music gave me "GOOSEBUMPS". Most of people are planning to see this movie just for the explosion, but if you are one of those people then you would be dissapointed. The movie is about "THE MOST IMPORTANT MAN" of history. Most of the time in the movie there will be conversations and conversations but it didn't bore me bescause I was not there just to watch the explosion but i was there to know how J. Robert Oppenheimer's life, How broken he was after he saw the power of his creation and in simple words the movie Oppenheimer is "FLAWLESS".

"Oppenheimer" is an exceptional movie that captivates its audience with its compelling storytelling, brilliant performances, and breathtaking cinematography. The film masterfully portrays the life and achievements of J. Robert Oppenheimer, shedding light on his pivotal role in the development of the atomic bomb during World War II. With a thought-provoking narrative and a deep exploration of ethical dilemmas, it leaves viewers pondering the consequences of scientific discoveries. Overall, "Oppenheimer" is a must-see film that brilliantly captures the complexities of history and the human condition.

The movie is a masterpiece. You can feel the character's difficulties and the storms blowing inside him deeply and sincerely. I saw the movie in IMAX and if you had told me it was a horror movie I wouldn't have objected. Albert Einstein was handled very well and the connection between what Openheimer said to him in the last scene and the first scene was perfect and fascinating. Personally, I felt Openheimer's regret even in myself. Chillian Murphy did a great job and even the supporting actors in the movie were Oscar-worthy. After leaving the movie, I questioned life for about 15 minutes in the corridor of the cinema and I felt the same feeling even at home. A movie that will stay with you for a long time after watching it. Classic Christopher Nolan Thank you.

I was at the premiere of the movie and it was amazing! I want to thank the entire team that worked on this movie, you guys are really cool! In the film everything was on the highest level, the cast, cinema, musical accompaniment, plot, sound, in one word everything! Throughout the film, he keeps the viewer in some tension, as if you are experiencing all the emotions that Oppenheimer himself experienced.

I expected a movie centered around nuclear war and the potential annihilation of the planet to be more captivating, but it just wasn't. Once again Christopher Nolan is semi-redeemed by terrific acting and a great cast, which is perhaps the only redeemable thing about this trash heap of a film. Truthfully I just couldn't wait for it to end...but it just wouldn't.

The soundtracks in this film are more than creative. The quality is at the peak of beauty. Verbal dialogues with music in you beauty. The characters in the movie are wonderful. Cillian Murphy is very creative. Soundtracks in this film are more than creative. The quality is at the peak of beauty. Verbal dialogues with music in you beauty. The characters in the movie are wonderful. Cillian Murphy is very creative. Soundtracks in this film are more than creative. The quality is at the peak of beauty. Verbal dialogues with music in you beauty. The characters in the movie are wonderful. Cillian Murphy is very creative.

I've never seen a movie this good in YEARS I thought theaters were dead but this saved that this was so amazing it made me sit there for a good minutes loves the acting the sound track and everything else about this movie it was honestly so great it made me happy that movies like this still existed the lead actor was really just perfect it made get chills it was like I felt his emotions and don't forget the other actors they were olso amazing and they all made the movie a 10 and the blast was realistic the delay and the hit gave me goosebumps Christopher Nolen did a amazing job on this movie he has never let me down and never will.

Review_Title: This movie was too short to be honest
Review: It was a really good movie, but I feel like it honestly could have explored so much more of the story of Oppenheimer. I'd say they could have packed atleast another 30 minutes into this movie just because they could have packed so much more into this film.

Always in the hallmark of a Nolan-style film, the setting is made magnificently and beautifully and adds cinema value. The sound of this film is amazing. The way the time is placed in this film makes this film more complicated than usual films. Overall, I am very satisfied with this film. Maybe this movie is the best movie i've ever watched so far. The IMAX format makes it extraordinary. Maybe a slight drawback is that there are too many facts that happen in one minute and it keeps hitting the audience's brain, but maybe that's what Nolan wants to emphasize on the audience, namely a sense of complexity, confusion, anxiety, reflecting Oppenheimer's regret after what happened in Japan. Truly cinema. Really masterpiece. Salute to the director, director, cast and crew.

Oppenheimer is a sweeping and ambitious film that tells the story of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the scientist who led the Manhattan Project to develop the atomic bomb. The film is directed by Christopher Nolan, who brings his signature visual style to the project. The film is also notable for its large ensemble cast, which includes Cillian Murphy, Emily Blunt, Matt Damon, Robert Downey Jr., and Rami Malek.

Review_Title: Cillian Murphy's best performance to date.
Review: There are movies that transcend mere entertainment, and "Oppenheimer" is undoubtedly one of them. Directed by the brilliant Christopher Nolan, this three-hour masterpiece is a breathtaking display of pure art, paying a splendid modern tribute to the grandeur of Hollywood's golden era. Nolan's craftsmanship is at its pinnacle, complemented by a 5-star cast featuring Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr., and Emily Blunt.

TBH I really surprised with Nolan's 1st Time Writing. Apart from Objective Scenes, Nolan Wrote Subjective scenes in a good manner with some Dark Humors. Especially the convo bw Oppie n Einstein and Oppie n Leslie during end and start of the film vice versa. Music made me rumble during 1st test and football basement meet. Now to the main plot Cinematography. It's Usual Thing for Nolan films to be with Good Cinematography. This is no exception. The Portrait individual shots, top angled shots are really came out well. Few frames are worth to be the wallpapers. For example, Green apple spilling with poison, Cillian's Zoomed in shots, Los Alamos and especially my favorite Pugh's cornered shot hugging Cillain during 2nd sex scene. I felt 2 issues with the Cinematography. 1st one an in and out in Portrait shots. I don't know why it happened but I don't think they done it purposely. 2nd is scaling. We are not gonna see the real blast in film. Only the test bombing is shown in the film. But we couldn't measure the range of the blast since there is no any nearby objects. And Finally to the performance. As usual Cillian, Matt and RDJ Nailed their roles. I felt some warm in heart whenever I saw Conti as Einstein. Blunt gave a notable performance. Pugh's role is not lengthy as the 85%+ of film moving to the main content. Since it's a Biopic you may face some slowness in Screenplay where I'm okay with it.
Hate to says that but the movie is BORING!!

Review_Title: Some of the best editing I have ever seen in a film
Review: Oppenheimer (the film not the guy) communicates some very complicated scientific ideas simply to allow them to be surrounded in the main message of the film, questioning the morality of the entire project and the persons involved. It is written extremely well.

Best biopic I've ever seen
The best thing about the movie is the sound effects and sound engineering
Of course, the photography is awesome, especially since even black and white is captured using iMax technology
I rarely talk or write reviews on movies, but I can't stress how much I love this movie.

"Oppenheimer" is an exceptional film by Christopher Nolan that delves deep into the life of Robert Oppenheimer, the brilliant physicist who played a crucial role in the development of the atomic bomb. Nolan's direction and storytelling skills are on full display in this riveting biographical drama.

What is good:
The movie has great storylines. Mr. Nolan is the master in story telling. I was never feeling bored during the 3 hr movie. The flashback combine with black/white and color scene tells great stories. For someone who is interested in the WW2 history, this movie is a must to recommend.

Nolan delivers a gadget of profound intellectually provocative weight, slaps it upon the minds of the audience and compels them to implode their moral preconceptions upon the nature of power, love and humanity. A true biographical film which latches upon the eyes of J. Robert Oppenheimer; revealing the troubles that come with "vison beyond this world." In my personal view, Julius Robert Oppenheimer is a flawed individual: conceited, arrogant, stubborn in his vast intellect, to the extent that his devotion to science and advancement of scientific theory clouds his intrinsic morals. The protagonist is portrayed as logical, with ample ability for reasonable foresight in matters of the political and philosophical impact of his actions, but continues to deceive himself of the moral implications of his "gadget." This man knew in his heart of hearts the results of his theory,
fully aware of the eventual display of power and threat of mutually assured destruction in the future. Nolan humanizes a genius of universal proportions, revealing that in-depth understanding of quantum phenomena (or any physical science) does not equate to emotional intelligence, nor basic human empathy.

Review_Title: Blown away by the Scene by Scene comparisons and RDJ and Cilian Murphy's acting prowess
Review: Mr Nolan never disappoints. The hype, the legacy leading up to the actual cinematic experience stands true right from the very first scene. The stark contrast, the character plays so well in the movie and is so engrossing that one will forget that this is the longest movie of Mr Nolan. The casting, the performances makes it a movie which is not to be missed if you are even if you are just a fun-viewer.

Not bad, but could've been more captivating. Incorporating elements of espionage, a country rivalry in bomb development, and similar plotlines could've enhanced it. As it stands, it's a chamber drama with numerous characters and insufficient intrigue for its 180-minute runtime.

Review_Title: First Nolan Movie- Best Movie I've seen in a cinema in the last 7 years.
Review: I went to see this movie in the theatre, knowing about the Manhattan project loosely with little knowledge. It is well done, and once you sit through the first 20 minutes, the movie's ADHD back and forth makes sense. To avoid spoilers, I will mention the cinematography. There are 2 scenes that blew me away. One is the Trinity test, which faithfully and almost meticulously recreates actual filmed parts of the test and preparations for it, is bone chilling. The other scene at the end, with another person, makes a great ending, and the accompanying soundtrack almost makes you feel obligated to feel the emotions they are talking about. If possible, I would recommend seeing it in IMAX because it is actually designed for it, and I REALLY want to see it in IMAX now, even though I saw it yesterday. The only downside was the sometimes confusing story, but the overall story is understandable.

This film is definitely worth watching. The cinematic experience is out of this world and makes you leave the theatre almost in the state of shock. The cast, the story and simply every aspect of this film is a masterpiece. Even though film is generally considered an art form, I have yet to encounter a film more worthy of the title of art than Oppenheimer. As I saw critics and media portraying this film at the top of the industry, I had more than high expectations and they were all met. As I was running a bit late to the cinema I didn't have enough time to buy popcorn or any snacks, which was honestly a save of money since all my focus was immediately captured when Oppenheimer showed up on the screen so I am not sure I would even be able to eat it.

What does the film represent? A story about the manhattan project and the making of the atomic bomb, but also a detailed view into a mind which saw things not many could see. Oppenheimer shows that all along, he knew exactly what he was doing, they all knew they were building a bomb with huge destructive capabilities, yet went with it anyway. These people on the project were scientists and the film really shows that there was a fine line of morality that each one was crossing when pushing for innovation, which ultimately led to destruction. In the end, Oppenheimer never regretted what he did, he may have felt remorseful about the deaths, but Nolan captures that really he knew he was the most important man on the planet at the time and people would listen to whatever he had to say. A gentle soul, yet strong egotistical and somewhat political view on the world.

The acting, cinematography, musical score, editing, everything about this film was flawless. This is the culmination of Christopher Nolan's life's work. This will be one of those movies that everyone has in their top 10 list. RDJ, Cillian Murphy and Emily Blunt lead an allstar cast that don't miss many spots in the telling of their story. Such an immense era in the history of our nation's military development amidst the the changing global landscape of physics needed this level of acting. Even in the scenes that were simply story building dialoge, the weight of the moment could be felt by the viewer. A masterpiece from start to finish.

My star rating for this movie will not be accurate because you can not put anything higher than 10. All i can say is christopher nolan is an absolute genius. The movie was incredible. I left the theater with tears in my eyes and jaw dropped to the popcorn covered floor. Still processing life after seeing this incredible masterpiece that must be placed beside the mona lisa. Scratch that, it must REPLACE the mona lisa. When a movie makes your body freeze and stop breathing you know it's good. My therapist will be pleased to hear that i'm close to finding the meaning of life after this movie. Thank you to christopher nolan and the entire cast of oppenheimer for reminding us all of what movies are meant to do.

A hypermasculine Sofia Coppola mood piece about physics. Why not be concerned about the latest problems physics presents in the present: the huge accelerator supercollider at Cern attempts to see back to the dawn of time. The point is this: science repeats itself in everwidening circles. The brave minds of Oppenheimer offer additional potentials by expanding physics with the artistic expressions of mood, memory, and adventure. The actor Cillian Murphy is hot to look at and fun to watch in an expressive gem. Thank you Christopher Guest for writing the truth about the past present and future in a film the mass audience can process today.

Review_Title: The best film which I ever seen
Review: My favorite movie has always been "Interstellar." No other film could evoke such emotions in me as it does. Christopher Nolan's new film once again managed to bring back those feelings and sensations while watching it. When you watch "Oppenheimer," you experience the entire range of emotions and sensations that a film can offer. Throughout all three hours, you'll be thrilled by the brilliance of the film, screenplay, music, visual effects, acting, directing, and cinematography. Everything is meticulously thought out and meaningful, making it exceptionally perfect and captivating. You completely immerse yourself in the film and become a part of it, living the lives of the characters, sharing their emotions. After viewing, there's a sense of fulfillment and a pleasant aftertaste. Christopher Nolan's films prompt contemplation and reflection, as they should after watching a movie. I recommend them to anyone who appreciates quality cinema, values art, and simply wants to delve into the world of great films.

Review_Title: Three hours and it doesn't even pass the bechdel test
Review: I fail to see how a three hour long movie can fail the bechdel test, your telling me in three hours there aren't two women that have a conversation about something other than a man. The lack of historical accuracy is shown by the lack of women that were important to the creation of the atom bomb that were not portrayed. This movie is romanticising someone that isn't even a good person that killed more than hundreds of people. It's incredibly boring.

Review_Title: Every youth will definitely watch this film.
Review: This film is the biography of the legendary Scientists Robert Oppenheimer. We saw the timeline of this film is during the second world war. How Germany is not invented the atomic bomb this film tell us the truth. Oppenheimer wife is comiunist and that's his big fault. At the end of this film we have a idea about this. This is not a tripical Nolan movie. We have see few change in it.cilian Murphy performance is superb. Robert Downey Jr role was nice portrait in this film. Sound quality was nice. In theaters the audience got goosebumps after hearing the sound. Screenplay,the dialog delivery by actor is good.

The Movie has its Good Moments. But also some parts that feel like dragging the Tempo down ... sometimes there are too many characters that dont get really introduced ... i personal would loved a small intro for every Scientist in the Project. So it just gets confusing sometimes ...

This movie is one of the greatest movies that have been released in the last 10 years. I don't remember the last time I watched a great movie in the cinema. The great movies that got released the last couple years were either banned from cinema in my region or I haven't had a chance to see it in cinema.
"Oppenheimer " is definitely another masterpiece with the combination of sentimental history event, brilliant performances ,marvelous storytelling.

This is a film to be watched many times. So many layers intertwined to majestically compose a perfect description of Oppenheimer's life,inside out. The guilt. The genius. The lover. The rational. The success yet the deep dark feeling that said success generated. The politics. The effects of an idiot with power. The loyalty and the treason. All of this about one of the most important moments in human history. How can you combine all these in a single film? Certainly Nolan had the answer, along with brilliant actors that bring to the audience a living sensation as if it would be a real life experience.

This has had to be one of the most anticipated movies of the year and I got to say Nolan did not miss on this one. Throughout the entire 3 hours long the movie played for I did not feel bored once at all. There was always something big about to happen that you were just waiting to see, nothing in the film was not needed and everything in it made the movie even better. The cinematography in this movie is absolutely outstanding. The Atomic Bomb scene is one of the best scenes from a movie I've ever seen. When watching the scene for the first time there was about 2 minutes from when the button was pressed to the sound of the explosion, the 2 minutes felt like 20 seconds. During the 2 minutes my heart was beating to an extreme pace and when the sound came the whole theater vibrated feeling like the bomb hit you. But the ending is what makes this movie a true 10/10. Einstein tells Oppenheimer that his whole life he will have to deal with the consequences and regret of his creation. The casting in this movie is amazing as a think Cillian murphy does a great job playing Oppenheimer, and who doesn't love Robert Downey Jr.

The main point one comes away with from Oppenheimer is that humanity isn't ready to have the power it possesses and its just a matter of time until we blow ourselves up in nuclear annihilation. Sadly, this film is timed perfectly as we are now fearing a nuclear armed Russia as well as other rogue countries. A phrase comes to mind, before you asked if you should, you did. Oppenheimer is a deep movie, lot's is going on. Be sure and know what you are getting into. It's a brilliant film, but it's not for everyone. Cillian Murphy will win best actor, Nolan best director, Blount best female actor and a score of other awards will go to this film. This movie is an experience, much like 2001 is an experience. I will probably see it again very soon.

How disappointing. The moments that were good you can eventually YouTube. I want to see movies in theaters that are larger than life, like Top Gun Maverick was last year. I think these films should take you to visual places you cannot normally go in every day life. Nolan's films used to have this impact. I thought it would be a good theater movie because it would be a big visual movie about the atom bomb. No.
Finally watched the movie today, was hoping I don't miss this one amidst my other travel compulsions.
I saw this on IMAX with my dad, brilliant movie with a great cast of actors.
Oppenheimer is a difficult, thought provoking watch and does it's subject matter complete justice.

Review_Title: A multi layered deep dive into a thrilling story with time shifting confusion
Review: Unbelievable performances from Murphy and Downey Jr in a film so rich in it's tapestry. It explores the morals, politics and human endeavour of the Manhattan project so well. The cinematography is outstanding as you expect from Nolan. A beautiful and unique soundtrack backdrops the mania of taking on a task of such magnitude - You can almost physically feel the weight of it as the moment comes to test the bomb.

Review_Title: I learned a lot about the basics if this event
Review: I learned a lot about the basics if this event.

This movie is really good. From its writing, its direction, it casting. I really loved it. I liked that the movie doesn't talk entirely about the bomb but talks about its creator oppenheimer in a story that makes you think how it must have felt to be aboard that manhatten project. Visually the movie is stunning. The sound effects and the music composed by ludwig is fantastic. You can actually feel the power of the nuke like you're there on the test site. Cillian Murphy was absolutely incredible, the other actors like matt damon, Robert downy and Emily blunt etc were really great too. I give it 10/10.

Review_Title: Very important and amazing - but will not be a mega hit.
Review: I would say it's about 8.5 of 10 - but generally not possible to make movie of such specific topic with score 10. Too complex. I think Nolan received about 97% of maximum possible result. But at least half of this score - is a work of his fantastic Dream Team.

Review_Title: Couldn't wait to get out of the theatre!
Review:
3 hours to relate human stupidity is way too much. Really a pity, the story is only told to the first degree when it could have gone much much further in the dimensions, emotionnally, humanly, but also the consequences that it does have on the spiritual planes of existence... I guess we're not ready for that king of awerness yet...
The actors are okay and the music is not bad
On the cinematographic side there is nothing exceptional...
Do you want to see the most beautiful staging of all time relating the explosion of the 1st atomic bomb? Go watch episode 8 of season 3 of David Lynch's Twin peaks! That's a masterpiece!

Not Gonna Lie I was not expecting Exteremly Good Film but I am exteremly suprised If I split the film In 3 Pieces (every Piece 1 hour)
First Piece Is Really Confusing Part Because Film Does Not Go On a Straight Line I Sometimes Shows Future / past Continously New Characters are entering movie
Second Piece And The Beggining Of The Third Piece Is My Favourite part
Oppenheimer has a relationship with an communist . While Developing Nuclear Weapon He Needs To Get security approval
But Due The Relationship With An Communist He Struggles To get security approval he has to leave His Communist Partner To get security approval But This Woman Couldnt handle it and ends her life.

Review_Title: Mind blowing Story telling with Science & Politics dominating each other
Review: Before Oppenheimer my favourite used to be Alan Turing's Biopic 'The Imitation Game'. Now I consider Oppenheimer is the film of this century with great story telling combining Science and politics. Every detail in this film is like a stellar experience to watch. Christopher Nolan did a brilliant work in showcasing every aspect of Dr. Oppenheimer's life. Chevalier Incident, Edward Teller(Father of Hydrogen Bomb), Karl Fuchs, Ernico Fermi, 1954 Security Hearing etc, all you need to know about before going to Theatres. I assume Nolan have shown the development of "Fatman" which was dropped on Nagasaki that was filled by plutonium in this film.

Robert never like this nickname. He viewed it as demeaning. He liked Self-discipline. He could see the femto second. Way more before it was invented. He went on psychotic episodes, but he stood his ground to sanity. Barely!

Oppenheimer is probably up there with one of the best films I've seen... in a very long time. The feeling you have through the whole 3 hours is gargantuan - it leaves you feeling sad and scared throughout. The quick edited scenes, the feeling of dread in every scene, with the use of intense music and sound. It was most definitely did not feel like a 3 hour movie. The pacing is just right, the blend of the storyline, from start to finish is like a loud and finely tuned machine. Probably my favourite Nolan film to date. I'm sure others will think Nolan has done better, but it's probably my personal favourite. I 100% intend going to see it again at the cinema - if you are planning on watching this, find time to watch it at the cinema, and if you can, an IMAX, this film is an experience.

Review_Title: When a movies exceeds it's hypeness
Review:
I went to the movie theatre thinking even though it'll be great movie it's hypeness is going to kill joy of the movie because I thought it was over hyped and it'll be impossible to meet that kind of a hypness in a movie. But I was wrong that movie exceeded all my expectations and honestly now I believe the movie was under hyped
I didn't even feel the movie was 03 hours long and the cast was perfect. Performance of Cillian Murphy and Robert was brilliant. I'll never forget the chills that I felt when I watched the bomb testing scene. And i truly believe this movie will be one of the greatest art ever to produce by humans. (I'm not a die hard Nolan fan}

Review_Title: The Nolan Cinema Universe strikes again
Review: How to critic Oppenheimer without talking firstly about the quality of the cast.

Review_Title: A masterpiece not ready for its audience
Review: This film is beautiful. Its cinematography along with its cast and screenplay is just magnificent. The beginning is shot in such a pace that you cannot loose focus, i've never experienced something alike.

I know I'm in the significant minority here on this review, but I was honestly not impressed with Oppenheimer. I went in not knowing what to expect from it other than the few snippets of previews I had seen and obviously what I knew from my American history lessons in college.

Three hours of movie, and I enjoyed every second of it. The story is told in a very astonishing way, the visuals and the soundtrack are like nothing I've seen or heard before. In the end of the movie I had a real stroke of emotions and goosebumps all over my body.
This is such a great and thorough telling of the history of the atomic bomb and the Manhattan project, but unlike the cold emotionless pages of a history book, it has been brought to life.

#Oppenheimer
It's not cyclical, it's spiral. It looks like a cycle (circle) since we are accustomed to look from the top (from the position of moral superiority as it is convenient). But from the top even mushroom cloud will appeared to be a circle (if you ever survive to tell the shape of it) .

Awesome acting, makeup, wardrobe all over here. Loved it. Obviously king but I didn't know all of the history behind this and it taught me a lot. I'd like to see it again as I'm sure I'll catch way more nuance than the first go. Acting was fantastic and I loved how they mixed up black and white "footage" with the more real time color aspects. Suspenseful soundtrack as well. Literally had suspense until the last line of the movie so don't leave early. Nothing exciting in the first half of the credits, at least that I saw as I headed out. Wild historical story that changed the course of the world and beyond unfortunately.

Review_Title: Christopher Nolan: A Master of Cinematic Brilliance
Review: Oppenheimer is a thought-provoking and emotionally charged cinematic experience. With its exceptional performances, especially from Cillian Murphy and Robert DJ, the film delves deep into the moral dilemmas of scientific progress and the burden of responsibility. Nolan's directorial prowess and storytelling mastery shine once again, making Oppenheimer a powerful and unforgettable cinematic experience.

Oppenheimer instantly enters the discussion for best film ever made, with impecable editing, scarring music and towering performances from a solid cast. Nolan's screenplay is incisive and detailed, with enough material to make the 3 hours feel like not enough time to devour this delicious work of art. Blending the thriller and the political courthouse drama, Christopher Nolan crafted an innovative cinematic experience that's both grand but shockingly sensitive and intimate. The tension, brought to its absolute limit in what may be the most tense countdown sequence ever made, is ultimately released in a shattering revelation that feels like a bucket of ice-cold water thrown at your body in the film's final moments. This masterclass in balance of an abundance of rich elements makes Oppenheimer a thoroughly engrossing victory that makes one feel as conflicted as the man behind its title: happy to have witnessed it but disheartened by its consequence.

Review_Title: Great! But is it too much and very confusing.
Review: Wonderful movie I like looking at history movies. Great Story line. But its very confusing the timeline is very Hard too understand. Till the second hour you can Look a Wonderful After it you loose interest. Charakter are great picked and historically good. Also they are very near with the Real Person (historically). Wonderful colours great camera and direction. My Problem is that He have Differential scenes in Different times and you dont directly understand it and this brings you out of context Till the End Beginns because their you realise what its All about. But generally it is a great movie by a great director.

Review_Title: Looks like a badly edited documentary
Review: It's easy to say I love it and feel safe being in the crowd but I won't do it for this Nolan movie.
An Ultimate Mastepiece by the master craftsman himself.

Review_Title: OPPENHEIMER - THE FILM OF THE CENTURY !!
Review: No spoilers here, just writing about how I feel about Oppenheimer.

Probably the most thought-provoking big-budget studio film in the last 20 years. While this was a fine film, the acting was utterly tremendous. Cillian Murphy, Robert Downy Junior, and Emily Blunt put on a true masterclass in acting, dwarfed only by the magnitude of Oppenheimer's life's work: the atomic bomb. Magnificent performances, and as far as big-budget studio films go, Oppenheimer may be second to none. The film had so many layers, and was truly one of the finest examples of the magnitude of life's everlasting consequences. It's silly to say a commercially successful movie will clean up at awards season, but it would be a travesty if the Cillian, RDJ, and Emily Blunt didn't all get a statue, as well as the sound team, and cinematography.

Oppenheimer's passion for physics and science shines through in this film. For such a niche topic, it is remarkable how the story remains interesting and carries the suspense that is found in some of these scenes. For that alone it's definitely worth the watch. If that's not enough, there are great performances across the board from a wide array of familiar faces. Personally however, the dynamic between Cillian Murphy and RDJ was the highlight. Like most Nolan films however, the pacing holds the movie back in some parts, and not every buildup leads to a satisfying conclusion.

Powerful film as it has incredible performances from all the cast members (Cillian Murphy and RDJ standouts). Gripping storyline and screenplay and concise in details. It could've been 10 to 15 minutes shorter as there were some scenes which were a bit too dragged or were unnecessary for the story's focus. Powerful cameos by Casey Affleck and Rami Malek ( watch out for the court room scene). The villain might shock you in some extent. The actor that portrays Einstein does a wonderful job even though he didn't have too many dialogues. Is it better than Barbie? Well they are two completely different films so it's difficult to judge them together. Overall this is a film which you shouldn't miss out on: with in the cinemas or once it comes digitally.

I'm still collecting my thoughts after experiencing this film, Cillian Murphy might as well start clearing a space on his mantle for the Best Actor Oscar.

Review_Title: OVERHYPED MOVIE WITH MANY UNNECESSERY SCENES
Review:
BORING ... OVERHYPED ... WASTAGE OF TIME AND MONEY ....
I just watched the movie in the theater. I have never been so excited to watch a movie. I studied about Manhattan Project so much since my high school days. I am now 38 years old. But I have to say that I am really disappointed. This movie is OVER-HYPED. The three-hour-long movie is really dull. While the section on Manhattan Project is interesting, I find many scenes redundant and boring. The film could have been condensed into less duration removing unnecessary scenes. All actors did a great job in their respective roles. But Christopher Nolan has disappointed me with mixing various elements in a haphazard way. This movie is OK - But NOT GOOD and definitely NOT GREAT. I am really very disappointed.
Ahh... Oppenheimer the Father of the Atomic Bomb, the American Prometheus and so on.

Wow. With no doubt in my mind this will be remembered and be considered a classic in the future, along with all of Mr. Nolan's films. I think one of the best things about this movie is its casting, I don't think anyone else could have played Dr. J. Robert Oppenheimer besides Cillian Murphy and along with Emily Blunt as his wife Kitty Oppenheimer and Robert Downey Jr. As Lewis Strauss. The only thing I think could have been done in casting is choosing someone else for LTG. Leslie Groves and not because Matt Damon is a bad actor his lines just felt forced and his performance was also felt forced. Another thing that this movie did great was it's score, ludwig göransson is one of the best film composers of all time, I genuinely listen to the soundtrack casually now, It's so good. It also has one of the best plot twists in film ever when Dr. David L. Hill who is played by Rami Malek who hasn't talked the entire movie just drops a bombshell at Lewis Strauss's Senate confirmation hearing and testifies against him and support Oppenheimer him even though we all thought he hated Oppenheimer. Overall, I find it hard to believe that this will not be remembered as one of the greatest films ever.

Review_Title: Ate it up without being spoon fed
