"Oppenheimer" endeavors to shed light on the fascinating life of J. Robert Oppenheimer and his involvement in the creation of the atomic bomb. While the film does have its informative moments, it falls short in various aspects, leaving audiences with mixed feelings and a sense of missed potential.

In this movie you will learn nothing about history or science. Nothing about emotions. Nothing about geo politics. It looks quite nice. Maybe it could have been ok if edited to 2 hours. 3 hours implies an epic. But this movie was just not epic in scale. To be an epic, it would have had to go outside Oppenheimer's bubble. About 1 hours was dedicated to his trial of "security clearance", who honestly cares about that. The Albert Einstein character was kind of like a Santa Claus type figure, not an actual person. It was just boring. I feel like an idiot spending money to see this, encouraging this false intellectual movie. Let's face it, all biography movies are not actually good movies, except Walk Hard (a parody), and I'm Not Here ( didn't use the typical biography format).

Review_Title: Boring, long winded, tiring and annoying. Simply a flop.
Review: You will get a 3-hour movie that is not entertaining, not edifying, and not intellectually informative. The plot can be summarized in less than 5 minutes, therefore, you will get a lot of filling time when nothing really happens. Half o the movie is a combination of a boring meeting that never ends - you get one of these every day at work - and a mock trial. Moreover, add to it a lack of intellectual depth in all the conversations. The movie really misses the mark on all the aspects of plot/action, a shallow to no conversation/dialog between actors, unmoving/ordinary scenes, and a lack of character development. Add to it a continuous annoying sound that is meant to fill in stridently for the lack of emotion because the movie never gets going. If you don't like it, don't be afraid to recognize it because there is almost nothing to like. My recommendation is not to spend the time.

Review_Title: Murphy is great but Nolan is not
Review: There is a famous Einstein quote: "If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough." In my opinion Nolan failed to explain it simply. Oh don't get me wrong I loved Inception, Interstellar and Dunkirk even though TBH I didn't understand Interstellar fully.

Review_Title: One of the most boring things I have seen
Review: The first 30 seconds was cinematic genius to introduce this movie, the other 25 minutes I sat through was insanely boring. The dialog was ok, the acting fine, but it felt serious, cold, and emotionless. Nothing exciting was happening, and I wasn't enthralled enough with what was going on to care whatsoever. This is a subject I know a fair bit about, and something I am interested in, and yet recognizing references and historical tie ins could not save this movie for me. No way I was going to waste another 2hours+ on this insanely long and insanely boring movie. Sure I didn't see the whole thing, but it did a terrible job engaging me, and burned 15 dollars from my pocket.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer's Insensitive Portrayal: A Reckless Misstep
Review: Hold onto your seats, movie enthusiasts, because "Oppenheimer's Insensitive Portrayal" takes you on a bewildering journey through historical misrepresentation and sensationalism. This film attempts to merge the scientific legacy of J. Robert Oppenheimer with the timeless wisdom of the Bhagavad Gita, but ends up veering into tasteless territory.

Review_Title: Nothing much for Asian ..More of a West war documentary
Review: The connection with the movie is only atomic in nature .Even an atomic blast could'nt make it click with the audience..never seen such an uni lnterested crowd..by the time the atomic bomb was tested the fuse in the theater was already blown...

The movie left me with mixed feelings as it attempted to explore the theme of regret and redemption. While the star-studded cast was impressive, it wasn't enough to salvage the film's weak execution. The plot felt disconnected from the intended message, leading to a lack of engagement. Additionally, the movie suffered from being overly long, with some scenes dragging on and loud, distracting elements. Regrettably, the film relied too heavily on the fame of its cast, neglecting to invest in a compelling story or well-developed characters. As a result, it failed to captivate and left me feeling disappointed.

Review_Title: Most boring movie I ever watched in theatre
Review: This movie is from start to end the most boring movie I have ever seen, there is no tension whatsoever. So many unnecessary scenes that dont add any value to the story, the tension towards the headlight of the movie " THE BOMB " I almost had to force myself to keep watching. When they tested the bomb ( after 2 hours of endless/boring conversations ) I was like " thats it? " I have seen bigger exploisons in a fast and furious movie. I thought come on this is not going to be THE EXPLOISON of the movie?! Atleast they are going to show the drop of the bomb on Hiroshima or Nagasaki?! NOOOOO just a radiomessage they dropped the bomb and it was a succes and Oppenheimer crying/nagging like a baby all the time. After the radiomessage I held on for about 10 min but left the theatre. Watching someone feed the ducks at your local park is more entertaining.

Review_Title: dissappointing for most die hard nolan fans
Review: Because what I, and assuming most, find it fascinating about Nolan's work is his brilliant ability to tackle the reality by twisting the rarely evoked imagination. Usually after watching a Nolan, I spend days to think about what I experienced and how it is feeding off my own muse. Unlike this, Oppenheimer dissappointingly, is a flat, uninspired, rushed but deadly long movie. Most characters had inadequate acting range. We all know what Cillian's acting range is, honest to goodness, do you think he gives even the half of it? I do not believe that its his inability but the limitations put by the long and non-linear scenario. All those good actors, which i find the casting so overwhelmingly loaded, scattered around the movie to give a five-minute glimpse without any depth.
Here are some points to consider that also includes some spoilers.

Review_Title: This is the end of Nolan.
Review: I had one more chance for Nolan after the garbage Tenet. And i have none now. This movie shows you how money talks in Hollywood. There is nothing good about this movie, there isn't any theme or clear conflict of the plot even. Everything is mixed together in this bore- fest auto biographic film. Its scenes are ripped off from other films and this film pretends it is bigger than it is with its over the top sound design. I don't recommend anyone to waste their time and money to this.
The whole film can simply be directed by even a high school ,non-professional educated, camera handler.
Everybody is pressured to saying that Christopher Nolan movies are great. Same happens for this one too. I had to sit through 3hrs of boredom and agony trying to figure out what this is all about.
Looking at the review I was really excited to go and watch this movie.

The lack of action and slow pace of the movie made it incredibly dull to watch. In the first part, the characters seemed to do nothing but engage in lengthy conversations that failed to captivate the audience. The only saving grace was the music, which managed to inject some much-needed excitement into an otherwise monotonous storyline.

This is a movie much more about politics and conspiracy than about the development of the nuclear bomb. The trailer is very misleading. The incessant music drowned out the dialogue and the non-chronological edits were very confusing. No charcter buildup. No emotion. A visually provocative biopic that seems less interested in character study. Hard to care about this movie. People and critics are saying they like this movie more than they do because they want to think of themselves as smart. Disappointed. This director is highly overrated and the false genius satus must have gone to his head.

Review_Title: Movie for men, Far too long and boring
Review: I dare to say what some people might want to say but darent.

Tl;DR version
This film is a perfect example of how you can have all the best ingredients but if you put them together incorrectly you can end up with an unpalatable mess.
The movie was very confusing because of two facts:
I don't grasp what's all the fuss about this movie. Three damn hours of talking blah blah blah.. and one terribly shot nuclear explosion. I wish Barbie was not banned in the Middle East.

Review_Title: About a man, not a bomb
Review: Starts off quick and awkward. Very hard to figure out what timeline you are in, throughout the movie. Apparently the future is in B&W, Totally not necessary, just confusing. I kept thinking "geez, we are not in your head, Christopher Nolan, get some details in order" Watching the documentary on Peacock was more enjoyable, and explained a alot. I can't imagine seeing this movie without watching the documentary first. I would have been completely lost, with it I was just merely lost. Too many, way too many characters to keep straight. If I had to choose a best character actor, I'd go with Matt Damon, although his first spout if anger was a bit off. There is much more to Oppenheimer the man, than what is portrayed. If I was streaming this 3 hour movie, I wouldn't have finished it. As it is, 4 people walked out of the theater before the 2 hour mark. Save tour time and money, and watch the documentary on Peacock.

Review_Title: A Disappointing Film Experience: Excessive Dialogue and Lack of Visual Appeal
Review: It's a huge pile of rubbish. This film is a terrible show in terms of entertainment. The two hours pass only with talking. Names, names, names... communist party, politics, and so on. If I wanted this level of detail, I would have read a book. Why am I even coming to the cinema? Because I'm looking for entertainment. Due to this guy's "I won't use CGI" approach, we have to watch something that looks like a photo with added sound. There are so many dialogues in the movie that after a while, you lose track of the plot, and it becomes torture. I had to leave the theater because I couldn't breathe, and my brain neurons collapsed. I've never seen anything more embarrassing in my life. I don't even know if anything was shown in the last 15 minutes, and I don't care anymore.

Oppenheimer is a visually stunning but ultimately unsatisfying film. The film's non-linear narrative is confusing and disorienting, and the film fails to explore the human cost of the atomic bomb. Fans of Christopher Nolan's work may find something to enjoy, but the film is unlikely to appeal to a wider audience. Literally it should be ban. Just telling about comments story of making a atomic bomb. And that thing kill millions of innocent people. This movie make no sense.
Boring story about the questionable persecution of supposed communists in the McCarthy era.

Review_Title: Bump in the road for Nolan
Review: Over produced, but I'm sure people will love it anyway because they think they should. I love Nolan's work, so just disappointed.

Boring Boring Boring
* Christopher Nolan worst movie, I'm Big fan of Mr. Nolan direction and story.

Arguably one of Christopher Nolan's worst films. It amazes me that the person who wrote Interstellar and Inception could be so lazy in writing a biopic. The dialogue is atrocious. Character introductions were cliche. The subjective black and white story line was unnecessary. It's tough to make a three hour movie feel rushed and empty but Christopher Nolan managed to pull it off in Oppenheimer. Sadly, it seems as though this Barbie/Oppenheimer scheme Hollywood pulled to get us all back in the theater to see these movies (at least from my perspective) failed. Oppenheimer's only shred of decency is it's use of sound and some scenes cinematography. Outside of that this movie is not worth seeing in theaters.

This movie was supposed to be Christopher Nolan's crowning achievement as a director and instead is an unintelligible mess because he still apparently refuses to have a decent dialog track. The entire movie is marred by muddy dialog and requires so much concentration to understand that you can't even enjoy it. It has to be one of the worst theatrical experiences I've had in recent memory, I'd have expected it to be a technical issue it was so bad but was told by the staff at the theater this was just the way it is. Since it is a Christopher Nolan picture, I'm not surprised. He's had similar issues in the past most recently with Tenant where, according to interviews with Nolan, he intentionally covered up dialog. I had to watch it with subtitles at home just to figure out what was going on.

Review_Title: Waste of time this is boring movie
Review: The film is a dull and tedious affair, with no sense of drama, emotion or insight. Nolan's direction is uninspired and bland, relying on clichés and exposition to tell a story that has been told better before. The cast is wasted, with no chemistry or charisma. The film is also too long, dragging on for nearly three hours, with no tension or excitement. People were literally sleeping in the hall, and I don't blame them. Oppenheimer is a disappointing and boring film that does not do justice to its subject or its audience. It is a waste of time and money. I give it one star out of five. I regret wasting my time.

There are two types of biographical films that can be made: one is a dry, realistic history lesson, and the other is a more exciting, though somewhat fictionalized, biographically inspired story. Oppenheimer is the worst combination of these two films. Based on the story, he is much more like Icarus than Prometheus, as he rose so high in his scientific career only to be burnt in political struggles.

Review_Title: He never even left his tent! (... would be a whatif)
Review: Much like in Interstellar, at the most crucial moment Nolan's movie is fully dependent on false realities (station axis of rotation, not the black hole). In Oppenheimer they had not found any story with flesh in it, unless they did the following:

Review_Title: Delete this movie - not worth it
Review: This film should not exist: bad storytelling, awful casting and boring concept. I have a degree in physics and I like long deep movies, but this movie is nonsense. Story could be told in 15 mins, not 3 hours. Wasted my time on 50 identical man in old hats arguing about nothing in desert. It is like a bad documentary. How did you spend that amount money on this? Maybe if you are a fan of Oppenheimer's life, you can find this movie interesting. And everybody from the movie crew is faking successful start - I am sure all of them are laughing at the audience who have to watch this movie for 3 hours. And I wish Christofer Nolan good luck on the next episode - "Oppenheimer 2: Oppy cannot decide what sauce to buy in supermarket" - it could be 4 hours. And "Oppenheimer 3: Oppy arguing with his neighbours" - ideally for 5 hours. Peace for all - I don't want to start a nuclear war in comments - just dropping a little thing :)

Review_Title: Nolan fan here - save your $25 bucks
Review: If you know absolutely zero about the history of atomic bombs you may get something out of it, but nothing that a documentary couldn't do better. Save your $25 you're not missing out. The last hour of the movie was so unnecessary and boring it left me thinking about other Nolan movies I'd rather be watching (prestige, memento, dunkirk, Batman, inception etc). This movie makes me think of the imitation game and how that movie did so many things well and how this movie didn't teach me anything new or leave me feeling any different when I think of this part of history. I would much rather see a new perspective included (native displacement to create los alamos, women in stem, how Oppenheimer lived rest of his days or his early life), would love to see more Olivia thirlby. I am a big fan of Nolan, but this fell short of all the hype. The music was unremarkable, didn't include any new perpectives, and was an hour too long focusing on characters that were uninteresting.

I'm disappointed with this movie I had gone to see this as part of the double feature and was excited. Christopher nolan never disappoints but he certainly did with this movie. To put it simply about an hour of this movie could have been shaved off there were parts in the film where nobody can hear what the character was saying due to some poor sound editing. Oppenheimer is fast paced in some scenes but is painfully slow in other scenes. The intimate scenes added nothing of value. This movie is overrated because big casts are in it thats all. Don't get me wrong I'm a huge fan of peaky blinders. This is just name tags attached its not genius and it certainly is not the best thing you will ever see. Once it reaches the big bang everything else in comparison seems bland. Just an average movie at best and its too long. Don't bother wasting your time.

A Film of 3 hours that somehow uses fast cuts the entire way through? Yep. Music all the way through? Yep. Just an overall loud soundtrack that had people put in earplugs around me? Yep. Let's just say it can be a little bit exhausting. At the same time, I can't help but feel like it could have been a better film had it been narrowed into 2 instead of 3 hours. It seems like it just contains too much information and overuse of dialogue to really keep you in your seat. Some of the characters just feel bland and emotionless. But maybe that's the way Nolan wanted it to be? That being said, it obviously has fantastic camera work, a great soundtrack and a couple minutes that were well done ( the speech scene and explosion). I just don't know if I could commit 3 hours of my life to watching it a second time...

I thought the movie was overall okay, obviously the cinematography was beautiful and the acting was great. I think the film was a bit ambitious and honestly way over-hyped. There were a lot of story lines that seemed unnecessary to include and definitely could've been shortened down. It was a little hard to follow at some points, and they mumbled a lot with very background music that was louder than the dialogue so sometimes I got lost, everyone in my group had the same complaint. The actual bomb scene as well was just extremely overhyped; that was probably the quietest part of the movie. Cillian Murphy did a great job. Some characters also just very random. It was almost like having a million little 15 second cameos of big faces. Lot's of unnecessary parts. Overall, though it was decent.

Aside from the sound design which was good, nothing here was really revolutionary. The mere length and drawn out dialogue made this film a snooze fest; the last time I wanted to leave the theater or just close my eyes was at the showing of the latest Matrix.

One of the most excruciatingly boring films I have seen in a long time. No stakes, no dramatic tension, no investment in the characters. Just endless dry dialogue often overlaid with very loud music so it was hard to even hear what was being said a lot of the time. I fell asleep and was unfortunate enough to wake up again with still 2 of the 3 hours to go. If I hadn't been there with my family I would have left. Christopher Nolan seemed more intent on proving his own intelligence than being a good storyteller. The messing around with the chronology was an example of this, as for me it detracted from the story rather than enhancing it. A very important and potentially gripping subject but this film did not do it justice at all in my opinion.
I don't see how this movie could have possibly gotten such a high average score.

So boring. Really, really boring. My 21 son said he liked it but I think he must be lying. A couple of times I got excited and thought the movie was starting only to be disappointed and settle back into boredom again. One positive about this movie would be that if it existed during WW2 the mere threat of having to sit through 3 hours of it would be enough torture for even the bravest enemy to surrender all their secrets. The allies could have won the war a lot quicker with this movie. Sitting through 3 hours of it made me feel like I should have been awarded the highest medal available to a civilian. I looked for the exit a few times but bravely I continued on. One thing I will say is that the acting is good, it's just the move that's bad.
"Oppenheimer," Nolan's new film, is 4 stars maximum. And Cillian Murphy doesn't save the situation, only constantly widening his eyes in close-ups.

Review_Title: Wish I could get these 3 hours of my life back
Review: I'm a movie buff. I love quality storytelling and Character development. This movie had none of these qualities. It was laden with music & sounds that were way too loud and completely distracting. Even to the point where, when you wanted to care about a character, you couldn't because the constant noise distracts. The acting and cinematography was good but if you don't know the story of Oppenheimer you will not understand. I recommend watching a biography of his life first so you can get a sense of what happened. This movie only touches on what actually happened. It's more of a courtroom drama..

This was such a disappointment. The movie was unnecessarily long for no reason and could have told the identical story with the same, if not better, impact in an hour less. It was generally just boring and not engaging. Full of old white men just talking and talking with little or nothing to say. The only two females in the film feel like token women with no personality or story other than 'mistresses'. The black and white felt gimmicky and made an already drab and boring film even more dull.

This movie cramped too much story, even it's 3 hour run time is still not enough. It rushed every single scene with dialogues, dialoges, boom, moved on to the next scene, dialogues, next scene, boom, next scene, without letting the audience absorb or process the scene.

Review_Title: Great cast. Good acting. Editing and soundtrack was horrendous.
Review: Overall I think this was a good film.

Review_Title: Boring and deceiving, stay away from Biopic's Nolan.
Review: The trailers for this film leaned way too much into Robert Oppenheimer's atomic bomb phase, where as this film actually only focuses on it for about an hour or so. Despite being a well acted, well visualized, and well adapted or faithfully adapted story; this is still a movie!! And you need to give the audience a reason to care. Oppenheimer as an individual is a boring and immoral lead, and his supporting characters aren't any better, or interesting for that matter. I feel like this should be a glorified documentary instead of a film, slap biopic on it if you want but unless your a science or history whiz this is a hard film to get invested in.

Review_Title: Just tell the story, for God's sake
Review: Oppenheimer was craptastic. It was a mess. 2 out of 10 stars. People who give it a 10 are sheep. Maybe they just like the visuals. Those were pretty good. But they don't save the movie.

I just watched the movie yesterday and I can barely remember anything already because of how boring the whole thing was. Oppie's character was way too flat as I always feared it would be ever since the Cillian Murphy was announced. Yes, Nolan released some great movies throughout his career but his lack of natural skill when it comes to emotional intelligence and intimacy was always evident and it really shows and bothers this time. As someone who's deeply interested in science and its rapid development in the 20th century, the film seemed too dull and uneventful to me, even the way it dove into racial issues fell flat and seemed artificial.

Review_Title: Quietly fizzles and peters out rather than providing any kind of explosion
Review: Unfortunately for me this film was a total failure.

Review_Title: Not relevant to our part of the world
Review: I watched this 3 hour long movie which was mostly dialogue based with some very stunning cinematic moments. I felt the last hour was a stretch that could've been wrapped in half the time. Obviously the movie is relevant to regions of the world that were involved in WWII and revolves around an American figure who was able to produce the atomic bomb in remarkably record time. The controversies that surround his carrier and personal life was the center of this movie. I walked out feeling not being able to relate to most of it, except for the impact of his discovery on the nuclear proliferation in our current times.

Review_Title: Too long, too talky, yet interesting
Review: I just saw this late this afternoon in Astoria Queens, NY. Here are some observations:

Review_Title: Despite a 1 mile Blast radius, this film still misses.
Review: As a die hard Nolan fan this film missed hard.
Title: Oppenheimer - A Misguided Fusion of Themes [⭐]
Story is slow, characters are randomly referred to by partial names at different points (randomly referred to by first same, or last name on it's own).

I really wanted to love this movie because I am a history buff and I wanted to see the story behind the bomb, and in a way I did get the story behind the bomb, but in a very confusing and boring way. The movie kept jumping around between time periods before the war and after the war, showing all kinds of scenes out of sequence, which if done right can be very effective, but in this movie it was done wrong, very wrong. A simple "1939" on the screen would've made things clear, but I guess we're just supposed to know. Even at the end of this three hour long marathon I was still confused about many of the scenes, and it wasn't just about the time periods, but the dialogue itself was confusing. Half the time I didn't know what or who they were talking about, and the last hour, after the bomb exploded, was not only boring and confusing, but also entirely pointless and the movie would've been better without it. In addition, they added in these scenes, presumably for dramatic effect, that were intended to show the character's emotions or thought process at the time, showing us what he was feeling but was not actually happening, and that too missed the mark for me. Much of it was just awkward and annoying. It wasn't all bad. The acting was very good, and some of the scenes were very powerful, but overall I'm still very disappointed in this movie. It could've been so much more entertaining.

Review_Title: If you're a Nolan fan. don't watch this movie.
Review: I was so excited to watch this movie. My dream shattered and it's one of the most boring movie. First flop of Christopher Nolan.

I was so very bored. They should have made 2 movies the making and detonation of the bomb and the persecution of Oppenheimer I would not see either. A plethora of dialogue that really did not interest me, however there was obviously much research done on this story so if you are a fan of government conspiracy, physics, math and endless discussions then maybe it's for you. The character of Kitty was just annoying, her 4th marriage, drank like a fish, couldn't handle being a parent almost giving up her child and then proceeded to have another, allowed her husband to cheat I just wanted to slap some sense into her. I definitely would have rather watched this at home so I could fall asleep in the comfort of my own house.
Oppenheimers Snoozefest

Review_Title: Should have been on History Channel, not Cineworld
Review: I love Christopher Nolan films normally. Usually very thought-provoking, mind-bending stuff. But this was just a non-story with an overall "moral to the story" that the atom / h-bomb has led us on a path that could destroy the world.... yep. I think everyone knows this already. So it became a political / scientific story with very little drama or action. Very disappointed.

The trailer and promotions of the movie seem to be about Manhattan project but on contrary it has too many sub plots pre and post Manhattan project. The political drama aspect explored in the movie remain very superficial and don't really grip the viewer.

Too long, too much boring dialogue. There is more than an hour of film left. They forgot the primary objective of cinema, which is to entertain, and they got lost in cinematography, editing, sound, etc. How is it possible to make a movie about the father of the boring atomic bomb? The first hour and a half is so heavy. Unintelligible dialogues. Scientists sitting at the table boring us to infinity. The Florence Pugh part is so inconsequential. Luckily the last half hour with a brilliant Robert Downey Jr. The movie was better. Best: Robert Downey Jr. Worst: Overrated Everything. We need better stories.

This might be a controversial opinion, I thought the movie was boring, I felt this movie could have been a 30 minute YouTube documentary than 3 hours feature film. I felt the sound design was lazy. I was a bit underwhelmed by it.
Is it a movie about the Manhattan project?

Review_Title: An Accurate Yet Underwhelming Depiction. It was like Reading a Book
Review: Oppenheimer" stays true to the life of the renowned physicist, but unfortunately, it falls short in delivering an engaging cinematic experience. The movie is incredibly fast paced in terms of the information it throws at you, and it never slows down. If you tune out for more than a minute, you'll be lost for the rest of the movie.

The whole movie builds up to the final scene being a propaganda message about mankind destroying itself with the bomb. We have had nukes for over 50 years and has not happened. Hollywood should pull its head out of its asd and just stick to storytelling. So sick of every movie turning into propaganda, gone are the days of Hollywood putting out anything worth watching. I am done watching anything on release day. I will want to hear a review of a film before going to watch it from now on. On the upside at least it accurately portrayed how self serving narcissists step on anyone they can to get a position of government power.
Cillian Murphy acting is exceptional really , but i found the movie is so long and boring at several levels. This movie could make a great documentary movie really.

Review_Title: Not for me, would kindly never watch this again.
Review:
The movie itself: casting, Cinematography, soundtrack- all that was good. As an art-form, yes it was good. However, probably at my fault to watch it, it's a daughting, terrifying and uncomfortable. Most people will say that's the point, but I had no warning how distressing this movie would be. Yes I know , again, "it's a movie about a bomb, what do you expect", well
I didn't know how deep this shit would go and how they would interpret certain scenes.

Any art is a kind of medium that conveys an exciting idea in a mind to millions of minds. And if part of this attempt is successful, it would be a great masterpiece of art. Nolan has failed to convey that excitement since "Tenet," and Oppenheimer has also clearly fizzled out in that endeavor. The most disappointing aspect is the screenplay, which will not give you a sense of excitement at any point as the movie progresses.

Review_Title: Average at it's best and infuriating at it's worst
Review: The story was great, we got a typical nolan screenplay cillian murphy, RDJ and matt damon acted brilliantly. The other stars like emily blunt were wasted they could have gotten more screen presence. Personally I think some scenes should be better especially Oppenheimer's university days and his mental health. The VFX was simply stunning,Nolan was not kidding when he said that he is gonna detonate a real bomb. The pace was giod but some scenes felt rushed especially the beginning. I like the fact that Nolan did not glorify the main character or make him likeable like most biopic directors tend to do. The ending was simply superb. Overall this is not Nolan's best movie but arguably one of his movies to be remembered. Now, coming to the point why I gave it 1 instead of a 8 is because of one scene. Yes it is the bhagavad gita scene. I don't know if Nolan wanted to convey something by keeping a holy book in midst of a sex scene or just wanted to do introduce bhagavad gita and he did not care about the significance of the book, be it any reason keeping a holy book of a religion in a sex scene and not less near a women's private parts is just not accepatable and is disrespectful to the religion. Just imagine if it was bible instead of bhagavad gita would'nt it be mortifying. The director and actor should respond to this or delete the scene from the movie itself.

Review_Title: Visually stunning great acting but so boring and complicated for a large chunk of audience
Review: I was so excited to see this movie since I am a big Nolan and Murphy fan, but I am hugely disappointed, the movie was too long and boring most of the times, they just glorified the act of making and dropping bombs(same usa propoganda).

I guess Hollywood just can't make movies anymore without ear shattering noise. This movie was very noisy all the way through. Even when there was no purpose for the noise, it was there. There is one scene where the atomic bomb is detonated in NM. Obviously it is consistent with the theme of the movie for it to be noisy.
I went to see this movie without any expectations and also hoping it was something different.
I went to the theater with very high expectations, but sadly enough they were not met. Especially from Christopher Nolan I would have expected something better.

Review_Title: If you're looking for thought provoking cinema, this isn't it.
Review: This film has everything laid out. I have been looking forward to it for months. Like others, Nolan is one of my favorite directors, nay, probably my favorite director of all time. All the critics raved about this film. The trailer made it look like something that I could take my kids to for the discussion I expected we would have afterward - even if I had to cover their eyes during the nude scenes. I was expecting to come out of this picture blown away and I even paid $25 to see it with a friend in IMAX first just to double check it was tween friendly enough. Well, I am sorry to say it was an enormous let down. Was it a decent flick? Sure. The cinematography was good, the story is interesting kind of, but let's be real here, Oppenheimer himself is not the interesting part of the story, the bomb is. The fact that you have to murder tens of thousands of people in order to save tens of thousands more. What the bomb does to people who aren't vaporized when it goes off. This was just barely touched on in the film. There are no scenes of mathematicians working feverishly, no real feeling of how large of a project this must have really been. There are snippets of things here and there about the project, but this really is JUST A BIOPIC of Oppenheimer. And somewhat of this Strauss guy that history pretty much has forgotten. And truth be told, none of it was really that interesting to me. Feynman would have made a much more interesting film, IMO. So, was it OK? Yeah, it was OK. Am I glad I spent $25 to see this in the theater? Nope. This is a rental, if you have nothing better to watch. But do yourself a favor, go get The Dark Knight or Interstellar and watch that again - you'll be happier in the end. If you want something kind of along the same vein that's a better movie, see The Imitation Game. If you are looking for.a thought provoking movie, watch The Fog of War.

By the hour and a half mark I was fighting to stay awake, this film is over hyped and convoluted. A good portion of it is just unnecessarily loud sounds for no reason and people yelling at each other. The entire thing felt like a poorly put together indie film festival entry. The explosion that was so hyped up was mediocre at best, I heard it wasn't cgi and that I should be impressed by it but that was not the case. I goto movies in theatre to be wowed, I don't care if it's cgi or 'real' as long as it's impressive and well done.

Review_Title: Disrespect with Hindu cultural & bhagwad Geeta ji.
Review: Really? Guys you really believe that? IS Oppenheimer Understood bhagwad geeta?& Accept with pure heart? No..he used Bhagwad geeta as Tool kit. & to get over regrets & guilt. & christopher nolan bloody conservative you made it intentionally bcz all western conservatives,hate hindusam & hindu culture. You shown bhagwad geeta in intimate scenes! I appreciate christopher nolan in technical way. But your thinking about as it s very wrong. Narayan hari. I offer my obeisances to the cowherd boy who holds the cow's garden and who is in the form of a cowherd boy.

Overall, I liked Oppenheimer. But the length and 'Adult Themed' rating brought if from a near 10 to a 6. You're captivated by a complicated genius. He ended WW II earlier with the nuke, yet he knew the international stage could end the World. He was top-notch physistist, but he cheated on his wife.

Exaltation of the character, where other physicists of greater importance such as Einstein or Heisenberg remain in the background. The references to Hiroshima and Nagasaki are very light and the effects of the explosion on the Japanese civilian population are not described at all. Made-in-USA product.

When I walked out of the theater after watching 'Oppenheimer' my soul was profoundly shaken, shaken by such a touching theme, such profound characters, and the fact that such a muddy period in history could be portrayed so shallow and contrived by Nolan.

Review_Title: Could have been Oscar worthy... But the sub plots made it an Atomic fail
Review: I went to see this movie because I'm Irish and think Cillian Murphy is amazing. I had no idea what the movie was about but wanted to support an Irish actor. I was really impressed by his unfailing acting ability (which has been flawless since the beginning of his public Career), Emily blunt also was brilliant and the other actors - but the writing and script structure was woeful.

Review_Title: The definition of waste of time
Review: It was an incredibly boring with a story that's 98% dialogue that leads almost nowhere. It's very hard to follow because they fail to grab your attention enough to care about any of the characters or what's going on in the film.
This movie pretentiously tries to be intellectual and intelligently made. However, it was over done. It is a struggle to not fall asleep during this film.

Review_Title: What a mess did I just watch for 3 hours
Review: As an admirer of Nolan's work, I am very disappointed. First of all, the soundtrack sucks, it's just random "bombing" sounds that hardly fit in the movie. You can tell it's not Hans Zimmer. Second, it is an extremely confusing movie. It's as if the director had a million different ideas and just mixed them up together in a disorganized, completely random way. The timeline of the scenes is very random and hard to follow. Also, 3 hours was too long and after 2h I was bored. I feel like I just threw away 3h of my life. This movie is a very boring, confusing and soulless mess. I felt no emotion whatsoever from the movie, unlike with Nolan's other works. I wish it was more organized and concise.

Never watching it again though and it was too long
Murphy was great, RDJ was boring, best scenes were the ones with Albert

Review_Title: Feels like watching a three-hour-long film trailer
Review: Capturing a wide array of historic events, characters and themes into one all-encompassing movie proves to be a difficult challenge for any director, and this one is no different.
The first two hours are fine. By the final hour, the time period had jumped so many times that I lost the plot. As a result, after three hours, we still don't have a sense of who Oppenheimer was.
Hell NO.
Like other reviews, I was really looking forward to watching this movie. The trailer looked great, there was a fantastic lineup of actors and the plot was an important part of our history.

Review_Title: Your typical world war movie but it's much more longer
Review: Just like I assumed, it's another conventional World War II film. The fascist and national socialist groups are the bad guys, while the Communists are the good guys, and we need to aid a specific group of individuals.

Review_Title: Incredibly boring, we walked out before the end
Review: This film has a few exciting elements, but it is two hours too long. Most of it is just uninteresting talk of boring men. We expected a masterpiece because of the reviews, but definitely wouldnt recommend. There is a clip out there of oppenheimer doing the 'i am become death, destroyer of worlds' wich truly captivates the darkness of the reality he lived and created. This film does not create anything more profound than this clip to be seen on youtube or wherever online. It said it took three hours, but it felt like six. I wouldn't spend time kf money on it looking back. I hope others enjoy it better.

Review_Title: What a waste of three hours
Review: I didn't like this movie.

Review_Title: A very long trailer! That's all!
Review: A huge waste of effort, money and most importantly fine acting! The way the film was cut and moved from one scene to another through different timelines could have been a million times better! It was a good idea but very poorly executed even the music was exaggerated in some scenes, the build up to the climax and anti climax was awful.

If i could give zero i would. Boring, long and waste of money. I was expecting more about how was the bomb designed and how he actually did. But nothing. I understand more from Wikipedia. I'm afraid the film "Oppenheimer" fell flat in more than a few areas. The most noticeable issue was the pacing; the movie was an exhausting, drawn-out affair that rarely managed to hold my interest. Rather than focusing on the most poignant parts of Oppenheimer's life and work, it was bogged down in needless minutiae.

The new film 'Oppenheimer' by Christopher Nolan premiered in big-screen cinemas worldwide. The biopic by the director, starring Cillian Murphy, has drawn a lot of attention in India as well, particularly for bringing up the sacred text Bhagavad Gita.

Well I guess if you're a person that just hates documentaries and will never watch them on tv (like my wife) this film is an excellent opportunity to learn a thing or two about the origins of the A-bomb. The film is long(about 3 hours), slow paced and filled with political jargon but visual effects and great acting will keep you awake.

The first hour of this film in particular has every cliché you've ever seen in a biographical movie come up again and again. What I found most annoying is this assumption that the audience can never understand any of the science involved in the story, so the makers substitute writing frantically on blackboards, cutting to sparks on a black screen, and the character being described as "brilliant genius", presumably because he can see the sparks whereas other people can't. Without any sort of context, the science is a meaningless abstract reference and the real story is lost. As for Cillian Murphy, he could have had a great career as a half forward for Nemo Rangers if he'd played his cards right and now look at him- sitting on an armchair stark naked in front of millions of people like an eejit.

Review_Title: The original was way better and more accurate
Review: The original was more about the making of the bomb. This movie left out a major part of the movie. Watch the original movie first. Fat man and little boy. I worked with a son of a man that actually worked on the Manhattan project. The acting in this version was good but the story line was not. Please everyone watch the original which most people never heard of. I can't say this enough watch the original I mentioned I think it was made in 1989. Thank you. I hope more people watch the original because of my post. I would never watch this movie again.

Review_Title: This Movie insulted the Gita and our civilization
Review: In this film, the scene where he is shown to be having sex and reading the Gita is totally unwarranted. It is an insult to the Gita and our civilization.

With the horribly boring special effects and the stupid shuttering noises movie after movie, you think the director would try something new after all these years. The story is interesting enough but it amazes me that they put so much rubbish into the film. From the idiotic quasi-sex scenes to the over-saturated but oversimplified scholarly talk, the director lost a moment to provide an accurate and fully matured documentary and instead gives us
THREE HOURS of absolute boredom. Really don't understand how people rate this so highly. The amount of money they dump into Hollywood these days is sad.

Review_Title: Boring and feels cheap. Openheeimer is a bomb.
Review: This movie is a long drag, worst film made from Master and Commander.

Review_Title: Insulting a philosophical holy book is not entertainment
Review: Trying to insult the Bagavat Gita by reading it in the middle of a sex screen shows contempt and hatred to Hinduism (though bagavat Gita is a not a religious text (more a philosophicaltest), the intent in the movie seems religious ). The dirty mindset of the maker is obvious and the purpose of movie has shifted from entertainment to brewing hatred towards particular sect of humanity. Either the makers should apologize or the movie should be banned in my opinion.

Review_Title: Not worth it, you will know it is just a hype
Review: Hello...I did not watched it in IMAX cause in my city it wasn't available. But I had some better hope in respect of visuals and a powerful story. 2 mins of explosion was great but visuals weren't so impressive after and before that, I mean nothing unusual and story ah..a very very very ordinary story. A very normal story and the plot we have seen many times in many movies.

Review_Title: Bomb was nice, but insult of bhagwad gita
Review:
Regarding Christopher Nolan,
He has insulted the Bhagavad Gita by depicting it in an inappropriate scene related to intercourse. The Bhagavad Gita is considered a holy book in Hinduism, and it should not have been portrayed in such a manner. This depiction is a disrespect to the sacredness of the Gita. Even though openhimer have taken inspiration from the Gita, there was no need to include it in that particular scene.

I was disappointed in this Nolan movie because it's such a departure from his string of intense and cerebral movies. It's Mostly about politics during the time period. Great acting by all the cast but it has completely unnecessary soft porn that ruins the story line. Don't bring young kids! Good stuff includes the history of the creation of the bomb and how Oppy struggled with the consequences once it was built. The story line about how Strauss was involved was very interesting. I would bet that very few people know about his struggles after the WWII ended. This is a long one so get comfortable.

Review_Title: A movie twisted by the duality of it's being. Parts are great. Parts are unnecessary.
Review: Nolan needs to be reeled in by the people around him.

Movie was too long. Lot of effort went into the production of this film though. Characters were well represented. Musical score was well done. Dialogue was overbearing. Expected the movie plot to include the bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Really exhausting trying to follow all of the names and characters throughout the movie. I wouldn't put it in the top 250 of all time though. It would have been a lot more effective if it were shortened and some of the scenes were deleted. It is good to get back to better produced and directed movies after having gone through the Covid era. Yet, I probably won't watch this one again.

When I first heard about the film "Oppenheimer," I was genuinely excited. The subject matter, exploring the life and contributions of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the father of the atomic bomb, seemed like a promising premise. However, my enthusiasm quickly turned into disappointment as I endured what can only be described as a dull and misguided cinematic experience.

I saw the film at a movie theater with hubby and friends. We are all over age 70. We could not understand 90 percent of the dialog because the soundtrack music was so loud. Our friends were totally bored. Hubby and I plan to give the movie another try when we can view it with closed captioning. The scenes with the hearing to remove Oppenheimer's security clearance were over-long and over acted. The constant switching between black and white and color was confusing. The senate hearing to approve Strauss's nomination was in black and white and the rest was in color. We all found the constant switching back and forth tedious. The near constant super facial close-ups of Robert Downey Jr.s face were a bit much, especially in black and white, and on a big screen. Not a film I would add to my collection.
The whole film can simply be directed by even a high school ,non-professional educated, camera handler.

Review_Title: Not great, not terrible...still a lot worse than the expectation
Review: Adding my thoughts while the experience is fresh.

Contrary to Christopher Nolan's advice, the "ideal" way to watch this movie is in a concrete bunker with gun range headphones. It is absolutely too load to watch. As a veteran of Hendrix, Who, Stones, and Pink Floyd, I left after 10 minutes and got my money back. Thank goodness I didn't travel to one of the 30 theaters on the PLANET, that have the full IMAX experience. Frankly, while the visuals of New Mexico are wonderfully done, the story itself did not need that film quality. But, I'm sure the Hollywood crowd will applaud and award an Oscar that I see as blatantly bought. It's really no different that the campaigns companies put on to drum up support at Oscar time.
Nolan at this point is a kid, who was given a toy and wants to play with it day and night.
..about one of the most important persons in human history.

Review_Title: Oppenheimer: A Dud Of Historical Fiction
Review: This film prominently features highly regarded male actors, accompanied by a limited presence of esteemed actresses such as Florence Pugh and Emily Blunt, who portray characters that align with Christopher Nolan's tendency for charismatic yet volatile female roles.
Love the story but terribly directed and this story was all over the place.

Review_Title: Life of oppenheimer or politics of oppenheimer
Review: I had high hopes But it was over. I think it doesn't give much about Oppenheimer's personal life, but a lot about his political life. For which I find the movie boring. And it would have been better if the movie had ended sooner rather than having an episode about politics at the end of the movie.

The movie was fail to educate people about the process of the atomic bomb, where the source, how it done. A single osciloscope? Come on. Even there was no B-29. Nolan did not want CGI? Thats why it make this move cheap. Even the transporting of the ore has movie, the ship that carry that bomb has a single movie, process dropping it has a movie, I expect movie like unbroken (CGI? Yes but clean)
You know what they use to picture the uranium? Marbels, hahaha. And you know what the bomb was lego. As I know the bomb was solid iron.
Oppenheimer was a really cool music video! A bit long though. Maybe it just needed an intermission or something.

The title speaks for itself. I was very much looking forward to this movie. It took only 45 minutes for me to be ready to walk out. The only reason I stayed was the hope for the movie to get better or at least progressively come close to expectations. What we got was a directors personal interpretation and failed attempt at "art" that became painful to witness. A confusing plot that even at the end gave little insight to what was trying to be portrayed. This film tried so hard to be the Citizen Kane of it's time. This attempt fell far short of everyone's expectations at the theater. A quarter of the movie was bearable and the rest, downright disappointing. The whole movie is fixated on telling a confusing story of 2 peoples perspectives of events along with a personal vendetta, and a kangaroo Court. Oh, and I think at one point they actually talked about making a nuclear bomb or something but that wasn't the main story line to what the film was about. At the end of the movie I heard a fellow moviegoer say "What did I just watch". This film took 3 hours of my life I will never get back, Although it's probably going to win an Oscar.

Review_Title: Hearing loss after 5 minutes of previews in Imax
Review: Went to see oppenheimer imax this morning, couldn't make it through 5 minutes of the previews because I thought my ear drums were going to rupture from the dangerously loud level of sound. Even previews of people just talking was causing me hearing damage I didn't want to wait for oppenheimer to start and find out what a nuke sounds like and burst my ear drums. This was the stupidest thing ever, there is no reason to play a movie at that volume, I couldn't even tell you a single preview I saw because I was just thinking about how loud it was and the hearing damage it was causing. 6 hours later now and my hearing is still diminished because of 5 minutes of this. Shame on you Imax, I hope this doesn't cause permanent hearing loss.

Had it not been for the nudity, I would have loved this movie. So disappointed in the decision to lower such standards for trashy scenes. We can understand that people are nude without actually having to view it. Several of us saw the movie together and agreed the nudity was completely uncalled for. Don't we get enough of society trying to shove that junk down our throats? Just adding to the problem of too many hormones running around to the point of affecting children and all the human trafficking problems. So disappointed in this film and it's director and producers. It could have been such an amazing film.

"Openheimer" was meant to be a captivating exploration of J. Robert Oppenheimer's life and the atomic bomb's development. Unfortunately, it fell far short of expectations. This is not a movie for fans of Interstellar or Inception. This is a very long and very boring movie about a guy in a suit who figured out how to kill other people in an spectacular way. The amount of meetings and discussions going on reminds me of corporate calls on teams. Nolan jumps around timelines. Getting caught up in this maze is difficult and tiring. It was a terrible movie. In the end I left the cinema after two hours.

Review_Title: Too loud, confusing; Nolan should've used CGI to do the "big event" to make it accurate..
Review:
First off, I like Nolan's movies to varying degrees. My favorite is the Batman trilogy, although I do fast-forward through the end of movie 1 (if I recall), as it's too violent. As for this movie:
First, in the coming attractions, it had the words "we saved (or we're saving) a million soldier's lives" and from what I remember, that comment wasn't in the movie (and it's important to understand in the context of bomb). Also, many times I couldn't understand the dialouge because the background music/noise was too loud and/or the words sounded distorted. I ended up going to the lobby and they did turn the volume down a little (they said they couldn't turn it down any further - were they under orders to have it only at a certain sound volume level?). I was totally confused about all the Washington D. C. hearings. Why SO MUCH TIME taken on this and the whole "commie"/"noncommie" stuff? Are there those in the audience who DIDN'T know that creating the first nuclear bomb and dropping it on Japan was very a controversial thing and that at the tiime we had a communist threat too? Was the Downey character in the movie just to provide an antagonist? I twice looked at my phone to see the time and midway through, I walked to the lobby for a break. Oh, and Nolan should've used special affects for the "big event". Everyone knows that an A-bomb has a very distinct mushroom cloud.

Oppenheimer, directed by Christopher Nolan, is a film that falls disappointingly short of its potential. While it attempts to delve into the intriguing life and contributions of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the renowned physicist and key figure in the development of the atomic bomb, the execution of the film leaves much to be desired. Here are a few reasons why Oppenheimer fails to deliver on its promise.

Firstly i would like to say i am not being harsh. I am being completely honest and with that, i think this movie was extremely dull and boring. I should've researched it before hand because i didn't know how dragged out and boring the plot was going to be. It was a type of movie where you have to have a high attention span & just have to be a smart person in general. The movie is based around science & history but the wording and everything about it just wasn't it. I found myself dozing off multiple times and if i'm being completely honest the only part i understood about that movie is when they actually set off the atomic bomb. Other than that it was shocking😂😂😂

Review_Title: Overall okay movie but ratings are patriotic
Review:
Boring movie
Don't recommend.
This is a very BORING political trial / commission hearing.

I simply can't like this movie. It wants to say way too much and says way too little about way too many things. It can't decide what it wants to be, so it's not really anything - not just for the viewer, but for the creator. And that's a problem. It's not good as a biopic: there are serious historical flaws in the story, which irritated me. I'm a huge fan of John von Neumann... anyone, who knows who he was understands why I mention him. As a drama? The movie can't decide the centre of the drama. It's too weak as a spy-story, too weak as a political drama, too weak as a personal drama. Not one aspect is worked out to carry the film. The strongest aspect was how many times in american history the "what you did 20 years ago is more important than who you become and what your expertese is" ruined people's lives. Or at least was used as a political rethoric against opponents. And I appreciated that, hence the 5 points. As a moral/personal evolution the moral conflict isn't built up, the "evolution of a scientist" dies away halfway and doesn't really connect with the "organizer scientist". The "science should or should not have moral boundaries" isn't worked out and built up, just comes and goes without a purpose. The only detactable personal evolution is the "man of future becomes the man of past", but somehow that remains too weak in the end, too. So the movie falls apart and not even the brilliant actors and the massively impressive explosion scene can hold it together.

Yes, it is a very average movie but hyped by the audience. Nolan fans have rated movie very well because they experienced the placebo effect. The movie is nothing special. I must acknowledge that the acting of every actor in the movie is top-notch. What I felt was bad, is the way storyline was presented; nothing creative was tried. Also, the movie is very dialogue intensive. At the end of the movie, I just felt that a lot of facts were poured into my head. Direction is slightly above average. From the perspective of students persuing science in graduation, the movie doesn't have much part of science; they could have showed how great Oppenheimer was in terms of his academic achievements and what all he did, instead, they choose to just say in a one-liner through dialogues!!!

Review_Title: Historically important, very well made, but incredibly boring.
Review: After the media hype I had half a hope this movie might be gripping. I was entirely wrong. If I'm not mistaken, I think I saw the word 'action' used in relation to this, If I did then it's laughable. So much God damned talking!!! Never ending talking. The only action part was a nuclear explosion but even that was a bit disappointing for me. I would have expected that in 2023 the very latest sound processing tools would have truly shook the cinema, that the blast was the blast to end all fictional blasts in the history of blasts. But no such thing. Just a bunch of test footage I'm sure Iv seen somewhere before. I do not understand how this film is languishing at the top of this list? Surely somebody paid somebody to make that happen? That includes the 8.6 rating too.

As much as I love Christopher Nolan but this is easily the worst movie directed by him. I was expecting something similar to inception based on the hype given before releasing the movie. The only thing that I love about the movie is how Cillian Murphy represented the character very well and his role was acted perfectly well. On the other hand, the supporting actors/actresses were lost in this movie. They weren't given a chance to show their full potential. And i truly hate when Hollywood glorify the United States name in their movies as though whatever was done is good to mankind. Also, I found it extremely disrespectful for the other countries such as Japan were it was victimized in this movie. Overall, the movie was extremely boring with so much non sense dialogues to prolong it and reach the 3-hour mark.

Review_Title: Pretty boring movie, could've just been an audiobook
Review: Start off by saying before watching the movie, I didn't even know the movie title was of the main character,, and I didn't even know who Christopher Nolan was or his work until after watching the movie and looking it up. Instead I had heard it's about a movie about war and supposedly a 'masterpiece'.
Absolute TRASH, total waste of time, save your money, go watch barbie, must be way better than this one.
I wish I didn't see this movie.

Review_Title: It is boring and does not live up to hype. Only the mid second half was good.
Review: Movie does not live up to the expectations. I watched it with great anticipation that it will be a fun mind blowing movie that lives up to the core of openhimer's life. To talk about the movie the build up upto the bomb test scene is amazing and the hype gets real, but the sound comes too late and kills the vibe. It was good to delay the sound but the director delayed it too much. Robert Downey Jr's character was amazing and his revelation as antagonist was terrifically amazing. Well his character only made the second half good, props to the writer! . when openhimer's character was being interrogated the hype was building up and died down at an instant which was a source of another disappointment. Worst thing about this movie was that unnecessary sex scene. It certainly seemed like the director wanted to reduce the significance of the holy scripture Bhagvad Geeta's significance from openhimer's life. He must have done it to not show himself as a Hinduism promoter. It was certainly the worst way possible. I have to say it was a waste of money. So I rate it 1 star. This movie is only running because of Christopher's reputation. So,Reducing 3 star will be the actual rating for this movie.

Review_Title: The film's message resonates Fermi's legacy demands recognition.
Review: The film proves engaging on a global level, even though some parts are tedious. However, it's truly senseless that the remarkable Enrico Fermi has received inadequate visibility. He embodies the crucial figure who provided fundamental guidance to all other characters, playing an essential role in the project's realization. For those who might not know, it's important to underline that Fermi is the inventor of the reactor, a contribution without which the achievement of atomic energy would have remained an unattainable goal, significantly altering the course of history. The film's message resonates-Fermi's legacy demands recognition.

Don't watch! Sheer wastage of money. Only lawyers might like this film. Christopher Nolan please retire gracefully than making mediocre films like these! Whatever was good was shown in the trailer nothing new. Switching between black and white was stupid. Was not hooked to it in the first few minutes. First two hours were really draggy and slow. Atomic explosion, has so much expectations from that shot, but it was just average. My nephew slept through the film (who has never done that till date).

Review_Title: Exclusion from Nolan's latest film (one perspective on Nolan's R-rating).
Review: Christopher Nolan used to be able to be counted on for delivering high quality, thought provoking, educated films that never ventured into the explicit (be it sex, nudity, or language). The majority of his previous films were standards of excellence, always looked forward to, and never required audiences to worry about what content they were about to see. I think many Hollywood professionals underestimate the amount of viewers who filter entertainment they see by their individual moral codes and consciences. Great storytelling (especially in writing) should be able to be portrayed without relying on the explicit. Would have loved to have been a Oppenheimer fan, but unfortunately Nolan has excluded viewers like myself from his latest film.

This very heavily marketed, promoted and hyped film was hugely disappointing. The acting is outstanding and there is some good writing, but it is riddled with unnecessary and ineffective narrative gimmicks and visuals of explosions, space, sub-atomic particles etc. They might have worked if used with better judgment and discernment, but they don't. They're just annoying and tiresome. Same goes for the heavy-handed and over the top score. I felt that most of this was in service of the director's ego rather than the film itself.
Oppenheimer starts switching between past, present and somewhere in between from the get go. As a result the first hour is a chaotic, weird paced struggle to get trough.
To be fair I had a bad seat stuck in the corner. Also, there was something with the audio in the film or theater. I couldn't make out parts of the dialog over the background/scene noise.

Review_Title: I was told I was seeing Barbie
Review:
I was told I was seeing the Barbie film tonight. Apparently my "friends" tricked me. I was about four hours into this when I said to myself "wow they not only made Ken super smart, but the focal point of this entire thing."
I have never heard him referred to anything besides "Ken", so I assumed he just had some sort of Nordic/Germanic/Jewish heritage that Matel didn't tell us about. Thought I'd see a lot more hot pink colors, but this sadly was mostly black and white or just close ups of the bright yellow sun. Not bad though.

Review_Title: Boring as hell, waste of time
Review: My first review ever. I'm a science savvy person. This was so boring movie. Thanks god there was a good internet signal and I had a sofa seat. I'm sorry for my wife who watched it with me. It was so f* slow, boring, jumping from topic to topic. It was so hard to understand for someone who didn't know the real story and science. Some facts like: the poisoned apple was presented with no context.

Review_Title: A Feature Film of a man Struggling with his Colleagues
Review: Christopher Nolan looks more like an indie director making movies in Hollywood. He breaks the traditional recipe of the blockbuster popcorn movie with a plot rather interested in breaking up the story of a WWII character, than in making a story of high intensity and drama, as is the type of Hollywood cinema. I'd say the movie is OKAY, but people and pop culture aren't ready for 3 hours of Oppenheimer getting in trouble for his "uncertain" communist party relation, and his bad vibes with his boss.

We are not Americans, so we had the advantage of not being familiar with the political intrigue surrounding the A-bomb story. We went in with high expectations, stimulated by the the M&M-frenzy (Media and Marketing).

Review_Title: An unpalatable, long and boring movie!
Review: An amalgamation of some scenes of different times and places!

Review_Title: Not what you would expected from a director of such calibre.
Review: Atomic breakthrough is not shown but kept behind the curtain, which only keeps you assuming of what happens actually happens from periodic conversations between scientists and etc. Doesn't show the horrors of atomic consequences. I wanted to see him being tormented emotionally after seeing what happened in Japan and etc. Deep political film, focusing on military mid WW2 and post WW2 drama typical pursuits of Americans after Russians/communists with it's deep paranoia which lingers till date. Oscar worthy by a lead actor but a let down overall, knowing Nolan this is second best after Tenet!!!!!
Can't get past the gratuitous nudity and sex. Give me one good reason for it in the conference room interrogation scene?

I rarely write a review ..but this time i couldn't resist staying a side without expelling my feeling after seeing the movie..i left the Sal in the mid of the movie...the movie is 3h i barley could sit & hold back in my seat for 1.5h..deadly boring..one of the very few movies that left the movie in the middle ...
Oppenheimer and the script in general is very stretched...the 1st 1.5h could summarize it into 10 min max....the development of the main characters very slow..and evolves meaningless crap love stories that doesn't contribute by anyway to the plot..
stay away & Save your 3h boring time awaiting you.
180minutes is just for conversation. No action at all. Slow pace like snail. If there is -ve Star rating, then i'll give it -ve. Its feels like forever to finish this movie.
When there was nothing left to sell in the cinema, they started to put forward the imax wave. Yes, they are right, after all, this is a commercial event.
Abysmal story telling, B tier visual effects and a failure to connect the audience to any of the characters.

Nolan is done. I just can't understand why people like this piece of 'history', full of dark, ugly, polotical setup. If Nolan likes it, fine, enjoy it yourself. Why do you spend 3 hours to torture audience with showing such ugly world with full of stupid politians?

Review_Title: Insulting Bhagavad Gita is Everything in this movie's negatives
Review: Acting, Production design is good but they gave too much hype for the movie since I expected good VFX such as in Interstellar, Inception, Tenet etc.

Review_Title: I am a Nolan fan but .....
Review: The movie's main issue is that it didn't need to be so complicated. Movies can be engaging without being confusing, like "The Godfather," "Shawshank Redemption," or "Million Dollar Baby." Another problem is that the movie drags on because it's too long and some parts feel slow.

Bla bla bla three hours of talking and talking and still more talking..............
A very long and very boring movie that did not touch on the Japanese or Soviet side......
Where is the bomb? How did they drop it? What happened before and after?

Long movies are not the problem, look how successful harry potter and avatar are. The issue is, this was basically a really long board meeting that lasted longer then Avatar the way of water. Somehow I feel like attending a legit real board meeting would have been more intresting then watching this. However it was very informative and the actors played their roles very well. If your not intrested in learning about the history of how the atomic bomb was created then you wouldn't enjoy watching this. 9/10 acting 7/10 runtime 6/10 plot and overall I feel like they executed an average of 7.5 to 8 of 10.

Cinematography in states is in crisis for decades and budget of $100M cannot fix it. Big, big lack of fresh ideas obviously want to be replaced by technology. The only idea is to full packets with money and to push academy to get another Oscar cause so much money was invested! Eventually the result is very poor. Screen play is terrible, overacting characters (Murphy as well), from the movie I could not figure out what was the biggest contribution and achievement of Dr Oppennheimer ? (what he was politician, spin doctor, PR, ....) The only reason i went to cinema to watch this movie I was bored with whole day rain. I regret every moment I spent in cinema. Eventually I would be better I stay in rain and breath fresh air.

Review_Title: A one small mistake can ruin the whole movie, history, character, energy ....
Review: Filmmakers bear a profound responsibility when employing elements of sacred literature in their works. Such material holds immense cultural and spiritual importance for millions, and any portrayal demands reverence and understanding. In delving into ancient scriptures, directors should approach the subject matter with a deep understanding or engage in meaningful discussions with experts to avoid unintended misrepresentations. One should not used content from popular and sacred scriptures whimsically. Even it's a common understanding to get a profound knowledge about it and then take suitable action.

Christopher Nolan's Oppenheimer is a sweeping, epic, and visually stunning film that tells the story of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the man who led the Manhattan Project to develop the atomic bomb. The film is long (nearly three hours) and complex, but it is also incredibly engrossing and thought-provoking.

Saw Oppenheimer in IMAX format. It's a decent enough biopic but itvsuffers from an unjustified grandiose directorial style. Nokan's insistence on film vs digital and penchant for unnecessary melodrama make it seem like more of a major work than it actually is. It's worth seeing, to be sure, but I think it's one of those overhyped productions that will be lost in the dusty film archive where pomposity goes to die.

Found it borning and confussing at times, but comes together in a full circle by the end. Found it to be to long and could have been shorter. Acting was amazing. Did not recognize some of the name actors until they showed some sort of mannerism. Based of a true story, I did find it interesting on historical events. We are always agaist other nations to be ahead and this was no different. I being 51, I took my dad and he was very pleased with everything and really enjoyed watching the movie. His comment was and that was history in a nut shell, and all the behind the sense I bet that still happens today.

Extremely boring and long movie. Thinking that this might be another Nolan marvel, but then it could not stand up to expectations. The first half of movie could have been finished within 45 mins and the second half i was expecting some action from WW2. But there were just names Hiroshima and Nagasaki etc. But nothing significant shown. The court room drama was too long, movie had some other famous actors yet it failed to create its mark. The needless romance lasting intermittently was equally useless.

The build up to the main event that everyone waits for is great. The SFX is fantastic. The music is fantastic. However the second Leg of the film is quite boring and pretty uninteresting. I would probably class the film in the lower end of nolan's films. The acting is however great, performances were probably some of the best. I've seen this year. Certain scenes that have been mentioned a lot in the media, I do agree are not necessary and had no impact on my experience of the film and it did feel out of place. Personally, I would not recommend this film to anyone and do not recommend this film to anyone unless you are a serious film buff who needs to watch all the movies that get released.

Oppenheimer is a long, slow-burning film that is not for everyone. The film is over three hours long, and it can be quite dull at times. However, the soundtrack is excellent, and the film's middle section is particularly well-done.

An honest view from a good fan of Nolan's work ; The protagonist is definitely worth a movie, the story is very interesting, the cast is first class but I sincerely think that the movie is overdone ...
